story:
Why us?

We both moved to St. Louis in 2013. We are both designers and passionate about sharing the narrative of our adopted city.

 

How will this work?

We have developed cameras that capture a picture when our heart rate reaches a certain threshold. We will use these cameras to document our experiences as we visit the neighborhoods of St. Louis. The cameras will produce a visual journal of our experiences allowing us to catalog the stories of the people, places and things we encounter; all triggered by our heart rate. These pictures will be able to be explored by neighborhood on an interactive website.

Why Saint Louis (STL)?

In 2014 we saw our city split, divided over racial tension that manifested in the shooting of Michael Brown and subsequent protests. [1] Recently, protesters gathered again to rally against the injustices they saw in the case involving Jason Stockley and Anthony Lamar Smith.

These racially charged incidents have kept St Louis in the media spotlight, but over the last few years St. Louis has been quietly evolving under a shroud of negative press. Our communities have worked hard to find answers, begin to fix problems, and move forward in a productive direction. [2]

While changes are underway, we believe that our city’s progress cannot solely rely on changes in  public policies. Each one of us is responsible for change through our actions and our attitudes. We can advance our community to be open, fair and trusting, and we see the faces of change in the people we encounter everyday. We want to share the people and places that make St. Louis the city we love, the city we call home, and the city we are proud to help build together.

Our hope is that at the end of the experiment, in all that we see, we prove that there is more good than bad, more positive than negative, and that all St. Louisans are more alike than different.

[1] https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2014/08/13/...
[2] http://news.stlpublicradio.org/post/what-s-chan...

 

Where will the money go?

We need your support to build a website that can showcase our project. This will serve as a way to curate the varied and eclectic neighbourhoods of St. Louis, through the images captured through our heart beats.

 

What do we need?

We already have two prototypes of our device- cameras triggered by our heart rate- that we will each wear, as we visit each neighbourhood. We need your support for the following:

  • Design of the website: $1,000
  • Development of the website: $3,000
  • Making additonal prototypes: $3,000
  • Commuting expenses: $200
  • Photography supplies: $300
  • Indigogo and transaction fees: $585

 

Are there other ways to give?

Some of you can't give financially, but you can still help:

  • Ask folks to spread the word and make some noise about The Heart of St. Louis. Share our story on Facebook, your blog or anywhere, really…
  • Use the comment section and let us know how else you would use this device and this technology in your life

 

Is there a stretch goal?

If we hit our goal, and exceed it, we will do the following:

  • Make the site interactive, where you can explore our experience through the photos we capture, based on a dynamic map of the city. As additional feature, we would like to add in a social aspect, where we can create a forum for additional dialogue.
  • Make more prototypes and give them to other people so they can capture St. Louis through their heartbeat.
  • Eventually, we want to have an official exhibit of our photographs in downtown St. Louis, to create awareness of our issue.
     

What happens if we don’t reach the goal?

We will share the photos shared on a static website and instagram account, but will be disappointed to not be able to share this with the rest of the world in an engaging fashion!

However, we are working on a wearable device for children with communication challenges, that leverages our technology. Get in touch with us if you are interested!

 

How does technology work?

Our cameras are outfitted with optical heart rate sensors. The sensors track the user’s heart rate in beats per minute and when a predetermined threshold is achieved, the camera is triggered to capture a photo. The thresholds are set based on the user’s resting heart rate.

Who holds the patent?

Kristin is the inventor of the technology behind the project, and has been granted patent for this work; US PAT 9270877. We have imagined a million applications for this technology, this is just one curious way we’d like to test it out. If you’re interested in staying up to date on our development, visit our webpage and register with us! www.heartofstlouis.com

 

Previous campaigns

Neeti ran a successful campaign previously at Project ListenUp, here.

story:
Summary

  • Be it book arts, ceramics, drawing, experimental animation, illustration, painting, photography, and sculpture, there is a wide spectrum of artistic mediums that will be proudly displayed in the forthcoming exhibition.
  • Extropy: The UCF Biannual BFA Exhibition will showcase the pieces these 54 students have worked hard for, and with your donations, some of the funds will go towards the distribution of catalogs displaying our works.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Within our goal of $2,400, most of the funding will go towards the creation and printing of the catalogs which will be distributed opening night.

story:
We are The Ark Car

The Ark Car is an interactive and mobile community art project that can act as both a stationary or roving art piece. The Ark is being built on a GMC 2001 3500 flatbed truck which is completely self-contained and modular. When complete, the Ark Car will feature a 10,000 watt sound system with DJ equipment, a dance platform that can hold over 50 humans or animals, 100 independently programmed Nanoleaf panels projecting waves of light around the Ark, a plounge and a pizza kitchen!

 

 

Where is my money going?

Our total budget for The Ark Car is $40,000. We have already built the steel support structure, sheet-metal hull panels and deck flooring. The major construction is finished and the Ark is now operational. With one festival already in the books, HyperBorea (Ontario's Regional Burning Man festival), we know what upgrades and additions are needed to complete the transformation from the Rusty Bucket to the mythical Ark we are envisioning. 

Your help will go towards these costs:

  • 10,000 watts of bone-shaking booty boppin bass
  • 100 independently-controlled & programmable Nanoleaf LED lighting panels 
  • Materials for 'the hut' and deck shade covering
  • Fog machines for ground FX
  • Unicorn ship figurehead
  • A ship's wheel
  • Fuel expenses for attending festivals and events in Canada and North America

 

 

Why We Built The Ark

We draw inspiration from the mythological Ark that saved humanity from the destructive force of nature. Our Ark sails towards fulfilling a similar ideal - a lifeship that nourishes creativity and propels our community forward. As part of Toronto's growing Art Car community, we envision the Ark as a platform for artistic expression and we've poured our blood, sweat, and tears into this vessel to make it happen. Now it's up to you to help us carry our vision forward into the future. 

 

The Team

The Ark Car Team is comprised of artists, builders, and GSD burners. Our core construction team leads are David Fradkin, Matthew Languay, and Jonathan Stein. David Fradkin designed and built Kaleidoscopic (2015) which appeared at Burning Man and Nuit Blanche Toronto before being sold at the Autumnal Ball Auction in support of the Black Rock Arts Foundation. Matthew Languay built and owns Basecamp Climbing gym and brings a wealth of carpentry project management knowledge. Jonathan Stein is a founding member of Heavy Meta (2017), a Toronto-based fire-breathing dragon art car and a long time event planner and promoter.

Awesome Campaign Perks

  • $3000 - Grand Admiral Of The GTA
    • O Captain, My Captain! The Ark will sail to a location of your choice and regal your friends with tales of your legendary feats at sea while throwing an epic dance party in your honour. This perk can be redeemed for anywhere within 200km of the GTA.
  • $750 - Captain For A Day
    • You can be Captain-For-A-Day at any festival where the Ark is attending. We sail anywhere you want and you get to pick your favourite Ark DJ's to play. A ridiculously large bottle of champagne and pizza for you and your crew are included.
  • $500 - Patron of The Ark
    • Get a hand-painted and framed watercolour painting of the Ark + all items in tiers below this one
  • $250 - First Mate
    • Play a DJ set at a festival or event of your choice where the Ark is in attendance.  
  • $100 - Quarter Master
    • Inside the plounge we will place a CNC cut signature board with the names of all donors at this level and above. Send us a digital file of your signature and we will use a CNC cutter to replicate it. Be remembered eternally for your help in building the Ark.
  • $75 - Sailing Master
    • Become an Officer of the Ark and receive an official title and custom-made insignia displaying your rank.
  • $65 - Gunner
    • Join us at a secret location in summer 2018 for an exclusive day party, BBQ, and photoshoot on the Ark with a professional photographer.
  • $55 - Boatswain
    • Get a 100% cotton tee with something naughty silk-screened on it.
  • $25 - Powder monkey
    • Get an Ark Car patch. Cool!
  • $15 - Crew Member
    • An Ark Car sticker + high five + a shoutout to you personally at our next event to say thank YOU!
  • $5 - You Did Your Best! 
    • Our eternal and undying love.

Get Involved With The Ark Car

The Ark Car needs your help to spread this campaign far and wide across The Seven Seas. Use the Indiegogo share buttons at the top of this page to invite your friends to join the campaign.

All Aboard!

❤️

The Ark Car Crew

 Matthew, J. Stein, David, Aaron, Zohar, Ramin, Alex & Eric

story:
The Vision

Tofino is a fast-growing resort community, situated in Tla-o-qui-aht First Nations territory, on the wild west coast of Vancouver Island, BC.  Every year thousands of visitors come to experience the super-natural beauty of this place.

As artists living and working here, we find there are limited options for exhibiting our work and connecting directly with these visitors. 

Our vision is a creative space where artists and collectors can connect, and have an authentic art experience.   We believe this will raise the arts and cultural profile of our beloved region, and encourage self-sustainability for local artists.

Your contribution will help us to bring this vision to life.

What We Need & What You Get

We have been offered a sub-lease on an ideal space, at Industrial Way - a short walk or drive from the heart of 'downtown' Tofino.  Local sculptor and jeweller Jim Schwartz has been using the space as his studio for years.  Now with a juice bar, coffee company and artisan bakery all joining the local brewery bar and other niche food outlets, Industrial Way is one of the fastest-growing new areas of town.  We will need your help to upgrade the space to show and sell the art we will be making there.

We are asking your support to cover some of our start-up costs (based on approx costs/ estimate quotes):

$5000 - Temporary Walls (all materials & construction, including taping & painting)

$2000 - Office Equipment (Laptop, iPad, Telephone, Printer/copier)

$1800 - Track Lighting, Hanging System & Sound System

$2800 - Lease of the space (Deposit + First Month)

$1100 - Security System (Installation + First Month)

$1000 - Insurance

$800 - Licenses, Permits & Memberships (incl: Business, Signage, Chamber of Commerce)

$300 - Advertising (paid ad in summer issue of Preview: Gallery Guide; otherwise utilizing free)

$200 - Point of Sale (POS) System & Internet/Phone deposits

$200 - Furniture (basic office + two cedar benches)

$150 - Website + hosting (3 year term)

= $15,350 approximate Start Up Costs

(If you are able to donate any of these items directly, please contact Andrea Fergusson 250.551.5425 or andreafergusson@gmail.com)

***

You can choose to support our creative vision, by directly donating to this campaign (hit the pink 'Back It' button), or by selecting any of the variety of original art we are offering here.  We deeply appreciate your contribution. 

We have secured a $5000 loan from Community Futures; another $10,000 will cover basic start-up costs.  However, if we are able to raise more than this, we can add a wider variety of workshops with a higher calibre of professional artists, make plans for an Arts & Cultural Festival, and be of greater support in our partnering with local non-profit organizations.

If, for some reason, we do not reach our funding goal, we will scale our plans down to accommodate whatever amount we are able to reach.   We can be resourceful, and we will make it work.  However, we truly believe in the power of our vision, and eagerly anticipate the means to make it a reality. 

The Team & The Impact

Andrea Fergusson came to Tofino almost six years ago, and has lived in Opitsaht (Tla-o-qui-aht village on Meares Island) for the last two.  She has a life-long personal practice making art, as well as experience starting artist groups, working in art galleries, and operating businesses.  An oil painter most often, she also loves drawing, watercolour and pen & ink. As mama to 3 boys, with new baby on the way, she is creating an art haven for herself and fellow artists.

Deanna Lankin is an ocean lover and oil painter, and has exhibited her work in Vancouver and all over Vancouver Island, including two solo exhibitions.  Most recently she exhibited her works at the prestigious Wickaninnish Inn in Tofino.  After completing the Studio Practice and Art Specialist Program at Bealart Institute in Ontario, she was naturally drawn to the West Coast of Canada.  She has since been living in Tofino, British Columbia, where she has been painting professionally since 2005.  www.deannalankin.com

Jim Schwartz moved to Tofino in 1976 looking to build his dream studio and live a life close to the ocean. Originally from California, Jim came to Canada to study at the Montreal Museum School of fine art. After a few years Jim came west. It was then that Jim began to carve local types of stone and was awarded with a Canada Council Bursary for this work. When Jim moved to Tofino his attentions turned to metallurgy, welding and structural design. Through the 90’s Jim spent a lot of time in Italy studying marble carving and sculpture techniques. Jim has graciously sub-leased his studio at Industrial Way to provide space for Experiential.

As this vision grows we continue to attract artists who wish to work with us.  Experiential is already a synergistic collaboration between local artists and the wider community.

Risks & Challenges

Selling art is an emotionally-driven business.  Traditional, commercial galleries are being replaced by artist-run galleries, artist studios and online art sales.  Education is part of the experience we can offer, for artists and collectors, and contributes to a richer understanding and appreciation for art in our world.

As artists on a journey towards self-sustainability, we have learned to avoid the pitfalls of 'trying to sell art' by simply allowing authentic conversations.  It is this experiential factor which adds that intangible magic to a piece of art. 

Art is not an object, but a doorway.  As artists we are dependable guides.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, you could still help us out by spreading the word about this project and sharing the link to this crowdfunding campaign!

If you're not already on our email list, CLICK HERE.

Thank you from our hearts and souls for your contribution to this project.  We are excited to keep you updated on our progress, and hope you can visit us once we open and feel the 'Experiential' nature of art in our creative space.

story:
La version française en bas de page (French version below)

I am an artist passionate about the contemporary art world, my journey into exile led me to settle in Montreal in 1991. It is with pleasure that I would like to share with you my experience as a professional artist. My dynamic personality is molded by the diversity and richness of my international experience.

For more than 15 years, I’ve been involved in the cultural field, and throughout my career as an artist. I’ve participated in numerous exhibitions in Montreal and internationally, including several exhibitions for the Rally Expo de Vues. d’Afrique. I have presented several conferences in school, community and cultural environments and I participated in consultation and reflection tables on the cultural issues facing Montreal’s diversity.

During my career as an artist, I offered painting and drawing workshops in both official languages to community organizations, refugee shelters and people with disabilities. During these workshops, I was able to see with enthusiasm the therapeutic and liberating role of the practice of art as a palliative for people facing difficulties and major life challenges.

As a professional artist, I have developed an excellent understanding of Montreal’s cultural issues as well as the challenges facing artists in our city in order to be better known on the local, national and international stages. In particular, I have an in-depth knowledge of the realities affecting artists from the Montreal’s diversity, particularly artists from black communities, as well as those of emerging artists. Finally, my last years of artistic practices led me to develop a creativity strongly influenced by the current multidisciplinary artistic practices.

Last but not least, I consider that the authenticity of the artist’s approach and his intellectual duty as a social worker represent the essential driving force behind creation—a duty that sometimes leads him to denounce, question, challenge, provoke, call into question and feed the social fabric of intellectual reflection.

The main message I want to convey through this project is to inspire people and other artists to connect with their inner self. For me that represents the only way to transcend their fears and gain access to a better version of themselves.

What we need and what you get

I have reached the final stages in my production plan. I am now asking all of you: families, friends, professional contacts or anyone else who is passionate about my work and/or artistic approach to get involved in this exciting project.

With your help, I will certainly be able to move forward and take the necessary steps to complete this exhibition. The funds I’m trying to raise will cover:

● The works production cost (frames, frames, materials);

● Logistics costs (room rental, material transportation);

● Promotion costs (public relations, web marketing and graphics)

What you will receive

In return for your participation and your contribution, these are the benefits you will be obtaining:

  • Greeting cards and envelopes
  • Signed Reproductions on paper: Learn more: Click here
  • Signed reproductions on canvas: Learn more: Click here
  • Signed reproductions on metal: Learn more: Click here
  • A reproduction on acrylic
  • Original framed watercolours
  • Prints on metal
  • Mixed-media original works
  • Large-format original works

The impact

I warmly invite you to be part of my new project!

As a professional artist, I have developed an excellent understanding of Montreal’s cultural issues as well as the challenges facing artists in our city in order to be better known on the local, national and international stages. In particular, I have an in-depth knowledge of the realities affecting artists from the Montreal diversity, particularly artists from black communities, as well as those of emerging artists.

At this point in my career and through my years of artistic practice my creative process is strongly tinged with the meaning of the message. I am increasingly working towards integrating an intellectual and social dimension in my creative process, in response to some of the current societal issues. My objective is to create in order to denounce, to question, to challenge, to provoke, to call into question and to nourish the social fabric of the reflection in multiple fields. The theme of the exhibition planned for October is “Art to Recreate” which highlights the resilience of beings and their ability to shape and change; a theme of hope and optimism for change.

Risks and challenges

Producing this exhibition represents a big challenge, I have already invested in it and covered registration and production costs to ensure the project is of high quality. One of the challenges that I will face is timing regarding the coordination of the exhibition and the estimated delivery dates. I want you to know that my team and I will make sure that each reward is delivered on time. I will keep you informed throughout the rewards delivery process!

Other ways to help

For those who cannot make a monetary contribution and wish to get involved, simply share this page with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, and any other social media platform!

I want to thank in advance all my supporters who have been following me for these many years and who have always encouraged me to do what I love and be who I am. Thanks to your support and contribution towards this campaign, we will make this exhibition a success!

 

Version francaise

Artiste passionnée par le milieu de l’art contemporain, je me suis établie à Montréal en 1991 après un parcours marqué par d’exil. Dotée d'une personnalité dynamique, diversifiée et riche en expérience internationale, c'est avec plaisir que j'aimerai partager avec vous mon expérience d’artiste professionnelle.

Depuis plus de 15 ans, j’évolue dans le domaine culturel, et tout au long de ma carrière d’artiste, j’ai réalisé de nombreuses expositions à Montréal et à l'international, parmi lesquels plusieurs exposition pour le Rallye expo de Vues d’Afrique. J'ai présenté plusieurs conférences dans les milieux scolaires, communautaires et culturels et j'ai participé à des tables de réflexion et de concertation liées aux enjeux culturels de la diversité à Montréal.

Durant mon parcours d’artiste, j’ai offert des ateliers de peinture et de dessin dans les deux langues officielles auprès d'organismes communautaires, de centres d'accueil pour réfugiés et de personnes handicapées. J’ai pu lors de ces ateliers, constater avec enthousiasme le rôle thérapeutique et libérateur de la pratique de l’art comme palliatif pour des personnes faisant face à des difficultés et des épreuves de vie majeures.

En tant qu'artiste professionnelle, j'ai développé une excellente compréhension des enjeux culturels montréalais ainsi que les défis que doivent surmonter les artistes de notre ville afin de mieux rayonner sur le plan local, national et international. Plus particulièrement, j'ai une connaissance approfondie des réalités qui touchent les artistes de la diversité montréalaise et plus particulièrement les artistes issues des communautés noires, de même que ceux de la relève artistique. Finalement, mes derrières années de pratiques artistiques m'ont amené à développer une créativité fortement teintée par la multidisciplinarité artistique des pratiques artistiques actuelles.

En dernier lieu, je considère que le moteur essentiel de la création repose l'authenticité de la démarche de l'artiste et son devoir intellectuel d'intervenant social - devoir qui parfois l'amène à dénoncer, interroger, interpeller, provoquer, remettre en question et alimenter le tissu social de la réflexion intellectuelle.

Le message principal du projet que je souhaite réaliser est d’inspirer les gens et les autres artistes à se connecter avec leur soi profond dans le but de transcender leurs peurs et d’accéder ainsi à une meilleure version d’eux-mêmes.

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Maintenant que je finalise la préparation de mon plan de production, je vous sollicite tous, familles, amis, contacts professionnels ou tout autre personne passionnée par mes oeuvres et/ou démarche artistique à vous impliquer dans ce projet passionnant.

Avec votre aide, je pourrai assurément aller de l'avant et franchir les étapes nécessaires à la réalisation de cette exposition. Les fonds que je tente d'obtenir permettront de couvrir:

  • Le coût de production des oeuvres (cadres, chassis, matériaux);
  • Les coûts logistiques (location de la salle, transport matériel);
  • Les coûts de promotion (relations publiques, marketing Web et graphisme)

Ce que vous recevrez

En retour de votre participation et de votre contribution, vous pourrez obtenir ces avantages

Des cartes de vœux et enveloppes

Des reproductions signées sur papier

Cliquez ici pour avoir un aperçu des : Reproductions sur papier

Des reproductions signées sur métal

Cliquez ici pour avoir un aperçu des: Reproductions sur métal

Des reproductions signées sur toile

Cliquez ici pour avoir un aperçu des: Reproductions sur toile

Des aquarelles originales encadrées

Cliquez ici pour avoir un aperçu des: Aquarelles

Des dessins originaux encadrés

Cliquez ici pour avoir un aperçu des: Dessins originaux

Des oeuvres originales-Mixed media

Cliquez ici pour avoir un aperçu des: Oeuvres originales

Des oeuvres originales grand format

Cliquez ici pour avoir un aperçu des: Oeuvres grand format

 

L'impact

Je vous invite chaleureusement à faire partie de mon nouveau projet!

En tant qu'artiste professionnelle, j'ai développé une excellente compréhension des enjeux culturels montréalais ainsi que les défis que doivent surmonter les artistes de notre ville afin de mieux rayonner sur le plan local, national et international. Plus particulièrement, j'ai une connaissance approfondie des réalités qui touchent les artistes de la diversité montréalaise et plus particulièrement les artistes issues des communautés noires, de même que ceux de la relève artistique.

À ce stade-ci de ma carrière et grâce à mes années de pratiques artistiques mon processus créateur est fortement teinté du sens du message. Je souhaite de plus en plus pouvoir intégrer une dimension intellectuelle et sociale dans mon processus créateur et créer pour dénoncer, interroger, interpeller, provoquer, remettre en question et alimenter le tissu social de la réflexion dans de multiples domaines, en lien avec les enjeux sociétaux actuels. En lieu avec l’exposition prévu en Novembre, le thème L’Art de se recréer souligne la résilience des êtres et leur capacité à modeler et changer ; un thème porteur d’espoir et d’optimisme de changement.

Risques et défis

Produire cette exposition est un grand défi, j’y ai déjà investi et confronté les frais d'enregistrement et de production pour assurer que ce projet soit de grande qualité. L'un des défis auxquels je serai confrontés est le timing concernant la coordination de l’exposition et les dates de livraison estimées. Je veux que vous sachiez que mon équipe et moi nous nous assurerons que chaque récompense sera remise en temps et en heure. Je vous tiendrai informé tout au long du processus des updates concernant la livraison des récompenses!

Autres façons d'aider

Pour ceux qui ne peuvent pas faire une contribution monétaire et souhaitent s'impliquer autrement, il vous suffit de partager cette page avec vos amis sur Facebook, Twitter, et toutes autres plateformes de médias sociaux!

Je tiens à remercier d'avance tous mes supporters qui me suivent depuis ces nombreuses années et qui m'ont toujours encouragé à faire ce que je suis. Grâce à votre soutien et votre contribution à cette campagne de sociofinancement, nous ferons de cette exposition un franc succès!

story:
We are currently community building as well as crowdfunding for Personaland. We invite you to become a citizen of this new, exciting online destination for the arts. Your participation will help us activate Personaland activities, build a platform for artists and performers to showcase their work, increase the number of Persona hosts and enhance our communications network. We are hoping to raise $25,000 with this campaign to get Personaland launched. Raising a little less, we might not be able to offer as much initially, however, if we raise extra, we’ll offer more stimulating experiences sooner! 

 

OUR GOAL

As artists, we sincerely wanted to do something positive and uplifting with our skills, so we utilized 21st Century tools to create a web-based sanctuary for the arts, its makers and appreciators. We invite citizen artists of all media to showcase their talents in a supportive, respectful manner. Our challenge was to make Personaland intuitive and easy-to-navigate so that all users can feel at home in this digital environment.

 

WHAT MAKES PERSONLAND DIFFERENT from current online galleries and video sites

Personaland will present artistic content in a dynamic, 3D way. Gallery visitors and performance audiences will have an experience of being there instead of just clicking on a screen. 

Here is what makes Personaland a special online destination for the arts:

While you attend the exhibition, screening or performance you can:

• Watch a video and read the artist's commentary 

• Connect with the artist and join their network

• Purchase the artwork, CD or DVD

• Option to donate a small amount to the artist. 

• You can choose to receive postings before each exhibition, performance, screening

• Additionally, Personas will be rambling throughout the Personaland environment dispensing gifts to make your journey there one of delight and surprise.

 

THE PERSONA STORY

What makes Personaland different than any other online site is that it is hosted by the Personas— peaceful, shamanic representatives from another dimension who wish to interact with you in entertaining and generous ways.

 

THE CREW

Personaland has a crew of talented artists committed to designing a destination which is entertaining and easy to use. We are fortunate that our make-up is diverse in gender, age, background and culture.

 

Stewart Wilson– Visionary artist and project manager. Stewart is the Personaman! He has been working with the Personas for almost 40 years and has created over 31,000 Personas and made thousands of paintings, drawings, photographs, prints and tableaus about them. Stewart also has extensive experience in arts administration, having co-founded and been Executive Director of Public Image Gallery, NYC from 1981-84 and Artwell Gallery, in northwest CT, from 1995-2011. His experience as a public and private school educator has further broadened his organizational and communication skills.

Kendall Noble– Talented digital artist and animator. Kendall has worked professionally for years in the game industry.

Andy Keplinger– Chief programmer. Andy runs his own game company and has broad digital skills.

Caitlin Mack– Social media specialist. Caitlin has extensive business experience.

Michael Johnson– Sound and music designer. Michal is a professional musician, record producer and sound designer. Graduate of the Berklee School of Music.

Marjorie Wang– Game designer with expertise in virtual reality. Marjorie is a graduate of 
NYU – Shanghai.

Baaria Ahmad Chaudhary–VR programmer. Baaria is a graduate of NYU – Shanghai.

Linda Donald– Our Lady of Perpetual Mirth . Linda is an actress who occasionally writes.

Plus dozens of other professionals, like Kat Sullivan, NYU motion capture specialist, who have donated many hours of individualized expertise to this noble cause.

 

THE REWARDS

All Level Contributors will receive:

• Immense satisfaction from being a founding member and an inhabitant 
of a unique, online, global village for the arts.

• Weekly announcements about Personaland opportunities and events 
through email and social media feeds.

• A personalized creative acknowledgement of thanks from Personaland.

Honored Guest Level ($50) and higher levels will also receive:

• A selfie with one of the Personas or an Space Alien when you send in your photograph.

• The opportunity for your artwork, performance or media to be 
considered as a showcase artist.

Citizen Level ($100) and higher levels will also receive:

• The opportunity to be represented as a Personaland flower in the Fountain gardens. 

• The opportunity to receive a special limited edition signed Persona print by Stewart Wilson 

• Special invitations to art openings, film premieres, performances and happenings.

• A personal, artist-signed New Year’s card sent to your mailbox.

First Citizen Level ($250) and higher levels will also receive:

• A Valentine’s Day card.

• An Space Alien Joy Ride

Friend Level ($500) and higher levels will also receive:

• A personalized birthday card.

• A Space Alien Joy Ride and Zeppelin Cruise.

Patron Level ($1000) and higher will also receive:

• An original, hand-signed Persona drawing.

Ambassador, Builder and Angel Levels ($2,500 to $10,000) and higher levels will also receive:

• 50"X60" woven Persona tapestry

• More drawings, Alien Joy Rides, Zeppelin Cruises and special gifts

Please Join Us. Your Adventure Awaits!

story:
Meh, You'll Do Candy HeART Car, You'll Do...

A sparkly candy heart with a disco soul, floating on a cloud over the dusty playa as a vehicle of love to deliver hope and fun to dusty burners all over Black Rock City.

In 2017, the Candy HeART car crew helped lonely burners find love, or at least an almost perfect playa date, with the popular So So Cupid dating service.

In 2018, we are mixing it up and will be bringing the Meh Dating Games (premiered this year at UnScruz Santa Cruz's regional event and at SF Precompression) to the playa for a more fun and interactive way to find love... or at least a few laughs and a raunchy good time!

We want to make sure people find love and feel loved on playa, so we will also be looking into helping the mobility challenged see the amazing art from our comfy love seat pulled by our sweet little Candy HeART Car.   

You'll do......almost!

DMV graciously approved our application to come back to the playa... with conditions.  There are a few repairs and upgrades that need to be made to get our sweet little Candy HeART Car and love seat trailer ready for the playa this year. 

We'd like to raise $4000 of those pretty green bills to help with the following repairs and improvements:

  • New tires, new axle or potentially new trailer for our love seat (the trailer has seen better days) Costs: $200-$600
  • Gas, transportation, and storage for art car/utility trailer and new tires and lights for utility trailer )used to transport art car and love seat to BRC) Cost: $1850
  • Improved safety barrier between the HeART car and trailer (we were told to DO BETTER!). Costs: $200-$500
  • Secure and stabilize the HeART frame to ensure we LNT!! (no loose screws or disco balls this year). Cost: $300 (shop rental/assistance)
  • Lights, lights and more lights!!  We want you to find us on playa....day AND night! $500
  • Dating Game stage equipment to make us mobile Costs: $250

We've got a HEART on for this project and we want to share it with you...check out the amazing perks we have for you to show us your love!

story:
What We Need & What You Get

Donations will fund three main arms of our project: production, transportation, and distribution.

  1. Sauce production
    • Perhaps the most important of our arms, this includes purchase of both pre-made sauces and ingredients for homemade sauces, sauce containers, time in a commercial kitchen so we can make sure our sauces are safe to consume, and a food permit from the Nevada Division of Public Health.
  2. Sauce Transportation
    • Also one of the most important arms, this includes purchase of a well insulated cooler, enough ice to keep the sauces cold, and a small portion of the cost of a truck rental to drive the sauces from Seattle to Black Rock City safely. We thought about renting a fleet of unicorn space pirate ninjas to defend against sauce bandits, but that proved too costly.
  3. Sauce Distribution
    • Arguably the actual most important arm, this includes materials for construction of a Sauce Consultation Booth (for offering sauce-based advice for bored mouths and boring souls), outfitting of a super-cool Saucecycle (for long distance sauce outings), and acquisition of Saucoliers (for single-serving sauce delivery on foot). 

As thanks for contributing to our project, you will not only be saving dusty humans from spiceless foods (and getting VIP access to the Sauce Consultation Booth), but we also offer a number of excellent sauce-based perks! In addition to owning a limited edition Dope Sauce sticker, you can also get a sample pack of 5 of our homemade sauces! If that's not enough sauce for you and you're looking for glory, let us help you design your very own sauce! You get a full bottle just to yourself as well as recognition whenever we use your sauce to add pizazz to someone's food and soul. Lastly, if, in addition to lacking sauce in your own life, you notice a distinct lack of sauce among your friends, let us bring our sauces to your party! Celebrate your transition to a new, saucier life with 19 of your closest on-playa friends. Because why be bland when you could...just...not?

In the event that we do not reach our goal, we will still bring sauces to BRC, but they will be fewer in number and will not travel as far from camp. With fewer dusty humans rid of their bland mouths, we expect the relative level of dopeness of Burning Man to decrease and that would be sad.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge we face is the one faced by us all: picking the best sauce for each occasion. While this of course comes with the risk of accidental mis-saucing, we believe in happy accidents and you should too.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our campaign among your weirdest friends, and stop by for our Sauce Consultation Services on playa! Guaranteed* to result in more a more zesty life.

*Only when used as directed. The Saucey Dopes make no claims for unlicensed sauce application, though we do encourage it.

story:
Short Summary

  • I'm an artist, energy healer, and psychic adviser.  My goal is to empower people to transform their lives through my work.
  • This campaign is to raise money for the first printing of the Totem Animal Collectible Cards: Aquatic Series.
  • Getting these cards printed, will allow you and others to have a printed version of my totem animals (which includes the animals symbolism); that is small enough to take with you, as a reminder.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need $240 to print and ship 49 sets of the 12 Aquatic Series cards to me. $210 is my salary for designing the cards.  The remainder will go towards campaign fees.
  • Guppys will receive the collectible card of your choice.  Tuna will receive the entire set of 12 cards for the Totem Animal Collectible Cards: Aquatic Series. Whales will receive a dozen sets of 12 cards for the Totem Animal Collectible Cards: Aquatic Series  All perks include a 1 inch Love & Gratitude Change the World sticker, as a thank you.
  • Even if I don't reach the full goal, I will print as many sets as I can with the funds that are raised.  If I go beyond the goal, I will use the extra funds to print more sets to have on hand to sell through my business.

The Impact

  • The Totem Animal Collectible Cards give people something to carry around with them to honor their totem animal, as well as to have a reminder of the energies they are wanting to access to help them transform their lives.
  • People working to better their individual lives, benefits everyone they come in contact with and assists them in creating change in the world.

Risks & Challenges

To fulfill the perks for individual cards, I need to order a complete set.  Images that are more popular than others could cause me to need to order more sets and have an overstock of cards with the less popular images.  I will order what is necessary to fulfill the perks, and I'll sell the overstock through my business.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to back the campaign, please support it by sharing it on social media.

Thank you!

story:
Hey! My name is Paul Anagnostopoulos and I am an artist who is usually bouncing around the world but currently based in Brooklyn. I graduated from NYU with a BFA in 2013 and then interned for several months at the Peggy Guggenheim Collection in Venice, Italy. Since then I have participated in numerous residencies and exhibitions in California, Mexico, NYC, and Iceland to name a few. 


This past year has been my busiest so far:

  • The SÍM Residency in Reykjavík, Iceland and corresponding exhibition Gefa & Taka, Give & Take
  • The Wassaic Artist Residency at the Wassaic Project in Upstate NY and exhibition in The Maxon Mills Gallery
  • TheAIAR in Guanajuato, Mexico and corresponding exhibition Wrestling Demons
  • Currently participating in Brooklyn Art Space and Trestle Gallery's Open Studio Residency in Gowanus, BK
2016 has been a whirlwind of creation and growth, and I won't be slowing down anytime soon.

I am very excited for my next opportunity to attend the Vermont Studio Center this upcoming October. During these crucial 4 weeks, I'll be able to completely dive into my studio practice. I will be afforded the chance to experiment and challenge my current process; expand my skill set; work with new, high caliber artists. All and all this is a critical opportunity to grow.

With your help, I will be able to head north and participate in this prestigious residency. I received an artist grant for partial funding and need a bit of help with the rest of the tuition/travel/supplies. In exchange, you'll receive SWAG. I'll be sending out stickers, linocut prints, riso prints, and even new original drawings and paintings! You can also contact me to purchase existing works or commissions through my site. Now's your chance to get a hand on a Lego man or some wrestling babes.

Thank you all for your generosity and love- really looking forward to sharing my future projects!


Water Sports at Flowery Island, 2015 Riso Print


Anthemoessa, 2015 Riso Print


Orpheus and the Foam, 2015 Riso Print


6411 Sand Dollar Cafe (Tangerine Speedo), 2015, oil on canvas. From the 2015 series Boys of Paradisa.


Kratíste (Hold), 2016, acrylic and oil on wood. From the 2016 series Pankration.


Installation View from Gefa & Taka, Give & Take at the SÍM Gallery in Reykjavík, Iceland.


Installation View from the Maxon Mills Gallery at the Wassaic Project in Hudson Valley, NY.


Installation View from Wrestling Demons at Centro Bharati in Guanajuato, Mexico. 

Installation View from Wrestling Demons of the linocut prints available.

story:
OUR MEDDLING MISSION


Help us bring to life Maria Sibylla Merian entomological observations and paintings from the 1700’s as we replicate her original work as sculpture using real specimens.


  

PROJECT SUMMARY


Considered the First Lady of Naturalism from the 1700's, Maria Sibylla Merian is the perfect example of how closely science and art intertwine.  

By supporting this project, you will help Meddling with Nature  take Maria's original early 18th century seminal work on entomology and metamorphosis in Suriname off the page. We will recreate her water color illustrations as sculpture using real insect, animal, and botanical specimens in an exhibition opening at the Lloyd Library & Museum in Cincinnati in July of 2016. 

This will be an exhibit that allows viewers to "see what she saw" and also begin to understand the challenges of documenting nature through illustration. We will present various live specimens, both plant and insect Maria was in contact with along side a wealth of descriptions relating to her work, her life, her challenges, and the state science in the early 18th century. The original books will also be present and opened to key illustrations for everyone to inspect. 

In addition to replicating Merian's work we plan to include workshops on entomology and plant preservation throughout the exhibit that will follow our ‘see with your own eyes, touch with your own hands’ approach, offering participants the opportunity to utilize the vast treasure trove of experience Maria has made available to us and create their own artistic works inspired by the natural world and Maria. 

    

By making preservation techniques accessible to the public, we hope to inspire participants to study and document the natural world through direct contact while educating the community on the life of such a remarkable woman during a time in which it was extraordinarily difficult for women to gain a foothold in the sciences. 

 Who was Maria Sibylla Merian?

Maria documented the life cycles of insects in a way that had never been done. Each painting demonstrates the vibrant and active life-cycles of her specimens in their natural habitat. She was a brilliant artist and naturalist whose passion and curiosity predates Darwin by a century and is still admirable today.  We take great honor in this opportunity to work so closely with her texts and to bring her work back 'Off The Page'.   Check out our website to find out more about the First Lady of Naturalism and be sure to check out the definitive biography Chrysalis by author Kim Todd, who has been generously helping us unwrap some of the mysteries and adventures that surround Maria.  


Why trust Meddling with Nature?

For ten years, Meddling with Nature has been hard at work advancing the Naturalist Philosophy espoused by explorers and scientists for hundreds of years with workshops on medical illustrations, dissections, medical history, taxidermy, and of course entomology. Meddling with Nature works exclusively with natural cause specimens, giving new meaning to life and death. 

Curious about what we have done in the past? This sweet little video should serve as a good introduction to our meddling crew. 

THE IMPACT - 'OFF THE PAGE'


Exposure. Allowing the original paintings “out of the stacks” to be observed by the public allows for her work to live on through a modern audience and fulfills the mandate that Libraries have to both preserve rare books and keep them relevant to the present.

Awareness. By introducing viewers to this work we hope to inspire a new generation of Naturalists. Through the workshops we will train participants to work within a naturalist philosophy both responsibly and creatively.

Collaboration. This work brings together a large number of arts, sciences, and governmental institutions. This paves the way for additional collaboration in the future. The bonds made here will bear fruit for decades to come.

Innovation. This is also a project that has not been done before. Recreating illustrations as sculpture in this manner may become a preferred method for future exhibits by other institutions. We are paving the way using a new method to look at scientific illustration. Audubon next?

Community. We will be utilizing the services of other local artists in the completion of these works from glass blowing to print making. Support for this project puts Cincinnati artists to work! 

Conservation. We are also working with local gardeners and providing sapplings and seeds to those who might like to attract a few butterflies to their own landscape. With the help of entomologists and botanists in Cincinnati we hope to further educate the public about what conservation means and how each individual can take matters into their own hands. 



The little moth and lizard in the middle don't match these particular plates but the actual plate specimens have been identified and are available!  Your support of this indiegogo campaign will make recreating these plates a reality. 


Who works with the likes of us? 

We are not novices to Naturalism. We have been presenting work and education related to this topic for 10 years. This is how we have gained the trust to work with such rare material.  In addition to the Lloyd, we are in league with the Krohn Conservatory, Cincinnati Zoo, Cincinnati Museum Center, and the Art Academy of Cincinnati for this project so far. More to come of course! This to us is a perfect storm of arts and science institutional cooperation.  With your help, we will be able to purchase the specimens and materials to make this work a reality.


FAQs regarding our campaign.


When and where will you be able to experience the results of this campaign?

The Completed works will be on exhibition at the Lloyd Library this summer beginning in July. The sculptures that we create as well as preserved and living specimens will be on display alongside the original watercolors of Maria.

During the run of this show, we will be doing city wide events that have their central focal point directed at the Lloyd. From brown bag lunches at the Cincinnati Zoo and Museum Center to street level demonstrations downtown and other local libraries and communities. Of course all of that depends on how close we can get to our financial goals.

What happens if we don’t reach our financial goal?

The show must go on! We will produce the pieces we can afford. If we fall short, we will need to scale some things back and make some currently planned free events ticketed. Rest assured that contributions you make will critically matter. We are doing this, but we need your help to make this as amazing as what we envision.

What happens if we exceed our financial goal?

Receiving larger than expected funding will allow us to scale the show up. There are several plates that we would love to reproduce as sculpture but require quite a bit more money than what we have allotted currently. An exceeded funding campaign allows us to complete those pieces. We would also be able to increase our outreach program and create a number of events for youth and patrons via summer programs and even school summer programs. 


Now who wouldn't want to see
this plate come to life!  




  PERKS PERKS AND MORE PERKS

Check out some of our amazing perks and help us bring this world to life!

But of course, this wouldn’t be an indigogo campaign without the perks! We added a lot of stuff to choose from and we are not at all opposed to custom perks.
Got an idea? Let’s hear it and make it happen.
We have access to the original plates from the 1700’s, we are already making
hi-fidelity scans of absolutely everything.  We also have a number of perks that are more event based and a few actually let you give positioning your own large insect a try.  Want to come to the exhibit and do a still life watercolour painting in much the same way Maria did her work? We got you covered. Paint and paper included.



Meddling Through The Ages Calendar

Celebrate the first lady of naturalism month after month!  We're finishing up design on our 18 month calendar and I have to say, it's just gorgeous.  Starting July 2016, you can begin using it right away and then frame each month as it passes.  Featuring 18 of our favorite Maria Sibylla Merian images.




Meddling with Merian Deck of Cards

Merian inspired, Meddling made!  Custom designed playing card deck featuring 54 plates appearing in Maria Sibylla Merian Metamorphosis Insectorum Surinamensium first edition (1705).  This standard poker size 54-playing card deck includes 2 jokers.  You'll have over half of the entire book in your hand!




Stick A Pin In It! Notecards

Got some corresponding to do and nothing to do it with? Well this is the perk for you! You'll receive 10 notecards with your favorite Merian plates.



Merian Prints

We're offering two different size print perks!  The '8X10 print' will look lovely absolutely anywhere!  And then our True to Size! canvas print measuring 20 inches tall, is truly a giant treasure!   All prints have been scanned directly from the original elephant folios, Insects of Surinam (1705), housed at the Lloyd Library and Museum in Cincinnati, Ohio. This will be the only time these prints are available at this price. After the show production must stop.  



DIY Mounting Kit

Everything you need to mount your own insect! Including one large relaxed, ready to mount insect and mounting guidebook! Perfect gift for yourself or others! Handcrafted frame or choice of glass domes. We have lots of stuff to choose from, so we will be in touch with you individually to make sure we send you exactly what you are hankering for.



Penchant for Pendants

These handcrafted pendants are made from select specimens from all over the world! Want one specifically from Suriname? Let us know. 



Workshops and Tours

"For the locals" Workshop!
Enjoy a specially programmed workshop that will have you leaving with not only the knowledge of how to position insects, but an incredible piece you create with the help of our amazing crew! We will be using specimens much larger than the stuff you might find in your backyard.

Paint like Merian Night!
Join artist Jeremy Johnson of Meddling with Nature for a night of painting and wine! Hosted at the Lloyd Library and Museum during the Meddling with Merian gallery showing, you'll have both the entire exhibit and the original Merian texts to use as reference.

Lunch & Tour of Lloyd Library!

Receive a private tour and lunch at the Lloyd Library and Museum with Exhibits Curator Anna Heran and Meddling with Nature founder Jeremy Johnson.

All workshops included, our Merian Calendar or the Meddling Merian Deck of Playing Cards perk. Your choice!




Mounts and Displays

Emperor Scorpions and More! - Lovingly hand crafted fresh specimen emperor scorpions and other intriguing little critters all nestled in ginormous glass dome!  Perfect present for the person who has nearly everything... except a diorama.

Harlequin Beetle Mount - Acrocinus Longimanus is one of the more intriguing and ginormous  beetles featured in the work of our heroine. You will receive a Riker mounted male and your choice of frame and background. We can print the original Merian plate should that be your choice! We will be in contact to inquire about how you want this puppy done.

Scorpion Mounted in Small Dome - Sweet little scorpion housed in a lovely small 4 inch diameter dome with custom wood turned base by artist Jeremy Johnson of Meddling with Nature.



Other Ways You Can Help

So, that’s about it. If you made it this far, then you are definitely interested! What if you can’t help financially? Maybe this campaign reminds you of someone, why not use the Indigogo share tools to send the word out!

Getting this message out to the world is certainly like fishing.  

If you can’t be a glorious sea-bass then try being a fisher! And to all you glorious sea-basses out there, why not take up a rod as well!


Thanks so much for giving this a look and again, if you have any questions please don’t hesitate to drop me a line at jeremy@meddlingwithnature.com


Extras!  Just in Case You Want to Keep Reading!

This takes a lot of effort from a lot of people. From 17th century Dutch translation to the nuts and bolts of building accurate dioramas, we have had a lot of expertise on our side from a number of highly respected institutions in the area.

This work requires a lot of specialized passion. I believe very much in organizational collaboration and this show will see all of the Cincinnati heavy hitters come to bat for one of the most important, yet invisible scientists from the 17th century.

However, I have realized a labor of love can only go so far without funding. We have received a lot of support for specimens and research, but now we are at the point in which we actually have to make this stuff! 

This is our first crowd funding attempt. Of course I am nervous about it, but after writing draft after draft for other projects which are now complete (but maybe not exactly as cool as I thought they would be) I am asking for community support. 

I am an independent artist and we are an independent organization; self-funded and self-motivated, but this time we truly need your support. Corners can't be cut and we can’t just do a “good enough” job on this one. Maria is too important, and there are not a lot of artists clamoring to elevate this work. It has to be right the first time.

So here we are, hat in hand. Help make this show road worthy! That’s right, we have intentions of sending this across the country, and even now our bobbers are bobbing.

Considered the First Lady of Naturalism from the 1700's, Maria Sibylla Merian is the perfect example of how closely science and art intertwine.  By supporting this project, you will help Meddling with Nature  take Maria's original early 18th century seminal work on entomology and metamorphosis in Suriname off the page. We will recreate her water color illustrations as sculpture using real insect, animal, and botanical specimens in an exhibition opening at the Lloyd Library & Museum in Cincinnati in July of 2016. This will be an exhibit that allows viewers to "see what she saw" and also begin to understand the challenges of documenting nature through illustration. We will present various live specimens, both plant and insect Maria was in contact with along side a wealth of descriptions relating to her work, her life, her challenges, and the state science in the early 18th century. The original books will also be present and opened to key illustrations for everyone to inspect. In addition to replicating Merian's work we plan to include workshops on entomology and plant preservation throughout the exhibit that will follow our ‘see with your own eyes, touch with your own hands’ approach, offering participants the opportunity to utilize the vast treasure trove of experience Maria has made available to us and create their own artistic works inspired by the natural world and Maria.     By making preservation techniques accessible to the public, we hope to inspire participants to study and document the natural world through direct contact while educating the community on the life of such a remarkable woman during a time in which it was extraordinarily difficult for women to gain a foothold in the sciences. 

 Who was Maria Sibylla Merian?


Maria documented the life cycles of insects in a way that had never been done. Each painting demonstrates the vibrant and active life-cycles of her specimens in their natural habitat. She was a brilliant artist and naturalist whose passion and curiosity predates Darwin by a century and is still admirable today.  We take great honor in this opportunity to work so closely with her texts and to bring her work back 'Off The Page'.   Check out our website to find out more about the First Lady of Naturalism and be sure to check out the definitive biography Chrysalis by author Kim Todd, who has been generously helping us unwrap some of the mysteries and adventures that surround Maria.  








Why trust Meddling with Nature?



For ten years, Meddling with Nature has been hard at work advancing the Naturalist Philosophy espoused by explorers and scientists for hundreds of years with workshops on medical illustrations, dissections, medical history, taxidermy, and of course entomology. Meddling with Nature works exclusively with natural cause specimens, giving new meaning to life and death. 

Curious about what we have done in the past?
This sweet little video should serve as a good introduction to our meddling
crew. 





THE IMPACT - 'OFF THE PAGE'




Exposure. Allowing the original paintings “out of the stacks” to be observed by the
public allows for her work to live on through a modern audience and fulfills
the mandate that Libraries have to both preserve rare books and keep them
relevant to the present.
Awareness. By introducing viewers to this work we hope to inspire a new generation of
Naturalists. Through the workshops we will train participants to work within a
naturalist philosophy both responsibly and creatively. 
Collaboration.
This work brings together a large number of arts, sciences, and governmental
institutions. This paves the way for additional collaboration in the future.
The bonds made here will bear fruit for decades to come.
Innovation. This is also a project that has not been done before. Recreating illustrations
as sculpture in this manner may become a preferred method for future exhibits
by other institutions. We are paving the way using a new method to look at
scientific illustration. Audubon next?

Community. We will be utilizing the services of other local artists in the completion of
these works from glass blowing to print making. Support for this project puts
Cincinnati artists to work! 

Conservation. We are also working with local gardeners and providing sapplings and seeds to those who might like to attract a few butterflies to their own landscape. With the help of entomologists and botanists in Cincinnati we hope to further educate the public about what conservation means and how each individual can take matters into their own hands. 


The little moth and lizard in the middle don't match these particular plates but the actual plate specimens have been identified and are available!  Your support of this indiegogo campaign will make recreating these plates a reality. 


Who works with the likes of us? 
We
are not novices to Naturalism. We have been presenting work and education related to this topic for 10 years. This is how we
have gained the trust to work with such rare material.  In addition to the
Lloyd, we are in league with the Krohn Conservatory, Cincinnati Zoo, Cincinnati
Museum Center, and the Art Academy of Cincinnati for this project so far. More
to come of course! This to us is a perfect storm of arts and science
institutional cooperation.  With your help, we will be able to purchase the specimens and materials to make this work a reality.




FAQs regarding our campaign.

When and where will you be able to experience the results of this campaign?
The Completed works will be on exhibition at the Lloyd Library this summer beginning in July. The sculptures that we create as well as preserved and living specimens will be on display alongside the original watercolors of Maria.
During the run of this show, we will be doing city wide events that have their central focal point directed at the Lloyd. From brown bag lunches at the Cincinnati Zoo and Museum Center to street level demonstrations downtown and other local libraries and communities. Of course all of that depends on how close we can get to our financial goals.

What happens if we
don’t reach our financial goal?
The show must go on! We will produce the pieces we can afford.
If we fall short, we will need to scale some things back and make some
currently planned free events ticketed. Rest assured that contributions you
make will critically matter. We are doing this, but we need your help to make
this as amazing as what we envision. 
What happens if we exceed
our financial goal?
Receiving larger than expected funding will allow us to
scale the show up. There are several plates that we would love to reproduce as
sculpture but require quite a bit more money than what we have allotted currently.
An exceeded funding campaign allows us to complete those pieces. We would also
be able to increase our outreach program and create a number of events for
youth and patrons via summer programs and even school summer programs. 

Now who wouldn't want to see this plate come to life!  



  PERKS PERKS AND MORE PERKS



Check out some of our amazing perks and help us bring this world to life! But of course, this wouldn’t be an indigogo campaign without the perks! 
We added a lot of stuff to choose from and we are not at all opposed to
 custom perks. Got an idea? Let’s hear it and make it happen. We have 
access to the original plates from the 1700’s, we are already making 
hi-fidelity scans of absolutely everything.  We also have a number of 
perks that are more event based and a few actually let you give 
positioning your own large insect a try.  Want to come to the exhibit and
 do a still life watercolour painting in much the same way Maria did her
 work? We got you covered. Paint and paper included.


Meddling Through The Ages Calendar 
Celebrate the first lady of naturalism month after month!  We're 
finishing up design on our 18 month calendar and I have to say, it's 
just gorgeous.  Starting July 2016, you can begin using it right away 
and then frame each month as it passes.  Featuring 18 of our favorite 
Maria Sibylla Merian images.







Meddling with Merian Deck of Cards


Merian inspired, Meddling made!  Custom designed playing card deck featuring 54 plates appearing in Maria Sibylla Merian Metamorphosis Insectorum Surinamensium first edition (1705).  This standard poker size 54-playing card deck includes 2 jokers.  You'll have over half of the entire book in your hand!





Stick A Pin In It! Notecards

Got some corresponding to do and nothing to do it with? Well this is the perk for you! You'll receive 10 notecards with your favorite Merian plates.




Merian Prints

We're offering two different size print perks!  The '8X10 print' will look lovely absolutely anywhere!  And then our True to Size! canvas print measuring 20 inches tall, is truly a giant treasure!   All prints have been scanned directly from the original elephant folios, Insects of Surinam (1705), housed at the Lloyd Library and Museum in Cincinnati, Ohio. This will be the only time these prints are available at this price. After the show production must stop.  






DIY Mounting Kit


Everything you need to mount your own insect!  Including one large relaxed, ready to mount insect and mounting guidebook!  Perfect gift for yourself or others!

Handcrafted frame or choice of glass domes. We have lots of stuff to choose from, so we will be in touch with you individually to make sure we send you exactly what you are hankering for.





Penchant for Pendants

These handcrafted pendants are made from select specimens from all over the world! Want one specifically from Suriname? Let us know. 






Workshops and Tours

"For the locals" Workshop!Enjoy a specially programmed workshop that will have you leaving with not only the knowledge of how to position insects, but an incredible piece you create with the help of our amazing crew! We will be using specimens much larger than the stuff you might find in your backyard. 

Paint like Merian Night!Join artist Jeremy Johnson of Meddling with Nature for a night of painting and wine!  Hosted at the Lloyd Library and Museum during the Meddling with Merian gallery showing, you'll have both the entire exhibit and the original Merian texts to use as reference.


Lunch & Tour of Lloyd Library!Receive a private tour and lunch at the Lloyd Library and Museum with Exhibits Curator Anna Heran and Meddling with Nature founder Jeremy Johnson.


All workshops included, our Merian Calendar or the Meddling Merian Deck of Playing Cards perk.  Your choice!




Mounts and Displays

Emperor Scorpions and More! - Lovingly hand crafted fresh specimen emperor scorpions and other intriguing little critters all nestled in ginormous glass dome!  Perfect present for the person who has nearly everything... except a diorama.


Harlequin Beetle Mount - Acrocinus Longimanus is one of the more intriguing and ginormous  beetles featured in the work of our heroine. You will receive a Riker mounted male and your choice of frame and background. We can print the original Merian plate should that be your choice! We will be in contact to inquire about how you want this puppy done.
Scorpion Mounted in Small Dome - Sweet little scorpion housed in a lovely small 4 inch diameter dome with custom wood turned base by artist Jeremy Johnson of Meddling with Nature.








Other Ways You Can Help
So, that’s about it. If you made it this far, then you are definitely interested! What if you can’t help financially? Maybe this campaign reminds you of someone, why not use the Indigogo share tools to send the word out! Getting this message out to the world is certainly like fishing.  
If you can’t be a glorious sea-bass then try being a fisher! And to all you glorious sea-basses out there, why not take up a rod as well!



Thanks so much for giving this a look and again, if you have any questions please don’t hesitate to drop me a line at jeremy@meddlingwithnature.com

Extras!  Just in Case You Want to Keep Reading!
This takes a lot of effort from a lot of people. From 17th century
 Dutch translation to the nuts and bolts of building accurate dioramas, 
we have had a lot of expertise on our side from a number of highly 
respected institutions in the area. 
This work requires a lot 
of specialized passion. I believe very much in organizational 
collaboration and this show will see all of the Cincinnati heavy 
hitters come to bat for one of the most important, yet invisible 
scientists from the 17th century. 
However, I have 
realized a labor of love can only go so far without funding. We 
have received a lot of support for specimens and research, but now we 
are at the point in which we actually have to make this stuff! 
This is our first crowd funding attempt. Of course I am nervous about
 it, but after writing draft after draft for other projects which are now
 complete (but maybe not exactly as cool as I thought they would be) I am
 asking for community support. 
I am an independent artist and we are an 
independent organization; self-funded and self-motivated, but this time we truly need your support. Corners can't be cut and we can’t just do a 
“good enough” job on this one. Maria is too important, and there are not
 a lot of artists clamoring to elevate this work. It has to be right the
 first time.
So here we are, hat in hand. Help make this show road 
worthy! That’s right, we have intentions of sending this across the 
country, and even now our bobbers are bobbing.

story:
The Lark is a culmination of desires.


The internet has inarguably become one of the single most influential forces of culture, but its nature of multiplicities causes the homes of ideas to lack integration.

The Lark is a new online publication that features the work of international scholars, poets, writers, artists, thinkers, and pays each contributor for their work.

With this publication, we hope to spark a new tradition: one of publications that unify art and critical thought, and treat those things as well as their creators with the utmost respect. The internet does not have to be a tapestry of distraction.

We believe in creating oases of calm in the mad rapids of the internet, where the mind and spirit find solace in a unified place of art and thought, where artists and thinkers and readers are all simultaneously fostered, and communally funded by people who share the same desire.

The Brook will not rely on income from advertisers. Instead, it will be communally funded by people who believe in the kind of work being published, as well as by people for whom this project's philosophical and social goals are in line with their own.

A brief note: Regardless of whether or not we hit our goal here by our deadline, if we reach $350 by March 1st, the first issue will go forward no matter what.

Similarly, submissions to The Lark will be open to the general public, meaning that anyone can send in anything to be considered for publication. The Brook's site will also function as a platform for related events (such as exhibitions, lectures, etc.) internationally, as they are sent in by its readers. To foster dialogue, letters sent in by readers will also be published as they are responsive to the current issue's content.

Submissions to The Lark will be open to the general public, meaning that anyone can send in anything to be considered for publication. 

The Lark posits the notion that art, philosophy, and scholarship can have a comfortable home online, and, critically, that the work of poets, authors, and thinkers deserves to be compensated, and rightly treated as the treasury of civilization.

A dummy draft of the first issue's cover.


The Insides

The Lark will play host to:

ART

  • Reproductions of 2-dimensional work, such as paintings and photographs.
  • Film
  • Music (recorded)
  • Poetry and prose
    et al
     

WRITING & THOUGHT

  • Art Criticism & Reviews - We find that there is so little art criticism today in the mainstream that is not either monolithic or has not been prepossessed by the need to pose as advertising. Without that need, true art criticism can take hold.
  • Philosophy & Thought Experiments - The play in philosophical thinking is often pigeonholed into hyper-academic dogma. If given the place to publish new ideas, we believe that new philosophy can flourish and the reader can, too.
  • Research - Social investigations, cultural insights, scientific explorations, will all be fostered here.

LISTINGS

  • Listings related to art, research, or culture, wherever it is in the world they take place, will be listed on a submission and acceptance basis from the general public.

 

On: Contributing

The money we raise from this campaign will go to paying our contributors for the entirety of the first year (March 2017 through March 2018), and the fees for upholding the website.

Each issue will be released every three months, making four (4) issues per year:

  • Spring (March-May)
  • Summer (June-August)
  • Autumn (September-November) 
  • Winter (December-March 2018)

Each issue will likely be made up of 15 contributors, whose contributions may range from a work of writing (poetry, prose, essay, philosophy, scholarship, etc.), a reproduction of a two-dimensional artwork (painting, photography, drawing, architecture, design, etc.), a piece of recorded music, or a work of film.

The hope is that, from however humble a beginning we must start with, we will be able to grow the project and continue to produce an online publication that is supported by the international creative community, therefore not relying upon paid advertising or mainstream trends.

We hope to be able to provide the people who support us with some nifty things, but the real benefit of supporting this publication is, truly, its fruition; and the knowing that you have helped form a new kind of platform for art and writing, the likes of which are few and far between.

 

Risks & Challenges

We know that there's a chance we may not reach our goal through this campaign alone. Although we aren't relying solely on this platform,  we know firsthand that raising money for projects can be slow-going and difficult. Here's some of the other approaches we're taking:

  • We are also applying to grants and other kinds of funding programs.
  • We will hold in-person fundraisers and other kinds of events to help us meet our goal.
  • If we aren't able to reach our goal, we will use whatever funds we do raise as well as our reserve funds to pay as much as we can to our initial contributors, who understand that we might have trouble in these delicate first stages.

We want to make this happen, and will exhaust every method possible to see it to completion.

 

Unable to Contribute Financially?

That is a familiar problem, and is more than okay! We can still use your help getting the word out about this campaign. Here are some other easy ways for you to help us realize this project:

  • Please send this around to people you think might be interested in supporting!
  • Use the magic of Indiegogo to share this campaign across the land.

Risks & Challenges
We know that there's a chance we may not reach our goal through this campaign alone. Although we aren't relying solely on this platform,  we know firsthand that raising money for projects can be slow-going and difficult. Here's some of the other approaches we're taking:

We are also applying to grants and other kinds of funding programs.
We will hold in-person fundraisers and other kinds of events to help us meet our goal.
If we aren't able to reach our goal, we will use whatever funds we do raise as well as our reserve funds to pay as much as we can to our initial contributors, who understand that we might have trouble in these delicate first stages.

We want to make this happen, and will exhaust every method possible to see it to completion.
 

Unable to Contribute Financially?
That is a familiar problem, and is more than okay! We can still use your help getting the word out about this campaign. Here are some other easy ways for you to help us realize this project:

Please send this around to people you think might be interested in supporting!
Use the magic of Indiegogo to share this campaign across the land.

story:
Hello, my name is Lenka Holíková and I'm Czech artist.

I was accepted to the Complutense University in Madrid where I will study my master degree in ¨Art creation and art research¨. In this moment I don't have any scholarship, I will receive it in five months, that's why I'm asking you a little help because I need to move to Madrid and start my studies there.  

If you can and you will help me, I will be very grateful. Check the rewards that I offer for your help...

Hola, mi nombre es Lenka Holíková y soy artista checa. 

He sido aceptada en el master en "Creación e investigación artística" en la Universidad Complutense de Madrid. En este momento no cuento con una beca, la cual voy a recibir hasta en cinco meses. Por lo tanto les estoy pidiendo una pequeña ayuda, la cual me permite mudarme a Madrid y empezar mis estudios mientras recibo la beca. 

Si quieren y pueden ayudarme, les estaré agradecida. Revisen las recompensas que doy a cambio de tu apoyo...

Ahoj, jmenuji se Lenka Holíková a jsem česká výtvarnice. 

Přijali mě na španělskou univerzitu "Complutense de Madrid", kde budu studovat "Výtvarnou tvorbu". Bohužel nyní nemám žádné stipendium, dostanu ho až za pět měsíců. Proto Vás žádá o malou výpomoc, která mi umožní přestěhovat se do Madridu a začít má studia. 

Jestliže mi chcete a můžete pomoci, budu Vám vděčná a za odměnu Vám pošlu malý dárek. Prohlédněte si nabízené odměny...
