story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
About Us

We are Drunken Chorus, a performance company and registered charity.

We make theatre, we help other people make theatre and we produce projects that reach audiences who might not normally go to the theatre.

We also work to increase access to deaf audiences, adults with learning disabilities and young people who might have barriers towards accusing the arts.

We run a project called DRUNKEN NIGHTS, which brings new, unexpected and surprising performances into the familiar and relaxed setting of local pubs

DRUNKEN NIGHTS has two really important aims:

Reaching new audiences: The events happen in the main space of the pub, not hidden away in a function room or upstairs theatre. All of our events are free and people don't need a ticket. The rules of traditional theatre don’t apply and anyone can enjoy the events from the comfort of their favourite bar stool.

Supporting artists: We support artists who are at the beginning of their careers, helping them to create new work and to develop their practice. The project opens up alternative routes into the arts industry and provides valuable experience for artists.

In the initial stage of DRUNKEN NIGHTS we select 18 artists to perform over three nights. From these we select 3 companies to support further with rehearsal space, mentoring and a production budget. This work then becomes a triple bill which we take back to the pubs and perform.


DRUNKEN NIGHTS is currently in its fourth year and we have worked with over 80 early career artists. We have provided significant development support for 9 performance pieces, through mentoring from renowned practitioners, including Franko B, David Rosenberg, Cathy Naden (Forced Entertainment) and Jon Haynes (Ridiculusmus). Past DRUNKEN NIGHTS artists include Selina Thompson, Lydia Cottrell and Non Applicables.

Our events have reached over 2,000 audience members in London, Preston, Hull, Sheffield and Lancaster.


DRUNKEN NIGHTS IV

We have selected three fantastic artists / companies to support this year: Paige Stillwell, Lascelles Dance and Two’s A Crowd.

They are currently busy working on developing their performances, which they will present in London and Sheffield in March 2016. They are receiving mentoring support from mentors Ursula Martinez, Third Angel and Nic Green.

It's really important to us that these companies get the best possible support during their development period. For many this is the first time they have had a full week of focused rehearsal time, or had a production budget for their work. We want to give them the opportunity to get as much as they can out of this experience.


Our aim is that our companies leave the project with the ability to continue touring their shows to areas of low engagement in the arts, bringing outstanding theatre to the doorsteps of local communities. 

Once the week is over our support doesn’t stop there. We continue to support and work with many of our DRUNKEN NIGHTS alumni, supporting them whenever possible to continue developing their artistic careers  We want to grow this so that our Drunken Alumni becomes a real community of support for early career artists.

As a registered charity, we have to raise or earn all of our income, and we want to demonstrate to our partners and funders that our community has our back.

So if you’ve ever attended a DRUNKEN NIGHTS event, are planning to attend one in the future, or if you’re passionate about projects that bring together audience and talent development, we’d like to ask for your support.

Your donations will ensure we can keep our events running free of charge, so those who can’t afford a ticket can keep coming along. They will also ensure that ongoing support is made available to our artists beyond the project, and enable us to continue working with the best mentors.

As well as all of this, your support will tremendously help in making the case to the trusts, foundations and corporate sponsors whom we are currently approaching to fund our work.

In return for your contribution, we’ve cooked up some rewards which you can read all about on the right hand side. If you’re not able to donate, you can still really help by passing this campaign along to people you know and who might be able to.

The old cliché is true - every penny counts! Thank you!


What will your money buy? 

Money raised as part of this crowdfunder will ensure that the events in March remain free and accessible for those who attend but crucially the money breaks down as:

- Fees for the three mentors

- Production budget for three artists / companies


Risks & Challenges

We’re working with partners who we have an established relationship with. They know their venues and their audiences, and more importantly we know how to work with them. With any non-ticketed and free event it's always difficult to guarantee or even predict the audience turnout, which is why we’ve developed a concise and targeted marketing strategy, especially around our approach to reaching pub regulars, local communities and deaf audiences. Of course the work made by our 3 emerging artists might be challenging in form but that’s the exciting part. Like any crowdfunder there is a risk we won’t hit our target - but do not fear, every pound counts in this campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can spare some money - we know and understand this, and it's the reason we keep our events free in the first place. So please pass the link on to friends and family who want to support a project that really makes a difference to early career artists and local audiences. We’re proud of what DRUNKEN NIGHTS stands for, and we hope you will show your support for our aims by donating to the project or sharing the info with your friends, family and colleagues.
story_txt:
About
Us
We are Drunken Chorus, a performance company and registered
charity.
We make theatre, we help other people make theatre and we
produce projects that reach audiences who might not normally go to the theatre.
We also work to increase access to deaf audiences, adults
with learning disabilities and young people who might have barriers towards
accusing the arts.
We run a project called DRUNKEN NIGHTS, which brings new,
unexpected and surprising performances into the familiar and relaxed setting of
local pubsDRUNKEN NIGHTS has two really important aims:
Reaching new audiences: The events happen in the main
space of the pub, not hidden away in a function room or upstairs theatre. All
of our events are free and people don't need a ticket. The rules of traditional
theatre don’t apply and anyone can enjoy the events from the comfort of their
favourite bar stool.
Supporting artists: We support artists who are at the
beginning of their careers, helping them to create new work and to develop
their practice. The project opens up alternative routes into the arts industry
and provides valuable experience for artists.
In the initial stage of DRUNKEN NIGHTS we select 18 artists
to perform over three nights. From these we select 3 companies to support
further with rehearsal space, mentoring and a production budget. This work then
becomes a triple bill which we take back to the pubs and perform.
DRUNKEN NIGHTS is currently in its fourth year and we have
worked with over 80 early career artists. We have provided significant
development support for 9 performance pieces, through mentoring from renowned
practitioners, including Franko B, David Rosenberg, Cathy Naden (Forced
Entertainment) and Jon Haynes (Ridiculusmus). Past DRUNKEN NIGHTS artists
include Selina Thompson, Lydia Cottrell and Non Applicables.
Our events have reached over 2,000 audience members in
London, Preston, Hull, Sheffield and Lancaster.
DRUNKEN NIGHTS IV
We have selected three fantastic artists / companies to
support this year: Paige Stillwell, Lascelles Dance and Two’s A Crowd.
They are currently busy working on developing their
performances, which they will present in London and Sheffield in March 2016.
They are receiving mentoring support from mentors Ursula Martinez, Third Angel and Nic Green.
It's really important to us that these companies get the
best possible support during their development period. For many this is the
first time they have had a full week of focused rehearsal time, or had a
production budget for their work. We want to give them the opportunity to get
as much as they can out of this experience.
Our aim is that our companies leave the project with the ability
to continue touring their shows to areas of low engagement in the arts,
bringing outstanding theatre to the doorsteps of local communities.

NIGHTS alumni, supporting them whenever possible to continue developing their
artistic careers  We want to grow this so that
our Drunken Alumni becomes a real community of support for early career
artists.

income, and we want to demonstrate to our partners and funders that our

story:
Short Summary

Hey, I'm Nate Waggoner. If you were part of the literary scene in the Bay Area between 2011 and 2014, you might have seen me read funny, self-deprecating work at Write Club, Quiet Lightning, Velro, Under the Influence, Word Performances, The Worst!, or some other event. You might have heard my pornographic fan fiction read out loud at Shipwreck. More recently, in New York, you might have seen me perform at Cartoon Monsoon, In Search Of..., or Funny/Sexy/Sad. You might have read something I've written on KQEDPop or at The-Tusk.com or somewhere else, or you might have read a piece by someone else that I've edited on The Tusk. You might have seen my artwork in posters for some of these readings, on The Tusk, and elsewhere. You can see all of my published writing and a lot of my drawings and a bunch of videos of me reading my work at www.natewagg.com.

I'm trying to go on a short, cross-country reading tour. I will be reading in Los Angeles during the Association of Writers and Writing Programs convention, then in San Francisco, then at Song Missing in Atlanta, then in Richmond. Here is the full schedule of confirmed events:

Highland Park Babylon at Bookshow LA: April 2

Funny/Sexy/Sad at Second Act in SF: April 4

Song Missing in Atlanta: April 6

I've Got a Message for King Wizard, Son of a Heartless Manipulator, but He's in the Yukon, Chop Suey Books in Richmond, VA, April 9

Funny/Sexy/Sad in Brooklyn: April 14

The point of this will be to continue garnering the small following I've accrued doing readings in different parts of the United States, as well as to promote The Tusk and to promote a book I recently put out though a small small press called Snow Goose, "Dilettantes and Heartless Manipulators." 

Joining me to read at these events will be such luminaries as Lizzy Acker (Monster Party, KQED, Willamette Week), Tom Batten (The Guardian), Lauren O'Neal (Slate, The Hairpin), Maggie Tokuda-Hall (Shipwreck, Midnight Breakfast), Casey Childers (Shipwreck, Write Club), and Andrew Blossom (Makeout Creek, I've Got A Message For You and You're Not Going to Like It). So in a way it's also about community-- all of us deserve greater recognition, these events bring people together, foster dialogue and creativity and so on.

What I Need & What You Get

I need money to eat, miss work, get a bus from LA to SF, rent a car to travel from Atlanta to Richmond, put gas in the rental car, get a hotel in Atlanta, probably take some cabs, and take the train back home from Richmond to New York. 

For donating, depending on how much you donate, you can get a copy of the book, a bunch of art I've done printed out together in a little collection, some original art, some art on commission i.e. you tell me what to draw or write, and I'm also selling a guest post on The Tusk (the site gets ~10,000 hits per month), as long as you don't write something racist or slanderous or whatever on there.

Risks & Challenges

I could be murdered by some maniac at literally any point on this trip. It's possible that no one will show up to any of these readings, that everyone has always just been humoring me, and now is the point at which they all just unanimously go, "You know what? Fuck that guy. We shouldn't support his awful nonsense anymore." I could get ripped up and chewed up and booed offstage. There's vomit on my sweater already, Mom's spaghetti.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this thing. Come to the readings. Please come to the readings!

story:
Thank you -you did it! With the offline contributions from individuals and Dundee businesses, we made £2,770 - £500 more than our target!
We look forward to seeing you at the end of May.
Further updates will be on our facebook page - www.facebook.com/CardboardArchDundee

Help us bring a fun, free, spectacular event to Dundee!

We want to recreate a huge version of Dundee’s Royal Arch out of cardboard boxes! We’ll work with Olivier Grossetete, who has created his amazing People’s Towers all over the world. With your help, we can bring the People’s Tower to Dundee on the original Royal Arch site.

People's Tower, Norwich

This amazing project is brought to you by Claire Dow, an events producer in Dundee and the Dundee Institute of Architects. It will be part of the Festival of Architecture 2016; during the Year of Innovation, Architecture and Design 2016; and also part of Ignite Dundee, if we get your help!

Together we can make something really special.

  • open to everyone

  • free to take part

  • It’ll make people think about their built environment, the changes in Dundee, and the town’s history

  • It will be fun!

With you involved we can build a unique event unlike anything seen before in Dundee. We will fill the new Slessor Gardens with hundreds of people having fun, building a massive arch together and then on day two it gets toppled and and trampled!

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise £2,270. The original Royal Arch was funded through public subscription and this is what they raised – if they can do it in 1849, we can do it again in 2016! This will cover the site costs such as fencing and overnight security, site signage with original arch history, and some lovely posters to tell people its happening.

Every penny counts – we have lots of unique perks for supporters. Everyone gets a magnitude of gratitude as standard! Choose from a unique polaroid arch selfie; exclusive signed copies of the architectural plans by Olivier Grossetete; a certified piece of the arch after the event; or a sunny yellow support badge – there are plenty of options.

If we don’t reach our goal, we’ll prioritise the safety aspects of securing the cardboard Arch overnight, after that its about the pretty posters and onsite display boards with history of the arch.

We are very time limited- we’ll close our campaign on March 16th – the date the original Royal Arch was demolished.

If you'd prefer to give in person rather than over the internet please do contact Claire - clairedow@ymail.com


The Impact

We believe that the project is important for two things – to get people out having fun and engaging with a great arts project; and to get them thinking about the built heritage here in Dundee – what buildings are gone and what new buildings are emerging.

Delivery

It’s a straightforward project in a lot of ways – we work with UZ Arts who are the UK producers and have done it before. We'll be joining cities like London, Sydney, Glasgow and Glastonbury Festival.  Olivier does all the preparation, engineering and design work and supplies the boxes flatpacked to Dundee. All we need to supply is a space to change those flat packed sheets into cardboard boxes (over 1,000 of them!), a safe site and people – lots of people - to help build and topple our Royal Arch.

We  have support from Dundee City Festival Trust and the Ignite Sparks programme . We applied for other public funds and are approaching businesses for sponsorship. This campaign is another brick in our wall of funding, and will help us show public demand and raise interest.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are lots of ways you can help and join in!

Please help spread the word – tell you friends and family about our plans, share our links and information.

Follow us on Twitter  or Facebook and keep up to date on developments.

Share these Indiegogo campaign details far and wide!

Volunteer to build boxes! In the week leading up to the build event, there will be workshops and opportunities to make the basic cardboard blocks, which will have arrived in flat sheets to Dundee.

Come along on the day! Don’t miss the main events- build day Saturday 28 May, and demolition day Sunday 29th May!

story:
The Shivaji Competition asks artists, architects, designers, planners, scientists,  writers and other creatives to propose the practical and impossible to maintain the human habitation on islands and deltas doomed by at least a one meter sea level rise in the 21st century. The ideas will be demonstrated on an island or delta under high risk to bring worldwide attention to these threatened places and push the world to live up to Article 8 of the COP21 agreement signed in Paris.

Summary

  1. International competition of ideas for islands, deltas and their cultures doomed by sea level rise in the 21st century.  Click here to enter.
  2. Using animated GIFs format for mass social media distribution.
  3. Named after Shivaji Maharaj, the great 17th century warrior king and protector of India’s islands. 
  4. Free to enter to encourage people worldwide
  5. Joins the dialogue at the Rising Waters Confab

Our Metaphor and Statement of Purpose

The great warrior king of 17th century India, Shivaji Maharaj, established the Maratha Empire against the dominant Mughals and held off the territorial ambitions of the Europeans. Part of his legacy is a group of island forts in the Arabian Sea with stonewalls ringing the edges against the sea and the Europeans. The Shivaji island forts are the starting metaphor and reality for responses to the invasion of the seawaters for the barrier islands and low elevation islands and deltas around the world.

With the predicted sea level rise of one meter, thousands of islands and deltas and millions of people around the world will be threatened with frequent saltwater floods from storms and king tides. Freshwater may disappear.  Sewer and rainwater drainage will not function.  Evacuation will intensify a refuge crisis and tensions in national borders.  Most islands have a light human or agricultural intervention. Others like Miami Beach are dense urban places.

The competition asks artists, architects, designers, planners, scientists and writers to propose the practical and impossible to maintain the continued human habitation of these islands throughout the 21st century. The ideas should be demonstrated on an island or delta under high risk to bring worldwide attention to these threatened places and push the world to live up to Article 8 of the COP21 agreement signed in Paris.

Responses can be elaborate infrastructures for urban cities and DIY methods for agricultural islands by residents with very limit economic resources. (or vis-a-versa). Both parody and reality are welcome as long as the proposals help wake up politicians, engage the minds of a broad public and respect the people of the islands or deltas. Think like Shivaji. The old political structure has lost its ability to respond and the invasion of the little known outside forces from the sea pose a serious threat to your way of life.

The GIFs 

Each entry will be submitted online as a GIF demonstrating a proposal when the sea rises at least one meter.  The GIFs should be persuasive to an international audience.  Humor, drama, paradox and factual reality in photographs, anime, renderings and all other visual formats are acceptable.  Clarity of idea and message is very important.

The Competition

A group of 10-25 finalists will be selected by Buster Simpson and Glenn Weiss in consultation with Rising Waters Confab participants.  These finalists will become part of a traveling exhibition available to museums, global warming conferences and outdoor giant screens.  One of the finalists will be selected to join Confab 2016 for one week in May 2016.  Round trip travel provided.

Buster Simpson, Rising Waters Curator.  For decades from Seattle, Buster Simpson has produced public artworks, agitprop and process-driven art for cities and museums across North America.  He seeks local solutions for global issues and reinforces the ecological and social conscience for neighborhoods and cities.  Simpson Website

Glenn Weiss, Competition Inventor and Organizer.  Weiss has curated and managed other competitions and exhibitions for the public art agencies in the USA including Times Square and for institutions such as the Storefront for Art and Architecture and PS1 in New York City.

Rising Waters Confab

The Rising Waters Confab 2016 will be held at the Rauschenberg Residency on Captiva Island, Florida in the Gulf of Mexico between April 25 – May 26, 2016.  The Confab is designed to spark a productive dialogue amongst scientists, activists, artists, island dwellers, and others, and work toward addressing the realities of sea level rise.  The 2016 participants will be announced soon.  The 2015 participants, selected by artists Buster Simpson and Laura Sindell, included David Buckland, Mel Chin, Xavier Cortada, Orion Cruz, Gretel Ehrlich, John Englander, Walter Hood, Lewis Hyde, Natalie Jeremijenko, Edward Morris, Helen Nagge, Jeremy Pickard, Andrea Polli, Thomas Ruppert, Susannah Sayler, Tom Van Lent, Glenn Weiss, June Wilson, Kristie Anders and Anne Focke. The online catalog of projects from 2015 can be downloaded at https://risingwatersrr.files.wordpress.com/2015/09/risingwatersreportfinal.pdf

Links

Competition Website:  https://Shivaji2016.com

Existing Engineering and Situations:  https://www.pinterest.com/shivaji2016

Sample GIFs:  https://www.pinterest.com/shivaji2016/sample-gifs/

Recommended GIF Maker:  http://ezgif.com/maker

Rising Waters Confab: https://risingwatersrr.files.wordpress.com

neighborhoods and cities.  Simpson
Website
Glenn Weiss, Competition Inventor and Organizer.  Weiss has curated and managed other competitions and
exhibitions for the public art agencies in the USA including Times Square and
for institutions such as the Storefront for Art and Architecture and PS1 in New
York City.
Rising Waters Confab 
The Rising Waters Confab 2016 will be held at the
Rauschenberg Residency on Captiva Island, Florida in the Gulf of Mexico between
April 25 – May 26, 2016.  The Confab is
designed to spark a productive dialogue amongst scientists, activists, artists,
island dwellers, and others, and work toward addressing the realities of sea
level rise.  The 2016 participants will
be announced soon.  The 2015
participants, selected by artists Buster Simpson and Laura Sindell, included
David Buckland, Mel Chin, Xavier Cortada, Orion Cruz, Gretel Ehrlich, John
Englander, Walter Hood, Lewis Hyde, Natalie Jeremijenko, Edward Morris, Helen
Nagge, Jeremy Pickard, Andrea Polli, Thomas Ruppert, Susannah Sayler, Tom Van
Lent, Glenn Weiss, June Wilson, Kristie Anders and Anne Focke. The online
catalog of projects from 2015 can be downloaded at https://risingwatersrr.files.wordpress.com/2015/09/risingwatersreportfinal.pdf
Links
Competition Website: 
https://Shivaji2016.com 
Existing Engineering and Situations:  https://www.pinterest.com/shivaji2016

Sample GIFs:  https://www.pinterest.com/shivaji2016/sample-gifs/

Recommended GIF Maker: 
http://ezgif.com/maker
Rising Waters Confab: https://risingwatersrr.files.wordpress.com

story:
Without a doubt, the all-time coolest teen bedroom belonged to Ferris Bueller and like every 80s teen, I wanted to hang out in that room. So I thought, why not recreate it?

My name is Sarah Keenlyside and I'm a Toronto-based artist and filmmaker. My collaborator Joseph Clement and I (we call ourselves "The Racket Club") are launching a WORLD-WIDE SCAVENGER HUNT and crowdfunding campaign to recreate Ferris Bueller’s bedroom in as much detail as humanly possible for an upcoming art event called Come Up To My Room (January 21-24, 2016) at Toronto's famous Gladstone Hotel. 

But it won't be easy! Ferris had some very special things in his room - Like the Cabaret Voltaire and Simple Minds posters, the E-MU II Emulator keyboard, the IBM PC XT, the Carver audio stack, the mannequin in the bed... 

That's why WE NEED YOUR HELP! You can contribute in three ways:

1. A financial donation of any size would be greatly appreciated, and we are offering some fun rewards. 

2. Help us find the things we need! Our website, www.saveferrisroom.com will have a running list of what we're looking for... Did you see an item on eBay? In your uncle's basement? Or maybe in your own house? Your tips could make all the difference! 

3. Tell others about us! We'd love our project to be mentioned on your blog, Instagram or Facebook. The more people that know about what we're doing and participate, the more fun and exciting this project will be!

We know not everyone who sees this campaign will be able to visit Ferris's room in person, but we'll be setting up a live webcam a few days before the event (so you can see us tearing our hair out!) and an online experience that will live on, so we can visit Ferris's room forever!

Footnote: We don't know exactly how much money we'll need to pull this off. We expect the minimum will be $6500. If we exceed our campaign goal and/or we don't end up needing all the money, we will donate the excess to The Red Cross. (Ferris has a Red Cross poster illustrated by Norman Rockwell in his room.)

story:
Hello! We are Angel, Israt, Jenny, Manny, and Sulgi -- we are the editors of AMPLIFYHER, the first-ever zine by and for undocumented women from the Asian diaspora. AMPLIFYHER is a collaborative project between RAISE (Revolutionizing Asian American Immigrant Stories on the East Coast) and DRUM – South Asian Organizing Center.


All of us are artists & organizers within the migrant rights movement. Yet, our voices are rarely heard because of how the "model minority myth" intersects with the myth that Asian women are passive and silent.

We came up with AMPLIFYHER to break this silence. We wanted to create a space where we could make ourselves and our community heard! 

We need your support to amplify the voices of undocumented women from the Asian diaspora, including trans women and gender non-conforming folks!

We want to raise $5,000 to produce 5,000 copies of AMPLIFYHER. 

Costs include:

  • Printing & mailing the zine as a bound book, with color pages.

  • Stipends for the 5 members of editorial team.

  • Honorariums for our volunteer translators and consultant board members.

  • Costs of creating and maintaining a website.

We are selling a limited number of the AMPLIFYHER zine. The rest will be distributed, free of charge, to various immigrants' rights organizations, high schools, & undocumented folks residing in the U.S., among others. 

For $30, you can purchase 1 copy of the zine and we will send one free copy to an undocumented person currently residing in the U.S.

Your donation will have a huge impact. To illustrate what you can help us do:

  • For $15, you would cover the shipping costs of mailing zines to 20 undocumented individuals in the U.S.

  • For $50, you would give us the funds to print 35 copies of our zine.

  • For $100, you would help us provide an honorarium to support undocumented Asian women artists.

Timeline:

Our call for submission closes on May 6, 2016. We are aiming for a Summer 2016 production date with a publication launch in Fall 2016. We will be sure to keep you updated!

Other ways that you can help:

Please share this link on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or Tumblr. Feel free to share our FB page and Submittable. Please use the hashtag #AMPLIFYHERZINE and tag @RAISENYC and @DesisRisingUp in your post.

You can contact us at any time at amplifyher.zine@gmail.com

---

AMPLIFYHER is one of the 2015 recipients of the Asian Women Giving Circle Grant. AMPLIFYHER is made possible through a collaboration with AALDEF (Asian American Legal Defense and Education Fund).

story:
Our Mission: 614 Art is a community of local artists coming together to create a movement. Together as one, we can build a community of local artists to connect with you. We are a non funded organization supported by local artist. 614 Art originally started as a blog that only posted local artists’ paintings via social media to help their art become more known. Our blog is now close to 10k followers on facebook, which helps creates a lot of exposure for their artwork. 614 Art will host gallery events with live music to help the local art scene by giving them a chance to showcase their talents. Artists will be able to host their own gallery shows with the help from 614 Art. We will post about their events to help them reach more fans.  We want to spread more art in the city . From wall murals, to more art events, galleries. Hosting a once a month 614 art gallery event free to public . Come to our next up coming event on December 19th.We are hosting our Monthly 614 ART Gallery Event at Rev1 with Ardina . With your help we can host monthly events like this and get more involved with our art community. Thanks to our sponsors we been able to do 3 events so far . Help us reach our goals to help spread more art around the city.

Details to Event: Join us at Rev1 December 19th .

http://on.fb.me/1knNcCj

story:
Friends and Family~
Thank you for your support of my directorial debut You Are Here. Writing and directing this project has been a long-standing passion project of mine-- and during the fall of 2015 we completed principal shooting of this powerful indie film. 

Through the expert work of our phenomenal Director of Photography Hakeem Foster; drafts on drafts; as well as collaboration with some of New York's brightest innovators #YouAreHereMovie was shot and produced. We need YOU to get through the post-production process. 

I am particularly proud to bring an honest, nuanced take on New York's current cultural landscape-- and all of the innovators that make their mark here. Your financial support of You Are Here Movie will empower us to bring vitally important narratives to the forefront.

In Gratitude, 

Safiya Aurora Martinez


Film Synopsis|

Jadon is experiencing seismic shifts in his young life. He has given seven long years to chasing his dreams of becoming an artist of renown in New York City. He is at turning point-- in the form of being called to a meeting at Universal Records in Los Angeles. This meeting has the potential to change his current hustle-- from train cars and clubs to boardrooms. The prospect of success is thrilling and terrifying. Jadon leans on his small circle of friends to prepare himself for the leap. They are fellow artists, muses and crushes. "You Are Here" captures an intoxicating, honest day in the life of a young dreamer. 

 

Your financial support will help us to:

*Complete post-production 
*Promote and publicize this gorgeous, original short film
*Pay for editing and sound mixing
*Produce all-access events for #YouAreHereMovie
*Finance film festival applications & travel 


Written and Directed by Safiya Martinez

Assistant Directed by Diana Mia Marte Piccini


STARRING:

Jadon Woodard is a phenomenal actor, poet and emcee. As an artist, his list of brand collaborations in the past five years reads like a who's-who of America's most influential corporations with Nickelodeon, Coors Light, Sprite, the NBA's New York Knicks and Usher's New Look Foundation among the highlights. Most recently, he won the Jack Daniels Jack'N Beats competition in the spring of 2015. 

Lissette Joubert has been featured in numerous indie fashion campaigns and photo shoots. She generously shared her talents, natural effervescent energy and generosity of spirit to You Are  Here Movie. This is her first independent film. 

Bridget Barkan Bridget Barkan 

As a child actress, Barkan appeared in commercials and Sesame Street, continuing to current day in films like HBO's Everyday People, Sherrybaby with Maggie Gyllenhaal, Brian De Palma's controversial Redacted and, most recently, God's Pocket, alongside Phillip Seymour Hoffman. Barkan had a guest role in Steven Soderbergh's TV show The Knick, and a recurring role as the one-legged hooker on Law & Order: SVU. On stage, Barkan has appeared in various Manhattan Theatre Club productions, was in the original production of Dog Sees God, and a workshop of hit Broadway show Spring Awakening. She is currently an artist-in-residence at Joe's Pub. 

Anthony McPherson is a brilliant poet, actor and performer. He is launching a west coast performance tour, and most recently won the Underground Slam at the Independent World Poetry Slam. 

Franki Acevedo is a photographer and long-time supporter of the arts. She works across mediums and modalities, bringing a wide variety of dynamic strengths and skills to her projects. 

Safiya Martinez is a writer, performer and educator. She holds a B.A. in Anthropology from The New School University, an M.S. in Education through the New York City Teaching Fellows program and an M.F.A. in Playwrighting from San Francisco State University. Her critically acclaimed solo show So You Can Hear Me has been performed at The Marsh Theater in San Francisco, The EXIT, APT 78, ArtNow NY Gallery, at the BAADASS! Women's Theater Festival in the Bronx, The Nuyorican Poets Café-- and as part of Stanford University’s LIVE SHORTS Program. She currently serves as the National Programs Manager at UrbanWord NYC. 


SPECIAL THANKS TO: UrbanWord NYC-- a leading literacy arts organization for youth. UrbanWord generously donated their space, resources and creative networks to support You Are Here Movie. 

For more information on UrbanWord-- follow, link and connect:
Website: http://www.urbanwordnyc.org/
Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/user/UrbanWor...
twitter: https://twitter.com/urbanwordnyc
Instagram: https://instagram.com/urbanwordnyc


SPECIAL THANKS TO: 

Sarah Sweeney for creating amazing original artwork for #YouAreHereMovie branding. www.sweeneymfgco.com/

SPECIAL THANKS TO: 

Liz Ronk for shooting all principal photography during You Are Here movie production. http://life.time.com/author/lronk1271/

https://twitter.com/lizabethronk

story:
About me and my art

My name is Gábor Urbán, I am a painter born in the former Yugoslavia. In the early nineties I denied to participate in the Balkan war, so I had to leave my country. I moved to Hungary, later I lived and worked on the island of Hvar, Croatia. Currently I live alternately in Hungary and Serbia.

One of my motto is from Apelles: ”Nulla dies sine linea”- “No day without a line”, what means that not a single day can pass idly, without a brush-stroke. I am working continuously for more than five decades, choosing painting as a profession and a way of life.

Description of Need

As a professional painter I either work on completing my artistic vision, articulating my thoughts and feelings in the form of paintings; or I merely paint paintings that can be sold easily to cover my everyday expenses – and this distracts me from expressing my real artistic vision. My more significant works which are coming from my real passion and love for painting are expressions of a spiritual adventure, a magical realistic vision about the destiny of humanity.

To focus on my artistic duty I need my financial situation to be secured at least for a year, so that I can finish 5-8 of my most significant unfinished paintings, that would complete my life work.

My goal

Next year I will reach the age of 70 and my health condition is worsening which decreases my working capacity. I feel a pressing urge to use my remaining time and energy to concentrate on completing my artistic life work instead of wasting my time and talent for pieces of smaller significance produced mainly for sale.

My goal is to finish 5-8 paintings in one years period of time.

How You Can Help

10 000 USD would be enough for a year to cover my modest expenses for basic and essential things that are necessary to maintain painting and living (food, paint, accommodation, bills).

With your donations you would support me to create with free spirit and dedicate all my time and efforts to my unfinished pieces without existential fear and constraints to fulfill my artistic mission, my destiny and duty in this world.


Some of my works:

Jacqueline du Pré


Quo Vadis Homine


Shipwright


Apocalypse


Arpad's Dream-Horses in Storm

story:
My name is Dawn Copps and I'm on the last leg of my school excursion  at Prescott College.  I'm acquiring this milestone, a Bachelor’s in Visual Arts,  for the purpose of continuing on to graduate school to study psychology/therapy, emphasizing art and somatic modalities.  This path means a lot to me because I've regularly been a connoisseur of human behavior and believe I have talents in mining people's psyches with a lot of empathy, with art as my constant companion.  This project means a lot to me because it is my first giant solo art installation and the performance will be an intense and amusing movement piece that explores identity in the context of restraint, performed with my twin sister.

This is a very ambitious senior project and I need help with it.  This is a performance installation set to take place April 22nd, 2016 , and possibly the 23rd as well.  In gestation for this work, I've completed several mentorships in the last two semesters in Butoh dance, installation, movement and indigenous costume/ritual. This movement performance within an installation will be very intimate, ritualistic and interactive. I need help with covering my huge list of materials, as this installation is large and immersive and the costumes involve a LOT of yarn. The materials for bamboo jellyfish, a water wall, coffin cribs and a pillow net aren't necessarily cheap (in addition to chairs, lighting and floor matting), though I am trying to use a lot of recycled materials. The project is, simply put, large.  I want to have the performance in a nice venue and I’ll be needing rehearsal space, which I hope to acquire cheaply, but those can be major costs. I would also like to give something to those who help with the performance and installation--fellow performer, sound track artist, filming, door, lights, etc. This program is pricey and my student loans don't cover my living expenses, let alone all these materials I need.  I will be working on this nearly everyday until April 22nd.   I'm needing the funds now because I have a lot of materials to buy.  


You all know my copious creativity...this is a culmination, in both forms familiar and unfamiliar to me.  I'm profoundly grateful for your reading this and your donation.

To show my gratitude, these are the gifts for your donation:

$25 and up= 1 ticket to the performance

$50 and up= 2 tickets to the performance

$75 and up= 2 tickets to the performance + a copy of the soundtrack, created by me and fellow bandmates.

alone all these materials I need.  I will be working on this nearly
everyday until April 22nd.   I'm needing the funds now because I have a
lot of materials to buy.  You all know my copious creativity...this is a culmination,
in both forms familiar and unfamiliar to me.  I'm profoundly grateful for
your reading this and your donation.
To show my gratitude, these are the gifts for your donation:

$25 and up= 1 ticket to the performance
$50 and up= 2 tickets to the performance
$75 and up= 2 tickets to the performance + a copy of
the soundtrack, created by me and fellow bandmates.

story:
Prints for the Godless

Art for Atheism - Atheism for Art

I'm Scott Wilson, and I'm an atheist artist activist, living and working in Kingston Ontario Canada. I make prints. Fine art, hand made, etchings that support, and extoll the benefits of what I like to call a ‘Golden Godless Future’.  I have sided with rational thought and humanist ethics, and I am dedicated to promoting these values through my work, art. 

I want to create an icons for the godless; to start a visual heritage for rational thought.

Prints for the godless, is a small business that I am developing to sell my prints. These are quality, handmade items that promote rational thought and empirical evidence over faith and wishful thinking. These prints serve more than just an aesthetic purpose; they are banners, proclaiming your affiliation with the free thought movement, to the world of rational, secular thinking. They are a way for rational thinkers to ‘come out' and be out as supporters of empirically evidenced rational decision making. 

The free thought movement, as I see it, has gotten to the point where it needs its supporters to stand proud. Prints for the godless is my job and I am part of a cell of dedicated free thinkers working to spread the cause of empirically evidenced fact based reason globally, I use art as a vehicle for this. I know that I am one of a community of strong voices striving to shape society with the aid of humanist ethics. That community promotes and supports the individual and leads to a blossoming of understanding, of compassionate problem solving, and of kindness that comes with truly knowing who, what and where we are as persons on this earth. In the context of our progress as a species, I think it is time to stop placating an invisible, omniscient, omnipresent creator god for whose existence or power no evidence exists! 

It is time to realize we are the only conscious thinking entities at work designing our future. It is time for humanity to grow up and transcend it's petty squabbles, cruelly divisive theo-political idiocy and make the kinds of choices that lead to the earth and humanity becoming an enlightened, caring bastion of honest understanding.  

So, what do I want? BUY A PRINT!

That is basically what I am asking you to do. I am a working artist. It is my job to create beautiful art that speaks to my vision for the future. You can help me spread this message and beautify your walls at the same time. Frame it and hang it on the wall to show your solidarity with reason, with the enlightenment, with humanity's ability to stand on its own two feet and also show your love of independent artists and creators.

The bulk of the support that I receive from this campaign will be going towards materials and things that I need to form the bulk of my inventory and the startup costs of my business. Things like paper and ink, zinc etching plates and lino-embossing plates; press time with the Kingston School of Art presses where I produce my prints are what I will be spending this money on.

Where I am now!

With the exception of the last print that I am currently working on, the atheist rose - all the plates that I need and some of the stock has already been created. 

Even the atheist rose is sufficiently underway that product will be available. I have however reached my last resource, and the luminaries of rational thought series - starting with the Hitchens commemorative embossed three dimensional print will probably not see the light of day without your support.

It is my intention to create and sell a new print that will come on line every two months and replace existing runs which are at their completion, they are after all, limited editions. 

Here I'd like to add that this campaign is not solely to raise financial capital for this project. It is promotional. Not that I'm downplaying the necessity of money, but a major part of this campaign is to get the word out that Prints for the godless exists, and is open for business!  You can help me reach my goals and aspirations.

If my funding targets are not reached this project is sufficiently underway that any who buys one of my perks will receive that print.

To conclude, I thank you if you've made it this far into my vision of promoting a rational future through art. 

If you are unable to support these goals with a purchase please do make your way over to my blog - www.artforthegodless.com - and sign up for my mailing list, and please try and promote this campaign in the usual ways: Like and subscribe to my Facebook page, Instagram and Twitter to help me spread this beautiful blasphemy!

**If what I have written here so offends, do encourage your invisible omniscient omnipresent all powerful supreme being to smite me in the manor of his/she/their choosing ;)

story:
TRUMP INSULTS PLAYING CARDS:

Now you can collect the greatest collection of Trump Insults.

54 full color caricature picture cards in each deck of the people in government, entertainment and the media whom Donald Trump has insulted. Each card includes the quote of the insult, the date, and where it was said. 

These cards are beautifully laid out with patriotic flag backs. Start spirited discussions about Trump and politics while playing cards with your friends.

DEDICATED TO DONALD J. TRUMP, TRUMP SUPPORTERS AND MAKING AMERICA GREAT AGAIN.  Even if Trump is not your candidate of choice, we still hope you support our campaign and can enjoy our cards and our artwork of all the people Trump has insulted.

Introducing the newly discovered caricature artist Christelli.


 Our aces are countries Trump insulted. 



 Our Kings and Jacks are the top ranking men Trump insulted.

 Our Queens are the top ranking women insulted. But it does not end there.



Remember Trump insulting Senator McCain, Senator Lindsay Graham, Jeb Bush and even The Pope?


Will you ever forget what Trump said about Megyn Kelly, Rosie O'Donnell and Hillary Clinton and "who would vote for that face", presidential candidate Carly Fiorina?



What did Trump say about HBO’s John Oliver, Beyonce and guess who else? The Wall Street Journal and Politico get insulted. Did you know Trump insulted Fox's Karl Rove and Vanity Fair Editor, Graydon Carter? 






JOKERS:

The Jokers of both decks represent supporters of Donald Trump.



WE ARE OFFERING 4 SEPARATE DECKS: 
Deck 1 has the choice of either a red and white striped patriotic theme on the back or a blue with white stars patriotic theme on the back. 
Deck 2 has the choice of either a red and white striped patriotic theme on the back or a blue with white stars patriotic theme on the back.



Don't let your friends trump you. Be the first in your card playing clan or group of friends to own a piece of history. Do your part to Make America Great Again by bringing Trump Insults Playing Cards to your next card game or gathering and start some stimulating conversation or even heated debate. Get your friends to discuss the issues and agree to vote for Trump. (or not) Own a piece of American history. Trump proverbially likes to hold all the cards and now you can too!  Even if you are not a Trump fan, you can enjoy his insults aimed at politicians, entertainment figures and the media.

Now you can be the first to own the only Trump Insults Playing Cards of all time. Love him or hate him, he draws crowds and attention to the issues. There has never been a candidate the likes of Trump. Nobody can deny he is a game changer. Now you can bring a colorful record of his best Insults into your home, impress your friends, start lively discussions and relive the greatest Trump Insults of 2015 and 2016.

Support this project. The TRUMP INSULTS PLAYING CARDS makes a great gift and conversation starter. Liven up your next card game or party. You will love these cards. Your friends will say: Where did you get those cards?

**********************************************************************

The 2nd TRUMP INSULTS PLAYING CARDS deck: 

Trump has insulted so many people that we are compiling a 2nd deck. 

The 1st deck roughly covers Trump insults from before the beginning of his presidential campaign till December 2015. 

The 2nd deck roughly will cover everyone important he has insulted in 2016. (We found some great insults with earlier dates and have included them here). The 2nd TRUMP INSULTS deck is being put together right now and will include the latest insults up to our printing deadline. , 

It includes many of the often insulted major players from Deck 1, including Hillary Clinton, Ted Cruz, President Obama, and Megyn Kelly. Also the NY Times, the NY Daily News, the IRS, the Superbowl, and Common Core Education,  And the new caricatures of Angela Merkel, Paul Ryan, Elizabeth Warren, Kim Jon Un, and Glenn Beck.




PREVIEW OF DECK 2: 



AND FOR THOSE WHO WANT A COMPLETE COLLECTION OF TRUMP INSULTS, FOR YOU WE HAVE: 

TRUMP INSULTS, THE E-BOOK

Includes over 120 caricature cards, plus many hundreds of insult quotes.

We had too many insults and not enough room. Some cards did not make the deck but here you can have them all and the quotes are also up to date. Get the complete collection here.

Retail price             $19.95

Indiegogo price     $15.00



----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We will use the Indiegogo funding to print the cards. I am working with a top level printer and game maker. You will see more games and apps from me in the future. 


We reserve the right to change the pictures, people and quotes on any of the cards.


                                                           *  *  *  *

story:
Short Summary

Yuto and Rebecca have been accepted to a residency in Japan for May 2016!! At this residency, Paradise Air, a living space is provided while we create new work.  Paradise Air will also assist in connecting us with artists or musicians in the surrounding area.  At the end of our stay Yuto will perform a new song and Rebecca will host an exhibition at nearby venues.  This is a wonderful opportunity for exposure and research, helping to start our careers as artists. 

What We Need & What You Get

The $3000 we need is essentially funding our airfare to Japan, providing that a ticket for each of us will cost around $1500.  We intend to save money of our own to pay for food/supplies/misc. costs.  If you contribute to our cause we will share our creative wealth with you!  Whether it be a song from Yuto or original artwork by Rebecca!  

The Impact

Residencies have a long tradition in the art world for boosting creativity and inspiration.  Traveling to Japan will allow us both a wealth of new cultural and artistic influences.  Additionally, the exposure of having a show/exhibition abroad is a phenomenal opportunity for young artists like ourselves.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute don't worry!  Feel free to share our page with your friends and get the word out!  Any amount helps, and the more exposure the better!

story:
After conceptualizing, scheming, and plotting for years, we are finally ready to introduce you to the mythical creature from another dimension that will be bringing Rock'n'Roll to Black ROCK City.


Meet The Bonerpillar

A 30-foot fire-shooting caterpillar made out of bones and YOU can ride it. All aboard for this Rock'n'Roll odyssey through Black Rock City!

Transformed from a Ford 66 Straight Six short bus, the Bonerpillar is an Art Car with attitude. 

The bus will be buried beneath layers of mutation, starting with a steel frame that safely supports the upper observation deck and the extended back deck. Layers of laser-cut and painted plywood will create the exoskeleton, adorned in bones and weird crap, with ribs protruding from each side.

About those bones...

Both literally and figuratively, we're talking real bones, things that look like bones, scrap metal, drift and salvaged wood... dead things. The skeletons of our cultural and industrial landscape. Re-purposed, re-imagined, RESURRECTED.


WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

An art project of this magnitude can be quite expensive. The Bonerpillar is more than 75% funded by the artists and our support team of builders,welders, engineers, burners and Rock'n'Rollers. With your help, we will be able to cover the remaining costs and conjure up this mutant caterpillar creature to bring Rock'n'Roll glory to the citizens of Black ROCK City!

What your donations will help us buy:

Flame Effects 
Two flame poofers affixed to the head that will serve as fiery antennas leading our little mutant as it crawls through the darkest of playa nights, complete with fittings, tanks, and fuel.
Gimme fuel, gimme fire, gimme that which I desire! 

Lights 
The lighting will be a combination of stage lighting and programmable LED's.
Our crew is working hard on the design to keep our little creature brilliantly blazing through the night!
Sound
What's the Bonerpillar without Rock'n'Roll? We need a high-power sound system that can crank out those guitar solos and keep us rockin' all over the playa!

Additional funds raised beyond our goal will be used for the following:

Upgrade Flame Effects
If we exceed our funding goal of $6666, we will add MORE FIRE!!! More fire means more awesome.

Additional Materials for Mutation  
The frame, exoskeleton, ribs and face are all fabricated by our team of artists. Additional materials such as metal, plywood, bones, cushions, and  paint, can help us take the Bonerpillar to the next level.


RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Risks:

Having too much fun, running out of hairspray, summoning a mystical creature from another dimension.

Challenges:

MOOP. Many of our materials are salvaged and natural, which creates a risk for Matter Out Of Place. To address this we will seal all fragile materials with lacquer and/or resin.

This is an old vehicle, old parts sometimes break. We have a rebuilt engine, a recently refurbished brake system, and have had the running gear professionally inspected before our adventure to Black Rock City!

Being an old bus with a top speed of 50 MPH, the  325-mile journey to BRC is especially daunting. We are going to hire a professional shipping company to haul the Bonerpillar to and from BRC.

THE BUILDERS

Based in Oregon and California, a group of dedicated veteran burners have come together to bring the Bonerpillar vision to the playa. We are co-conspiring to manifest this gift of rock'n'roll in caterpillar form to give back to Black ROCK City. Each contributor has their own journey of connection, transformation and ass-slapping good times that they have personally been gifted with from the dusty depths of the Burning Man community. And now it's time to return the favor in the form of a mind-blowing, face-melting experience.

Let's get dusty!

HOW ELSE YOU CAN HELP

As a community project based in the atmosphere of gifting, we are encouraging donations of resources!

We're looking for more materials, especially electric guitars and bones. We also need: Plywood, lumber, steel stock, propane cylinders and more.

We are hosting work parties throughout the summer. If you live close and want to be part of the Bonerpillar Erectors, come on down to help!

The best thing you can do for us if you like the Bonerpillar: Share! Tell a friend, tell your mom, tell your mom's friend. Share our project on your Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and in your community. We look forward to hearing from you!


DONOR-PILLAR PERKS

Look at all the fun things you get when you donate! Not only will you become a critical member of Team Boner, we will also mail you a bunch of crap!

(Be sure to check back for NEW unique perks throughout the campaign.)

$1 Donation = Boner Hug

Every dollar helps get the Bonerpillar more fire, more lights, more music! Find us on the playa and we will give you a special Boner Hug and a big 'Thank you!'

$6 Donation = Sticker

With a $6 donation, you become an official Donor-pillar! And you get this righteous Bonerpillar sticker along with our sincere gratitude!


$16 Donation = Postcard From the Playa

We will stop rockin' long enough to hand-write a special Bonerpillar Postcard and mail it to you straight from Black Rock City.

$26 Donation = Boner-Kozy

Keep your beverage cool and classy with our cool and classy Boner-Kozy! Plus a sticker!


$46 Donation = T-Shirt 

Receive an organic cotton short sleeve T-shirt with our Boner Creature art by underground comic icon and illustrator Larry Welz, plus a sticker.

$66 Donation = Bone Pendant

Become a serious Donor-pillar and receive a unique, one-of-a-kind wearable piece of art. These resin pendants are handmade by us with love, weird bits and lots of tiny rodent/lizard/bird bones collected from our local barn owl. The pendant will come on an antiqued-gold ball chain. Here are some examples of what you might get:


$126 Donation = Donor-pillar Fun Pack

Can't decide between the kozy, shirt and bone pendant? Get all three with your donation! Plus a sticker!

$266 Donation = Special Gear Pendant Fun Pack

Is the Bone Pendant just not cool enough for you? Then you could be one of the lucky few to receive an extra-special Gear Pendant hand-crafted by Le Rod. Plus the kozy, shirt and sticker! Here are some examples of these unique wear-able art pieces:


$666 Donation = Original Artwork

One lucky person will get to own this original skull painting by our very own artistic genius, KC Welch. Dimensions are 12" x 16" unframed.


$1666 = Plane Ride At Burning Man 2016

Ever see the beauty of Black Rock City from the sky?! One of our pilots in camp will take you and a buddy up for a plane ride over the playa. You'll also receive a sticker, a kozy, a shirt and a pendant!



A WORD FROM THE ROD

I love mutant vehicles. Probably what inspires me most artistically at BRC are the art cars. I've always wanted to build one. And I want it to be big. Big so there's room for new friends. More mutant vehicles equal more fun. More Rock music equals more fun. The Bonerpillar is here to offer The Bonerpillar Experience to as many rockers on the playa as possible.

Vote for the Bonerpillar!



FAQ

Q: What madness is this?!

A: The Bonerpillar!


Q: Are you playing all genre of rock?

A: We will do our very best to feature as many different kinds of Rock & Roll as we can! As we get closer to the Burn we will plan several genre specific events/nights/tours etc.


Q: Can I ride?

A: Yes!

THE BUILDERS
Based in Oregon and California, a group of dedicated veteran burners have come together to bring the Bonerpillar vision to the playa. We are co-conspiring to manifest this gift of rock'n'roll in caterpillar form to give back to Black ROCK City. Each contributor has their own journey of connection, transformation and ass-slapping good times that they have personally been gifted with from the dusty depths of the Burning Man community. And now it's time to return the favor in the form of a mind-blowing, face-melting experience. 
Let's get dusty!




HOW ELSE YOU CAN HELP
As a community project based in the atmosphere of gifting, we are encouraging donations of resources!

We're looking for more materials, especially electric guitars and 
bones. We also need: Plywood, lumber, steel stock, propane cylinders and
 more.

We are hosting work parties throughout the summer. If you live 
close and want to be part of the Bonerpillar Erectors, come on down to 
help! 
The best thing you can do for us if you like the Bonerpillar: Share!
 Tell a friend, tell your mom, tell your mom's friend. Share our project
 on your Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and in your community. We look forward to hearing from you!









DONOR-PILLAR PERKS

Look at all the fun things you get when you donate! Not only will you become a critical member of Team Boner, we will also mail you a bunch of crap!
(Be sure to check back for NEW unique perks throughout the campaign.) 
$1 Donation = Boner Hug
Every dollar helps get the Bonerpillar more fire, more lights, more music! Find us on the playa and we will give you a special Boner Hug and a big 'Thank you!'
$6 Donation = Sticker
With a $6 donation, you become an official Donor-pillar! And you get this righteous Bonerpillar sticker along with our sincere gratitude!




$16 Donation = Postcard From the Playa
We will stop rockin' long enough to hand-write a special Bonerpillar Postcard and mail it to you straight from Black Rock City.
$26 Donation = Boner-Kozy 
Keep your beverage cool and classy with our cool and classy Boner-Kozy! Plus a sticker!




$46 Donation = T-Shirt  Receive an organic cotton short sleeve T-shirt with our Boner Creature art by underground comic icon and illustrator Larry Welz, plus a sticker.$66 Donation = Bone PendantBecome a serious Donor-pillar and receive a
 unique, one-of-a-kind wearable piece of art. These resin pendants are 
handmade by us with love, weird bits and lots of tiny 
rodent/lizard/bird bones collected from our local barn owl. The pendant will come on an antiqued-gold ball chain. Here 
are some examples of what you might get:





$126 Donation = Donor-pillar Fun Pack
Can't decide between the kozy, shirt and bone pendant? Get all three with your donation! Plus a sticker!
$266 Donation = Special Gear Pendant Fun Pack
Is the Bone Pendant just not cool enough for you? Then you could be one of the lucky few to receive an extra-special Gear Pendant hand-crafted by Le Rod. Plus the kozy, shirt and sticker! Here are some examples of these unique wear-able art pieces:



$666 Donation = Original Artwork
One lucky person will get to own this original skull painting by our very own artistic genius, KC Welch. Dimensions are 12" x 16" unframed.




$1666 = Plane Ride At Burning Man 2016
Ever see the beauty of Black Rock City from the sky?! One of our pilots in camp will take you and a buddy up for a plane ride over the playa. You'll also receive a sticker, a kozy, a shirt and a pendant! 




A WORD FROM THE ROD

I love
mutant vehicles. Probably what inspires me most artistically at BRC are the art
cars. I've always wanted to build one. And I want it to be big. Big so there's
room for new friends. More mutant vehicles equal more fun. More Rock music equals more
fun. The Bonerpillar is here to offer The Bonerpillar Experience to as many
rockers on the playa as possible. 
Vote for the Bonerpillar! 






FAQ

Q: What madness is this?!
A: The Bonerpillar!


Q: Are you playing all genre of rock?
A: We will do our very best to feature
as many different kinds of Rock & Roll as we can! As we get closer to the
Burn we will plan several genre specific events/nights/tours etc.

Q: Can I ride?
A: Yes!

story:
“If you can dream it, you can do it!” 
– Walt Disney

I’m Luanna, an artist and the founder of Artrvl. We are creators and we strive to make a difference for our life and others alike, above all, we love traveling the world and the fulfillment it brings to us.

Because of a common interest, ART, I survived for one month without money last year after I quit my advertising agency job. My host owned a hotel, she was very helpful and offered me accommodation, food and a drop-off at the airport. If a total stranger can offer me hospitality for one month in exchange of creations, so can the rest of the world!

Traveling liberates our mentality through its unexpected experience, people and difference of culture. Often we stumble fortuitously upon our talents and the things that mean the most to us.

That's how Artrvl was born!There are many creators who are already traveling the world on job assignments, a few are famous, others work through agencies who charge both creators and vendors 50% or more in service fees!

About Artrvl

Artrvl is founded in Hongkong, June 2016, It's an international online network which facilitates all creators solutions to travel the world for free by offering their creative skills. Giving individual and business art appreciators (NOT art buyers) close and exclusive experience to the creation they admire the most and the creative mind behind it by offering their hospitality.

We intend to expand the nomad life into physical world, not only digital. We can contribute and make our world full of art, culture and music, while at the same time promoting art appreciation, breeding art in a receptive and friendly environment.

Imagine your country will become the next most welcoming and art-friendly place. We hope our website will be the beginning of bridge-building to enable talented people to travel the world; to unveil their creations, and to truly enjoy life to the fullest.

But to get the ball rolling, we need your help and support to spread the word, the funds will go to building our MVP, maintaining website, video production, marketing campaign, and events.

Featured in

                                       

The Perks

 

 

International exchange between
creativity and hospitality

 

What type of creators can join?

  • ART: painting, illustration, art installation, wall art, photography, drawing, 3D art, sculpture, paper art, street art, light art, CG art and more 

  • DESIGN: crafts, fashion design, digital, web design, graphic design and more  

  • PERFORM: music, dance, performance and more 

  • VIDEO: film, animation, stop motion and more

 

 

The Website - responsive design

 

How traveling with Artrvl is free

Simple and Reliable

How does it work - for creators

 

  1. login or sign up
  2. Add a new portfolio
  3. overview of all your portfolios
  4. find a gig
  5. apply it with your portfolio
     

How does it work -
for appreciators and commissioners

  1. browse an artist’s portfolio
  2. invite the artist
  3. create a new gig
  4. fill in required information 
  5. Choose what you could offer

     

Our milestone

Our team

 

A Special Thank you goes to

Juri Zaech and his graphic designs that went into our MVP demo

Henryca Citra's illustration, Emi Haze's illustration to represent our MVP

Trevor Powers (aka Youth Lagoon)'s AFTERNOON as our demo background music

FAQ

  • Q: What if I can’t provide accommodation, food or transportation, can I still invite artists?
    A: Yes, the options are mandatory, but you have the choice to give cash instead, which equals the local mid-range living standard. 
  • Q: How many countries can I travel to through Artrvl?
    A: Artrvl support all creative activity and traveling in all countries, some countries requires visas, guides or convoy, you can refer to nomadlist.com or loneyplanet.com to check essential travels information, cost of living, best time to go, time zone, weather, traffic, food, visa, health & safety & insurance and the likes.
  • Q: How can Artrvl ensure my safety?
    A: We have a function to let everyone verify themselves by linking their passport and credit card to their profile, we won’t store any information or charge anything meanwhile we make sure everyone’s account is linked to their social network, You can get to know the hosts and creators through their profile, comments and their ratings from previous gigs, use our messaging feature to message the other party any questions and get to know them better.
  • Q: How is the offer determined for my invitation?
    A: cost of accommodation, cost of food, cost of local transportation, these are determined by algorithm and are automatically calculated once you fill in your gig information. Artrvl only charges a service fee when your gig is confirmed. Of course the more you offer, the more likely your gig would attract more talented people.
  • Q: How does Artrvl process payment?
    A: Our payment system is designed to make transferring money between creators and hosts as simple and reliable as possible. Here’s how it works:
    1. Once a gig is confirmed between both parties, host prepays Artrvl to lock the deal.
    2. Our punishment towards cancelation is strict, this way we will keep Artrvl community healthy and responsible.
    3. Once a gig is accomplished and reviewed, if cash is involved, the funds will automatically go to creators’ account.
  • Q: What’s Artrvl’s cancelation rules? If I get invited for a gig and the other person cancels it at last minute?
    A: If you cancel a gig at least 48 hours before it starts, you will get refunded except the service fee; If your cancel a gig less than 48 hours, then it’s nun-refundable. If you are a creator and cancel a gig less than 48 hours, your rating will drop by one star which will affect your future invitation.
     

Join our community in Facebook and Signup

Artrvl Facebook Page

Once a gig is accomplished and reviewed, if cash is involved, the funds will automatically go to creators’ account.

story:
My name is Eva and I am the owner/operator of Tucumcari Tarot. I have been using cards for divination for over 20 years - but sometimes struggle to find decks that I connect with. Two years ago I decided that if I wanted the deck I envisioned that I needed to create it myself! So Tiamat Design Company was born.

The Delphi Oracle deck will be our third deck creation, but our first oracle deck. It features art from Christos Karapanos, an amazing artist from Greece paying special attention to details.

What We Need

We need your help to create this deck as we want it. Previous decks were created by me, but I'll be the first to admit that my artistic talents are limited! Funding for this deck will cover the following:

  • Artist Design Fees (60% of the cost)
  • Publishing Costs
  • Shipping Costs

What You Get

The standard deck specs are as follows:

  • Large Sized cards at 3.5" x 5.75"
  • Full color front and back
  • Printed on 300gsm smooth card stock with blue core
  • 25 cards in base deck
  • LWB (little white book) with card meanings
  • Shrinkwrapped with silk bag



The Artwork

Here is a peek at my favorite card so far - more cards will be revealed as we approach fully funded. For more examples of Christos Karapanos's work visit his website at  http://christos.cgarena.com/


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Help us to get the word out and make some noise about our deck.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
- SÉANCERS -

A PERFORMANCE CYCLE

BY JAAMIL OLAWALE KOSOKO

 

My name is Jaamil Olawale Kosoko. I am an American artist and curator working internationally on creative projects that relate to spirituality, identity, and body based performance. I am a 2017 Princeton Arts Fellow and Lecturer, a 2017 Jerome Artists in Residence at Abrons Arts Center, a 2017 APAP Leadership Fellow, and a 2017 Cave Canem Poetry Fellow. 

I am raising money to close the funding gap of a multi-tiered series of interdisciplinary projects launching this year. With your support, over the next several months my team and I will: 

  • premiere the new short film: WHITE STATE | BLACK MIND, The Making of #negrophobia
  • record a series of new and selected poems. 
  • publish the essay WHITE STATE | BLACK MIND
  • conduct a series of international creative residencies in Pennsylvania, Belgium, Munich, Vermont, and NYC. 
  • create and present the World Premiere of the new live performance, SÉANCERS opening in Dec. 6-9, 2017 in NYC.

 

My work attempts to make plain often invisible systems of power, assumptions and cultural categories through abstract, oblique, and alternative readings of society. 

Questions will include asking how we engage choreographic structures that resist determining who we think others are, and how we expand the notion (offer more context or framing) of the 'blink', the 'gaze', 'perception' of self in relation to others. I anticipate an engaged and active program of reading, perceiving, observing and witnessing. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $5000 to support artist and material fees related to producing these events. All proceeds go to paying my awesome team of designers and performers. It will help us travel to present our ongoing European tour of #negrophobia in Munich and Brussels, as well as conduct creative residencies to finish the piece. We are thankful for the institutional support we have received and need this last push to meet our goal.

story:
WHAT IS BEYOND THE SURFACE?

We were attracted to the idea of portals that exist in our everyday lives.  Infinity mirrors open the gates into such portals.  These mirrors reflect the infinite depths of our souls, and these portals act as visual gateways into those depths.

Burning Man is the stage, the desert the backdrop, and the infinity mirror is the doorway for our subconscious to liberate themselves from each of us.  In this way, we can see beyond the surface and unveil the truth in this world...

 

WHO ARE WE?

Zac, Phil, and James for starters. The three of us have combined experience in large-scale installations, architecture, programming, and engineering. We are currently pursuing Master's degrees in Integrated Product Design at the University of Pennsylvania.

 

HOW WILL WE DO IT?

Beyond The Surface is an immersive room where every wall and ceiling is filled with infinity mirrors. What is an infinity mirror, you ask? Here is one:

We will have 150 of these babies, so get pumped up!

There will be a number of lighting effects that will be activated by human interaction. We have built loads of prototypes to see what is possible and how radical we can make them.

Here are a couple pieces we placed around the UPenn campus:

 

As you can probably assume, the pieces above are made with static LEDs. HOWEVER, Beyond The Surface will have some more riveting effects that we have prototyped below:

 

Here is an example of how these will interact on the entire installation:

 

 

We plan on implementing effects like the ones shown above along with others to make sure there is something new to see on each day of the Burn.

 

NOW, WHY WOULD YOU HELP US?

As we mentioned, we are looking to raise $10,000 to make this gem sparkle like a clear summer's night. We want to create a memorable experience for people and really open their imaginations to how you can interact with technology to create something inspiring. Let's give ya the breakdown:

  • $1500 - Acrylic
  • $1500 - Steel
  • $1500 - LEDs
  • $1100 - Overhead
  • $1000 - Electronics
  • $500 - Wood
  • $500 - Mirror film/application solution
  • $500 - Consumables
  • $500 - Hardware
  • $500 - Transportation
  • $500 - Perks
  • $400 - Generators

We understand that sometimes these projects don't reach their funding goals, but every contribution is an enormous help that will allow us to bring the full functionality of Beyond The Surface to the playa.

 

STRETCHHHHHH GOALS!

Our current design of Beyond The Surface is going to be pretty dang neat. However, if we happen to raise more money than our goal, we have a few snazzy items in mind to add to the installation:

$15,000 -> If we hit this target, we will add a fully reflective floor to Beyond The Surface, adding another element of infinite illumination.

$17,500 -> If we hit this target, we will add speakers that will project sound programmed to compliment the lighting effects within the room.

$20,000 -> If we manage to really surprise the s*** out of ourselves and hit this, we will add all of the components above, PLUS infinity themed furniture within the space where burners can lounge and enjoy the show.

 

CURRENT STATUS...

We have begun fabrication of the pixels (AKA infinity mirrors) and the structure of Beyond The Surface, as well as the programming of our lighting effects.

 

 

 

As mentioned previously, the three of us have extensive experience in large-scale manufacturing, as well as project management. Additionally, our team has calculated for mishaps and troubleshooting as to mitigate any delays in the production of Beyond The Surface. We are confident we will complete construction and testing by August 15th, allowing us extra time to play with lighting effects and ensure proper functionality.

 

THE RADICAL TEAM!

 

Zac Bensing

I love building trippy stuff. I'm formally trained as a mechanical engineer, yet passionately trained as an artist of many mediums. Creating an installation for Burning Man has been a dream of mine for years and being able to watch this piece bring enjoyment to others is going to be the reward I look forward to most. Let's get wild, peace!

 

Phil Chang

I'm interested in how technology and design can create memorable experiences.  Burning Man has given me the opportunity to explore this further with Beyond the Surface.   A former architectural designer and now a product designer, I enjoy designing and building things at all scales.  Never one to shy away from learning new things, I've lately been exploring developing firmware for consumer electronics, creative coding, and learning the blues on the harmonica.  Please don't ask me to perform....yet.

James Sannino

I'm an MIT nerd turned technologist/designer based in Philly. I've been creating interactive installations for art and science for 7 years in the museum world. I'm gonna blow your pixelated mind with infinite recursion!

FOLLOW US ON INSTAGRAM FOR DAILY UPDATES AT:

                                                        beyondthesurface2017

story:
Hi everyone! If you're here, you probably know that making these calendars is one of the highlights of my year. Not only are these calendars a great way to keep track of the spectacular year to come, they make a great awkward gift for coworkers and friends! 

It all started about six years ago when my friend Katie took a photo of me standing around naked during a swim break while on a kayak trip in Florida. Starting with that photo I began amassing a collection of naked photos all over this beautiful land we call America. I published a calendar of my favorite 12 and handed them out as mostly unwanted Christmas gifts that year. Since then I have published a calendar every year.

This one is extra special: featuring 12 photos, some solo and some group shots, from my recent raft trip down the Colorado River through the massive ditch we call the Grand Canyon with a lovely group of friends. 

Buy one today so I can SEND IT! 

Any remaining funds after orders are all filled will be donated to the National Parks Foundation.
