story:
Ogni viaggio ha una storia da raccontare e può portare a nuove amicizie o a rinsaldarne di vecchie.

Siamo Federico e Mattia coltiviamo e condividono la passione per l'arte, la grafica e il design. Amici di vecchia data, abbiamo intrapreso percorsi che ci hanno portati ad allontanarci e poi riavvicinarci a distanza di anni.

Sono Federico cresciuto nei quartieri centrali di Verona, Fotografo e Web Designer alla continua ricerca del modo migliore con cui interpretare la realtà nei miei scatti, nei miei viaggi trovo ispirazione attraverso l'obiettivo della mia affezionata Reflex. Influenzato da sempre dai grandi nomi della fotografia, le qualità che caratterizzano i miei lavori sono i ricordi, le emozioni e la passione per questa forma d'arte.



"In ogni scatto, immortalo un momento irripetibile nella storia e nel tempo." (Federico)

Sono Mattia, grande estimatore dell'ora del tè  e di uno stile British d’altri tempi, Veronese di nascita e viaggiatore da sempre. Dopo aver realizzato che la progettazione di Video Games per me non era altro che un interesse passeggero, ho iniziato a coltivare la passione per il Design. Dopo la Laurea in Design Industriale, continuo a inseguire il desiderio di lasciare un segno del mio passaggio nelle case in cui ho il piacere di poter progettare gli arredi e gli interni di lusso.

"Nulla è impossibile, a meno che tu non lo voglia." (Mattia)

Il nostro lavoro e la voglia di viaggiare ci hanno portati a vistare quasi tutto il mondo, permettendoci di assaporare cibi deliziosi, respirare profumi taglienti, tornando ogni volta con una nuova storia da raccontare attraverso la nostra passione.

Incontrarsi nuovamente a distanza di anni e raccontarsi le esperienze fatte ci ha portati all’idea di realizzare un sogno comune: condividere i nostri ricordi e fare in modo che esperienze e emozioni vissute possano lasciare un segno anche in chi guarda. 

Siamo circondarti da ricordi di un passato lontano, raccontato con gli occhi di scrittori famosi, poeti ed artisti internazionali che hanno rappresentato a loro modo le mille sfaccettature della bellezza. 
 

LA NOSTRA ARTE LA NOSTRA PASSIONE.

Qual'è il posto che meglio ti rappresenta? Quale stile? sei Più URBAN o POLYGON, più RIBELLE o ASTRATTO ?
In quale città ti sei innamorato, sotto quale statua hai perso la cognizione del tempo ammirandola? Sono queste le domande alle quali ti invitiamo a rispondere per poter scegliere la grafica che meglio ti 


DOVE SEI?


Qual'è la tua città di origine, Verona, Milano, Parigi, New York, Praga?
Per noi, sono tutte importanti, ma quello che conta di più è l'emozione che ti ha trasmesso. La statua della Fontana di Trevi, la Torre Eiffel, vogliamo farti rivivere quell'emozione, quella prima volta.
Amiamo le forme urbane che le città creano espandendosi sempre più, quelle architetture maestose che spiccano su tutto il resto, vogliamo riportarti là dove, forse, hai lasciato un pezzo di te stesso.


COME CREIAMO OPERE UNICHE.


Viaggiando per il mondo, possiamo confrontarci con molteplici realtà, possiamo respirare gli stessi profumi che hai respirato tu durante il viaggio ultimo a Parigi, possiamo assaggiare un croissant nel chiosto sotto la Eiffel Tower e scattare una foto. Osserviamo i piccoli dettagli del luogo, parliamo con le persone che ci indicano, quali sono per loro i luoghi importanti della città, del loro mondo.
Una volta ritornati in studio, rielaboriamo il materiale, correggendo, colori ed esposizione delle luci, per poi poterci inserire il tocco personale di YOLOIN, la grafica che contraddistingue i nostri Foto Quadri, trasformando un semplice "click" della fotocamera, in un'opera d'arte creata per te.
Le stampiamo su tela e le intelaiamo, pronto per la spedizione. Vogliamo che tu possa rivivere le emozioni che forse avevi messo in un cassetto dei ricordi, quando aprirai la confezione che ti verrà consegnata.
 


LE COLLEZIONI.

 

 

 

 

 

 

URBAN:  fotografie di architetture, opere d'arte, sculture, vie, strade, scorci, paesaggi di tutto il mondo.
POLYGON:  la parte astratta di YOLOIN , un'immagine realistica portata all'estremo con colori e forme dalle quali si possono generare molte interpretazioni.


L' EDIZIONI LIMITATA


Abbiamo creato delle opere speciali, in edizione limitata per Indiegogo. La particolarità è che il soggetto principale lo sceglierai tu, sarà proprio la tua foto preferita ad esser rielaborata e stampata, come una vera e propria opera d'arte.
Sarai tra i fortunati che potranno appendere alla parete di casa tua o del tuo ufficio un'opera che sicuramente invidiata.


I DETTAGLI FANNO LA DIFFERENZA


Ogni tela, verrà timbrata ad inchiostro sul retro. Non perché vogliamo esser vanitosi, ma perché vogliamo offrire un prodotto di qualità, con quelle particolarità e quei dettagli che possano fare la differenza una volta che scarterete e toccherete con mano le nostre opere. Ogni particolare verrà curato nei minimi dettagli, voi siete importanti per noi e vogliamo giustamente, coccolarvi.



 


PERCHE' INDIEGOGO?

 


Per la realizzazione delle tele, sono impiegate delle tecnologie per le quali, le grandi quantità sono indispensabili, seppur, vogliamo mantenere una qualità alta del nostro prodotto per poter soddisfare i nostri intenditori al 100%.
Le lavorazioni sono manuali per piccoli volumi ma con l'obiettivo di raggiungere un numero sempre maggiori di persone, bisogna pensare anche all'industrializzazione del prodotto, il che, non vuol dire grande quantità poca qualità, ma significa esportare la bellezza e far felici più, persone e quella persona, potresti esser proprio tu.
Il tuo supporto ci aiuterà ad avviare una linea di produzione e poter ampliare la famiglia di YOLOIN in tutto il mondo e poterci affidare a professionisti nel settore della stampa, della digitalizzazione e del marketing.

Aiuteremo sempre più persone ad abbellire i propri ambienti, domestici e/o lavorativi, creando ogni volta delle atmosfere indimenticabili e invidiabili. 

Il tuo SUPPORTO è PREZIOSO per aiutarci a far diventare la nostra passione un lavoro vero e proprio, per incrementare cosi le ore spese a fare quello che più ci piace.

Grazie!
Mattia e Federico

story:
The Story

Hello Everyone !

We are building an Art Car for this year's Burning Man 2017 !!

  • We are Campi Camp, a camp that has been in Black Rock City since 2009;
  • We are now ready for another Small Step and would like to contribute to the community on the Playa by Gifting a Magic Art Car for everyone to enjoy, Music, Lights, Love;
  • Only you can help us make this dream come true for All!

What Needs to be Done & What You Get

The break down for folks in the know:

  • Transportation Logistics: one way Paris-Oakland of 27 custom-made LED light tubes- L 2.5 meters x ø 15 cm x 10.5 kg each; and round trip Oakland-Black Rock City of the Art Car
  • Vehicle Repairs: transmission, heating/cooling system and more
  • Design & Construction: 2D, 3D, Technical Drawings & Construction Documents, Welding, Engineering Consulting for lights and sound, and more
  • Sound System: 10k watts of Danley Sound
  • Other: accessories, paint and other details
  • Come and ride with us, or pick one of the perks: a picture, a mug, your name engraved on a metal plaque, or even gift an actual custom-made LED light tube Tube. Or a huge Thank You!!!
  • The funds are all going to the art car restoration and sound quality improvement, whatever amount we manage to raise.

The Impact

This campaign is about finally bringing the beautiful spirit of Campi Camp deep into the Playa with its great music, art, and diverse community.

  • We'd Love to share this magnificent art&sound and show the world what we can achieve when we put our efforts together.
  • We have successfully brought 2 art pieces to the Playa in the past and we're waiting to bring an art piece on wheels this summer.
  • This is a long term project, since the Cuddle Shuttle, with further improvements, will be heading there every year. So, whether or not you're coming this year you will see it shine and hear its beats out there in the future.

Risks & Challenges

If we don't get the amount that we're looking for, the art car will run with less tubes and the sound system will not be as powerful.

  • We are working hard to keep costs as low as possible
  • We re working in sync with some of the best art car builders in the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any contribution is helpful! If you cannot contribute, please share with your family and friends and help us make some noise about our campaign.

Thank you for everything!

story:
AESTHETICS OF SICKNESS - BOOK RELEASE

‘Aesthetics of Sickness - The Gore Archetypes’ brings together the filthiest and most gruesome metal cover albums ever been released. With lyrics, bands, artists interviews, commentary, photos and artwork. The volume also includes high profile blood artists.

Flesh & Blood artists interviews: Hermann Nitsch, Andres Serrano, Jordan Eagles, Vincent Castiglia, Neal Auch, Dr Rev Mayers, Jen Lewis, Maxime Taccardi, Ryan Almighty, Body Worlds (TBC).

Metal artists interviews: Aditia Wardhana, Alex Horley, Andriy Tkalenko, Arthur Ryabov, Costin Chioreanu, Gyula Havancsák, Joachim Luetke,  Lordigan Pedro Sena, Marcelo Vasco, Mike Hrubovcak, Remy Cuveillier, Tony Koehl.

Bands interviews: Cannibal Corpse, Carcass, Napalm Death, Exodus, Avulsed, Asphyx, Desecration.

100 artists with 100 bands on 100 releases

Including: Exhumed, Aborted, Cryptopsy, Autopsy, Cradle of Filth, Municipal Waste, Dismember, Obituary, Death Angel, Six Feet Under, Decapitated, Sodom, Rage, Accept, Macabre and lots more.

Print specifications

  • Bloodstained (Ethically sourced) 
  • Meat packet 
  • Square Hardback 22cm x 22cm 
  • Collected in one deluxe volume 
  • Printed on high gloss 150gm paper 
  • 200 Pages 
  • Limited Edition 
  • Hand numbered and embossed

Corpse set contents

Aesthetic of Sickness Book

  • Human Anatomy Figures
    • 11 inch (30cm) Male & Female Anatomy Model Figure for Anatomical Medical Study
    • Half-skin, half-ecorche with great detailing for muscle structure
    • Material: Resin
    • Colour: White
  • Life size zombi hand of The Holy of Saint Stephen
  • Bulb Douche Enema Colonic clense
  • Blood splattered Rameseys apron
  • Stainless steel urethral penis plug keyring
  • Meat socks
  • Beelzepoop with flies
  • Blood syringe pen
  • Feortan black surgical face mask
  • Black latex fisting gloves
  • Heavy Music Artwork issue 8
  • Heavy Music Artwork issue 9

HEAVY MUSIC ARTWORK - #9 VOL.3

Heavy Music Artwork volume 3 issue 9 comes with a new format and style. Focusing more on what we know the best music and art. There are no more themes so we can move freely in the domain of creativity letting bands and artists express their views unrestricted.

Bands interviews: Deicide, Bloodbath, Monstrosity, Gruesome, Revocation, Unleashed, Conan, Korpiklaani, Mantar, MaYan, Lucifer, Chthonic, Entombed A.D., Voivod, Ken Mode, Horrendous, Terrorizer.

Bands interviews: Antï Graphic, Ester Segara, Vincent Fouquet, Alex Tartsus, Uwe Jarling, Juanjo Castellano Rosado, J.L. Rey Phlegeton, Stefan Todorović

Print specifications

  • Ethically sourced and FSC approved and using vegetable-based inks
  • Limited edition of 666 units hand numbered and stamp embossed
  • Perfect PUR binding on 250gsm (cover) Offset Paper
  • 100 pages
  • 1700 Total units printed 

    What We Need & What You Get

    Your contribution will help us release our 9th Heavy Music Artwork magazine and 'Aesthetics of Sickness' book. Is also a way to pre-sell before it hits the stores around the world. We are looking to raise a base of £3,000. This will help us with the release of the magazine and of course help with bills, etc.

    This is an estimate of our costs and where the funds will go towards

    • 30% Production costs
    • 20% Marketing
    • 18% Overheads
    • 25% Printing costs
    • 5% Campaign fees

    Vision & Mission

    • End post-modernism
    • Promote graphic artists, music artists
    • Entice people to explore and experience life within the arts
    • Examine through music, art, and literature all aspects of the human condition

    The Impact

    • Your contributions will not only benefit us as a publisher but the artists and the metal community as a whole
    • We are dedicated to having our publications in places where you wouldn't normally see a metal magazine like art galleries and museums
    • Our work has helped young artists getting the attention they deserve as well as getting paid jobs from bands

    About Heavy Music Artwork

    Heavy metal is one of the most relevant and influential art forms and it must be celebrated as such, Heavy Music Artwork is the first to make this statement. Since our launch www.heavymusicartwork.com great popularity, reaching nearly 1 million page views, and 25,000+ monthly visitors. Promoted via all HMA social networks 80K+ Followers. Newsletter to 12K HMA email subscribers. We also have an online store where you can buy directly from us www.heavymusicartwork.bigcartel.com

    Libraries and Universities

    Labels and PRs

    Debemur Morti Productions, Lion Music, Mascot Group, Pitch Black Records, Snapper Music, SPV, Warner Music, Svart Records, Adrenaline PR, Asher Media, Audacious PR, Clawhammer PR, Cosa Nostra, Devil PR, Dewar PR, Domino Media, Duff Press, Earsplit, Factory Music, Fly PR, Future PR, I Like Press, Noble PR, Noise Cartel, Old Empire, Perfect Storm PR, Pioneer Music Press, Publicity PR, Rarely Unable, Red Sand PR, Savage Gringo, Scream Promotion, Silverblack, Stampede Press, Speakeasy PR, Stereo Sanctity, Team All About The Music, Visible Noise, Wilful Publicity and Work Hard PR.

    What are the risks?

    As with any project, there are risks involved in releasing a publication. We might not be able to deliver the end product on time, or we might run into problems with the printing and shipping. Our team has over 15 years of delivering creative projects of all sizes and shapes. We are already in the 5th book and 9th magazine release.

    Other Ways you can help

    If you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: Ask your fellow metal head to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Please share and make the world know that metal is art in all its forms.

    Thank you

Heavy Music Artwork issue 9


 HEAVY MUSIC ARTWORK - #9 VOL.3
Heavy Music Artwork volume 3 issue 9 comes with a new format and style. Focusing more on what we know the best music and art. There are no more themes so we can move freely in the domain of creativity letting bands and artists express their views unrestricted.
Bands interviews: Deicide, Bloodbath, Monstrosity, Gruesome, Revocation, Unleashed, Conan, Korpiklaani, Mantar, MaYan, Lucifer, Chthonic, Entombed A.D., Voivod, Ken Mode, Horrendous, Terrorizer.
Bands interviews: Antï Graphic, Ester Segara, Vincent Fouquet, Alex Tartsus, Uwe Jarling, Juanjo Castellano Rosado, J.L. Rey Phlegeton, Stefan Todorović
Print specifications

Ethically sourced and FSC approved and using vegetable-based inks
Limited edition of 666 units hand numbered and stamp embossed
Perfect PUR binding on 250gsm (cover) Offset Paper
100 pages
1700 Total units printed 




What We Need & What You Get
Your contribution will help us release our 9th Heavy Music Artwork magazine and 'Aesthetics of Sickness' book. Is also a way to pre-sell before it hits the stores around the world. We are looking to raise a base of £3,000. This will help us with the release of the magazine and of course help with bills, etc.
This is an estimate of our costs and where the funds will go towards

30% Production costs
20% Marketing
18% Overheads
25% Printing costs
5% Campaign fees


Vision & Mission

End post-modernism
Promote graphic artists, music artists
Entice people to explore and experience life within the arts
Examine through music, art, and literature all aspects of the human condition

The Impact

Your contributions will not only benefit us as a publisher but the artists and the metal community as a whole
We are dedicated to having our publications in places where you wouldn't normally see a metal magazine like art galleries and museums
Our work has helped young artists getting the attention they deserve as well as getting paid jobs from bands

About Heavy Music Artwork
Heavy metal is one of the most relevant and influential art forms and it must be celebrated as such, Heavy Music Artwork is the first to make this statement. Since our launch www.heavymusicartwork.com great popularity, reaching nearly 1 million page views, and 25,000+ monthly visitors. Promoted via all HMA social networks 80K+ Followers. Newsletter to 12K HMA email subscribers. We also have an online store where you can buy directly from us www.heavymusicartwork.bigcartel.com
Libraries and Universities

Labels and PRs

Debemur Morti Productions, Lion Music, Mascot Group, Pitch Black Records, Snapper Music, SPV, Warner Music, Svart Records, Adrenaline PR, Asher Media, Audacious PR, Clawhammer PR, Cosa Nostra, Devil PR, Dewar PR, Domino Media, Duff Press, Earsplit, Factory Music, Fly PR, Future PR, I Like Press, Noble PR, Noise Cartel, Old Empire, Perfect Storm PR, Pioneer Music Press, Publicity PR, Rarely Unable, Red Sand PR, Savage Gringo, Scream Promotion, Silverblack, Stampede Press, Speakeasy PR, Stereo Sanctity, Team All About The Music, Visible Noise, Wilful Publicity and Work Hard PR.
What are the risks?
As with any project, there are risks involved in releasing a publication. We might not be able to deliver the end product on time, or we might run into problems with the printing and shipping. Our team has over 15 years of delivering creative projects of all sizes and shapes. We are already in the 5th book and 9th magazine release.
Other Ways you can help
If you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: Ask your fellow metal head to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Please share and make the world know that metal is art in all its forms.
Thank you

story:
FRANCAIS / ENGLISH

INTRODUCTION :

Pour la 3ème année consécutive, l’association « les amis du manguier » renouvelle son projet de résidence artistique permettant à des artistes de divers horizons de se retrouver un mois à bord du « bateau-givre », afin de bénéficier de condition de création hors du commun et de participer à l’activité culturelle du village d’Aqunnaaq situé à 45 minutes de marche.

https://lemanguier.net/portfolio/artistes-en-arctique/

Faisant parti des heureu.ses.x elu.e.s, c’est avec le plus grand plaisir que je lance cette campagne afin de financer ma participation.

For the third consecutive year, the association "les amis du manguier" renews its project of artistic residence allowing artists from various horizons to live for a month aboard the "bateau-givre", in order to benefit from creative conditions out of their comfort zone and participate in the cultural activity of the village of Aqunnaaq 45 minutes walk away.

https://lemanguier.net/portfolio/artistes-en-ar...

As one of the lucky candidates, it is with great pleasure that I launch this campaign to finance my participation.

PROJET ARTISTIQUE DURANT LA RÉSIDENCE :

Ma recherche plastique s’articule autour du dépassement de l’image en photographie en vue de cristalliser les interactions constitutives de notre identité, de notre environnement et de notre notion de réalité.

Pour les lecteur.rice.s intéressé.e.s, ma problématique de recherche en création contemporaine se trouve en bas de cette page et je serai ravie d’en discuter avec vous si le cœur vous en dit mais pour l’heure allons à l'essentiel.

Afin de vous présenter mon projet, il m’est nécessaire de revenir sur une série précédente « Paquare ».

https://www.sc-camors.com/paquare-metal

Réalisée en 2016, après un volontariat de protection environnementale au Costa Rica. S’inscrivant dans mon projet de recherche en création contemporaine, elle regroupe un ensemble de 20 photographies sur fer brut dont voici quelques exemples.

My plastic research intend to go beyond the image in photography in order to crystallize the interactions that constitute our identity, our environment and our notion of reality.
For interested readers, my research problem in contemporary creation is at the bottom of this page (in French).
In order to present you my project, it is necessary to me to return on a previous series "Paquare".
https://www.sc-camors.com/paquare-metal
Completed in 2016, after an environmental protection volunteering trip in Costa Rica. As part of my research project in contemporary creation, it includes a set of 20 photographs on raw iron, here are some examples.

 

De part sa composition, l’œuvre est donc sujette à l’oxydation et sans précaution de conservation l’oeuvre entamera un lent processus de détérioration jusqu’à son irrémédiable disparition, créant ainsi un effet miroir avec notre environnement menacé qui plus que jamais nécessite que nous changions nos comportements

Le très bon accueil qu’à reçu cette série auprès d’institutions publiques et privées (je remercie d’ailleurs la Galerie Agama, Toulouse université, le Quai des Savoirs et le HDLU muséum de Zagreb) m’a permis de rencontrer de nombreu.se.x visiteurs afin de les sensibiliser à mon projets et aux enjeux me tenant à cœur.

Encouragée par les retours positifs, je souhaite poursuivre mes travaux dans d’autres environnements menacés par l’activité humaine et l’Arctique en tant que lieu emblématique des effets néfastes du réchauffement climatique est une destination toute indiquée.

Outre la production d’une nouvelle série de photographie sur fer brut « AASIAAT », cette résidence sera l’occasion d’un partage avec la population locale, me permettant d’animer des ateliers artistiques mais surtout d’appréhender les problématiques environnementales des hommes et femmes pour qui le réchauffement climatique est vécu au quotidien.

Due to its composition, the work is therefore subject to oxidation and without precaution of conservation the work will begin a slow process of deterioration until its irremediable disappearance, thus  a mirror effect is created with our threatened environment that more than ever requires that we change our behaviors.
The very good reception of this series from public and private institutions (I thank the Agama Gallery, Toulouse University, the Quai des Savoirs and the HDLU Museum Zagreb) allowed me to meet many visitors to make them aware of my projects and issues that are important to me.
Encouraged by the positive feedbacks, I wish to continue my work in other environments threatened by human activity and the Arctic as an emblematic place of the harmful effects of global warming is a perfect destination.
In addition to the production of a new series of photography on raw iron "AASIAAT", this residence will be an opportunity to share with the local population, allowing me to lead artistic workshops but especially to understand the environmental issues of men and women for whom global warming is lived every day.

 

LE FINANCEMENT :

Le montant sollicité ne couvrant que la moitié de la participation aux frais de vie à bord du Manguier (2500€), du transport (1500€) et de l’achat d’équipement adapté au grand froid (500€), n’hésitez pas à me soutenir une fois le but atteint.

Cette campagne n’est pas sur le mode de financement « tout ou rien », ainsi vous recevrez votre contrepartie même si elle n’atteint pas la somme requise.

Chaque contribution, même modeste, compte énormément pour moi …

N'hésitez pas à partager cette campagne ! ;)

The requested amount  covering only the half of  the participation in living expenses aboard the Manguier (2500 €), the transportation (1500 €) and the purchase of equipment adapted to the cold (500 €), don't hesitate to support me once the goal is reached.
This campaign is not in the "all-or-nothing" mode, so you will receive your perks even if it does not reach the required amount.
Every contribution, however modest, counts enormously for me ...
Feel free to share this campaign! ;)

LES CONTREPARTIES :

J’aurais souhaité pouvoir vous tenir informé en temps réel, vous distiller en direct un peu de cette aventure boréale, mais nos conditions de vie rendrons l'accès à internet peu fréquent et surtout en débit très réduit. Cependant, si cela m’est techniquement possible je vous enverrai le plus régulièrement possible des nouvelles de ce périple.

Je propose en contrepartie de votre soutient les fruits de ma résidence. Celle ci ayant lieu du 2 au 30 avril 2019 il ne me sera pas possible de vous les présenter avant la fin de la campagne.

C’est donc une contrepartie « à l’aveugle », mais pour chaque tirage je vous ferai parvenir au préalable un catalogue numérique vous permettant de choisir votre photographie.

Vous pouvez cependant voir ma série "Paquare" ici: https://www.sc-camors.com/paquare-metal

I propose in return for your support the production done during this residence. it takes place from April the 2th to the 30th 2019, thus it will not be possible for me to present  you before my work he end of the campaign.
It is therefore a  "blind" perks, but for each print I will send you before a digital catalog allowing you to choose your photograph.
You can however see my series "Paquare" here: https://www.sc-camors.com/paquare-metal

DERNIÈRES NOUVELLES :

Parce que la médiatisation est toujours importante voici les dernières nouvelles de « Paquare » qui semblent être de bonnes augures pour AASIAAT :

- Chronique dans le numéro 87 fev/mars 2019 d’Aesthetica https://issuu.com/aesthetica_magazine/docs/e-issue_87___issuu?e=5376688%2F67404697&fbclid=IwAR3XfykXvd58KsplwzP6jZjKF3L7iGP2ogH8xC_tCGiqPUzf6ZgPI1r23Dg

-  Finaliste du YICCA International contest of contemporary Art

 

MERCI A TOUS !

 

PS : LA RECHERCHE EN CRÉATION CONTEMPORAINE :

 

Comme promis, pour ceux qui souhaitent un peu de lecture, voici plus de détail sur ma problématique de recherche.

 

Avant propos :

Nous vivons dans une société où les inégalités font rages et où les droits les plus élémentaires sont constamment remis en question, voir bafoués. Manifestations contre l’avortement, recrudescences des agressions homo et transphobe, inégalités salariales entre les hommes et les femmes, manifestation d’hostilité envers les réfugiés de guerre, les exemples sont si nombreux qu’une page ne saurait tous les répertorier. Notre écosystème lui même est désormais tellement menacé par l’activité humaine, que cette dernière décennie a vu l’émergence d’un nouvel exercice transdisciplinaire étudiant l’effondrement de notre civilisation : la collapsologie.

C’est un monde de paradoxe, ou le mal être généralisé s’exprime souvent violemment, notamment au travers des replis identitaires des nations. En France, le rassemblement national obtient toujours davantage de voix, mais nous pouvons constater cette tendance dans de nombreuses autres nations (Etats-unis, Royaume-uni, Brésil, Turquie pour en citer quelques uns. Un monde de paradoxe car, parallèlement à la déréliction des populations et à la destruction de notre planète, se dresse les multinationales toutes puissantes et leur dictature du bonheur, de l’esthétisation à outrance, du divertissement de masse et de l’ hyperconsommation. Le capitalisme cognitif ou capitalisme artiste colonise jusqu’à la moindre parcelle de temps de cerveau disponible, tentant de transformer sans vergogne nos neurones en part de marché.

C’est l’ère de l’économie libidinale qui, comme l’explique Bernard Stiegler, organise et produit du désir en détruisant la conscience, induisant ainsi une destruction du désir. Cette stase artificielle dans un état de félicité illusoire constitue une entrave au processus d’individuation personnelle et collective. Pourtant, comme le dis très justement ce dernier, si nous voulons faire face aux défis écologiques et sociaux qui se dressent devant nous, « Nous savons que, dans les décennies qui viennent, la Terre et ses habitants, les êtres humains, devront faire preuve comme jamais -individuellement et collectivement- de l’intelligence du monde et du sens des responsabilités qui, en principe, les définissent comme être humains plutôt que comme des limaces ubuesque ».

Ces symptômes paradoxaux se retrouvent également dans le monde de l’Art contemporain, investi massivement par l’esthétique du banal, de l’absurde, du morbide ou du kitch. Les expositions et lieu de diffusions se multiplient, ce qui pourrait sembler à priori être une évolution positive, si ce développement ne donnait pas naissance à une uniformisation et à la constitution d’une élite restreinte diffusée massivement dans les musées du monde ou vendus dans les salles d’enchères prestigieuse. La photographie, que la doxa populaire a longtemps tenu à l’écart , n’échappe pas à ce phénomène.

 

Problématique :

Dans notre société du capitalisme cognitif (ou capitalisme artiste), où l’appauvrissement de l’individuation psychique et collective nous conduit à nous désengager toujours plus de nos responsabilités dans l’établissement d’une société durable, l’Art doit, selon moi, plus que jamais interroger le spectateur sur son impact et son pouvoir d’action sur la société.

La photographie, Art de l’image par excellence, montre, suggère, compose mais peut présenter certaines limites quant à l’interaction entre l’auteur, l’œuvre, le spectateur et l’environnement.

Dans ce contexte, comment dépasser l’image en photographie, en vue cristalliser les interactions constitutives de notre identité, de notre notion de réalité et de notre environnement?

story:
About The Founder

Hello, my name is Denny Hunter. I’m the founder of Artobotic; A project to make fine art accessible to the general public via the use of vending machines in public spaces. It’s been going for three years and our mission of making art accessible has been successful. We take fine art out of the gallery space and make it available in your local pub, barber shop or cafe for a fraction of the cost of what you would pay in an uptown gallery.

I’m a humble technician and you’ll usually find me in the lighting cupboard of a council run art centre but I’m also an artist myself and I believe that art can be a crucible where the very fundamental components of ideas are formed. Brexit Art Machine is one such crucible; A simple pillar type, vintage vending machine filled with art by some of the most distinguished artists from the UK along with the very cream of our emerging talent who have made signed and editioned artworks that reflect their own view of Brexit and what it might mean to them personally.

Brexit Art Machine is a representation of ALL artists from all walks of life and the more funding we receive from this project, the further the machine will travel as an artwork in itself. Our hope is to get this machine as far into the heart of the political sphere as possible and hopefully to inform decision makers through the medium of ART. 

What We Need 

We need enough funds to send B.A.M on a rollercoaster journey over The UK with enough funds to feed, and house two B.A.M staff over this period along with all the other costs involved in such an undertaking. This will mean:

  • Machine & transformation = £700
  • Petrol funds & other transport costs = £800
  • Hostel funds = £60 per night (for two people B&B) = £600
  • Insurance Of Artwork = £60 for 10 day period 
  • Food & drink for staff = £40 per day per person = £800
  • Miscellaneous fund= £500 to cover the unexpected such as breakdowns and /or repair of the machine.

So the total that we would need is £3460 for a ten day tour for two people and the machine. If we receive less than this we will shave days off from the tour for example, if we receive half of this amount we will only tour the machine for 5 days but make sure that we include our main objectives like The Scottish Parliament, Welsh Assembly and Westminster. If we receive more than this amount then the funds will be split amongst the artists involved and Artobotic to further continue our endeavour of making art accessible to the public.

What You Get

​We want to mix this up a little and make this as exciting for you as possible, so for this limited time only we will be offering you an exclusive chance to own signed, limited edition artwork by some of the UK’s most distinguished artists like Unskilled Worker (Helen Downie) , Ai WeiWei , Banksy Magda Archer or Hello The Mushroom from the comfort of your own home.

These special works will be interspersed with artwork by our larger pool of emerging talent and will be vended at random by a celebrity on the day of the 29th March 2019. So there is a very good chance that you could get something worth far more than the £25 + p&p that you spent!

There are also options for gifting such as ‘a video of the box being vended from the machine with a bespoke message’, Also - all of our smaller rewards will feature an augmented reality experience to wow your friends with!

The Impact

You will be part of a unique art project designed to unpick very real problems which could influence decision making. Your contribution will go directly towards it’s mileage (every box represents roughly 10 miles on the road). And don’t forget, this project will undoubtedly receive the media attention that you as backers will deserve along with daily updates on how the project is unfolding.

If anyone can pull this off it’s The Artobotic team. We have transformed and toured art machines in this way for over three years and we have been successful in  making art accessible to the public and ‘theming’ them around a particular issue or event, organising artists and managing funds.
story_txt:
About The FounderHello, my name is Denny Hunter. I’m the founder of Artobotic; A project to make fine art accessible to the general public via the use of vending machines in public spaces. It’s been going for three years and our mission of making art accessible has been successful. We take fine art out of the gallery space and make it available in your local pub, barber shop or cafe for a fraction of the cost of what you would pay in an uptown gallery.I’m a humble technician and you’ll usually find me in the lighting cupboard of a council run art centre but I’m also an artist myself and I believe that art can be a crucible where the very fundamental components of ideas are formed. Brexit Art Machine is one such crucible; A simple pillar type, vintage vending machine filled with art by some of the most distinguished artists from the UK along with the very cream of our emerging talent who have made signed and editioned artworks that reflect their own view of Brexit and what it might mean to them personally.Brexit Art Machine is a representation of ALL artists from all walks of life and the more funding we receive from this project, the further the machine will travel as an artwork in itself. Our hope is to get this machine as far into the heart of the political sphere as possible and hopefully to inform decision makers through the medium of ART. What We Need We need enough funds to send B.A.M on a rollercoaster journey over The UK with enough funds to feed, and house two B.A.M staff over this period along with all the other costs involved in such an undertaking. This will mean:
Machine & transformation = £700
Petrol funds & other transport costs = £800
Hostel funds = £60 per night (for two people B&B) = £600
Insurance Of Artwork = £60 for 10 day period 
Food & drink for staff = £40 per day per person = £800
Miscellaneous fund= £500 to cover the unexpected such as breakdowns and /or repair of the machine.
So the total that we would need is £3460 for a ten day tour for two people and the machine. If we receive less than this we will shave days off from the tour for example, if we receive half of this amount we will only tour the machine for 5 days but make sure that we include our main objectives like The Scottish Parliament, Welsh Assembly and Westminster. story:
An Album to the WORLD

My name is Felipe Mejia, I'm musician from Costa Rica.

I'm working on this moment very hard to produce my first professional studio album along with one of my friends from life, Mauricio Delgado, which is the producer, engineer and music college. 

We strongly believe that this album is going to be a watershed in our musician's life and also we are very passionate about this work.

I feel very happy that many people encourage me to to this. They always ask about my next album, So that is the main reason why I'm doing this with a fundraising. 

What We Need & What You Get

So let me break down here a little bit why we need those funds.

First, pursue the original music here in Costa Rica, is very hard, specially when you are doing something different. So I already spent my whole savings to start with this album, but from now I'm totally out of budget.

This album will have 6 songs with different instruments.

We are going to record with a full band: drums, guitars, bass, percussion and voice.

The idea of this campaign is also to include the production of the album, pay the studio, and mix and master with high standards, art for the album, and video clip.

You guys will received an VIP access to this album and the art will have the lyrics in two languages so you can understand better the meaning of the songs: Spanish and English. This whole package will be available to download with an code.

How much is your impact? 

Increase the music business on this country because is very emergent.

I will need to pay to artists and people from here to make this happen.

This album will be available to everyone.

I always enjoyed the meaning of community, so basically this will be a gift that anyone can share.

 

Thank you guys!

story:
On November 8th 2018 a devastating #CampFire burned through my hometown of Paradise, CA. Over 100,000 acres in total have been lost. Hundreds of people are still missing and over 70 have been confirmed dead. This fire decimated my hometown in minutes, without warning. There were no text alerts, no sirens, just people running into the street screaming to tell everyone to get out. My family drove away with nothing but our animals and the clothes on their backs, while the house I grew up in was already engulfed in flames. My entire family lost everything they have ever had in a blink of an eye. The fire is now 100% contained, but the fight is long from over. 

The fire destroyed the town and now people need to rebuild. My family needs to rebuild. My mother is out of places to go and just lost her job. My brother is suffering severe flashbacks and night terrors from barely escaping alive. My sister and her three children with autism don't qualify for FEMA because the apartment she was staying in is still standing, even though it will be months before the town will be open to the public again. And now her landlords, who lost their homes to the fire, are trying to wrongfully evict her in order to move in themselves. My uncle who is blind and has developmental delays had to escape on foot to make it out alive.

My family is in trouble, resources are dwindling. I am living in Boston now. I am a broke artist living in a big city, but wanted to offer help my family in any way I can. I created this #ParadiseStrong design to raise money for them. The mighty Paradise High School Bobcats and the font of the Paradise sign inspired this design. We are #ParadiseStrong.

I will be making stickers, prints and t-shirts as prizes for backing this project. 

My mom, Rebecca, has always been my best friend. My whole life I've watched my mother work so hard. She has never had anything of her own, no stability. And what little she did have is lost to the fire now. I want to give her the gift of a stable home. I also want to get my family all the services they need to heal and grow from this experience. Every dollar raised helps us get closer to that.

story:
What does SL mean?

SL stands for Sematsatsa Library, a name that is in many ways has worked and in others has not worked. 

People often ask me how did I come up with the name and what prompted me to actually call my social enterprise, Sematsatsa Library. The answer is simple. I grew up in a nuclear family, as an only child with my civil servant mum and my teacher dad however, the people I was  mostly surrounded by were women,who in essence in my side of the woods would be called, "Sematsatsa". Till now, the word just stuck with me. 

Later, as I grew older, when the time came to come up with the name, I bound Sematsatsa with a place, positioned in my memory, as a happy place, with the word, Library. And so, this journey has been quite nostalgic in remembering the two spaces and places that encouraged me to express myself, unapologetically and unafraid.  

Therefore the SL Journal  is a space I hope many women will share with each other as well as about each other's work.  With the intent to  document and contribute to the discourse of black voices in the Visual Arts sector, to understand the role of the female artists in relation to the socio -political landscape of Post – Apartheid South Africa as well as explore through conversation and writing the practise of collaboration between  black female artists.

In this first edition of the SL Journal, a lot of work and cooperation has been given and so far, in kind. 

We have worked with many women, as well as men, along the way who have made sure, we have the full support  however we need to step up to the plate to producing a fully fledged publication. 

HOW MUCH DO WE NEED? 

We have determined that to put a journal of this importance in the wake of the discourse of African women's narratives and lives, we'd need an amount of R25 000 as a start.

Together with your contribution, we will be able to commission the women we have started the process with (pictured in our campaign header) on our first edition.  

WHY DO WE DO WHAT WE DO?

The SL Journal has been an idea carried in many ways through the different events that we have hosted as a social business, both online and offline. This time, the premise is motivated with collaboration as our ingredient to a successful literary signifier for women of colour to engage with on a material, creative as well as intellectual level.  

In the past, we have collaborated and co - hosted events with amazing artists specifically writers and by our nature, on women. 

Our most recent event  in Johannesburg at the Visual Arts Network of South Africa, we collaborated with writer and Arts & Culture Editor of Africa is a Country, Neelika. M. Jayawardane  to start a conversation than set the agenda on it. We hope to expand on the sentiments shared during the event with this particular project.  We are fortunate to have her as one of our patrons and contributors to the project. 

HOW CAN YOU HELP US GET THERE?

The SL Journal​ is aimed at starting the conversation on many topics however we cannot do it without the assistance in different forms. These topics involve telling stories that will encourage us, to collectively write the narrative, right. To write the story in total intimacy with our own ideas. 

In most cases, finance is needed to maintain a platform and with finance, many eyes and hands are able to make a creative output that we all can be proud of. 

​​Please read further to see what our Perks entail. Remember, a PERK is a reward you receive for supporting our initiative. 

For starters,

We have partnered with several organisations on the journey, some who are walking with us and others, who have provided us with advise & space to conceptualise our ideas. 

​​People can't all contribute in cash therefore we know that it doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please ask anyone in your network to get the word out and make some noise about our #SLJournal campaign.
  • Find us on FB,twitter and IG : Sematsatsa Library

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Paula Neves, writer and director of True Colors. I'm graduated in Film and I believe that movies were meant to represent us and/or the society we live or once lived in. I also believe people have colors.

"Synesthesia is a neurological phenomenon in which stimulation of one sensory or cognitive pathway leads to automatic, involuntary experiences in a second sensory or cognitive pathway"[Wikipedia].

Can you imagine the taste of your favorite song? The smell of a word? Seeing color in words and letters? That is the case for our lead character, Artur, who has seen shades of orange in everyone around him. Until he meets Lunne. Weird name, weird clothes and shades of blue.

Our goal is to tell a story through the POV of a person with synesthesia. This perspective of story-telling creates a new challenge and edge to the filmmaking process. Taking the simplest experiences and conversations that we have day to day and putting them in the perspective of a synesthetic individual adds a new dimension both visually and audibly.

For some, that means representation. And for others a brand new thing.

What We Need

Support! As you know, the art of filmmaking comes with a cost. We are aiming for a no frills shoot. With the money that we fund, we will us it towards;

- Production Insurance: This ensures that our cast, crew, and equipment is safe. 

- Catering and Craft Services:  A safe, productive, and happy crew is a well fed crew.

- Locations: We have two locations in the script; a coffee shop and a book store. We need each location for one day. (If you know of anyone in the greater LA area that owns a location and would be willing to donate it to us, please let us know! It'd be greatly appreciated.)

- Gear Rentals: Because our short is being told through the 'lens' of an individual with an exceptional perspective, we are looking to rent some special equipment to best portray this experience. This includes camera and additional lenses.

- Additional Expenses: hard drives, expendables, transportation costs for cast, crew, and equipment.

What Do YOU Get

In addition to the opportunity to get to know more about these amazing people and watching an artistic love story, you will also have access a short documentary and production BTS.

Yeah. You read it right: A short documentary.

We’ll have a 2nd unit on set covering behind the scenes and interviews with cast and crew. Plus full research and interview with synesthete people and their art.

The Impact

Synesthesia for some people can mean their whole life, for others is a brand new word and concept.  1 out of 2000 people have synesthesia. One third of them don’t know about it. Feeling represented and connected on the big screen is a reason we make films. 

True Colors goal is to have the audience participate actively in this process. To experience the world and the story in an interesting way. We want the audience to fill in the blanks and notice their own senses being triggered or ignored that usually come without thought.

With the film and the documentary, we most of all want to bring awareness.

Other Ways You Can Help

Social media! Share this project with your friends, family, and co-workers!  Let’s fund a beautiful and engaging story of two complete strangers with different colors.

story:
What is Siren Call?

Last Fall, the five show creators met in Rogelio Martinez's playwriting class at ESPA/Primary Stages where we fell in love with each other’s writing and became convinced that we had the capacity to get stuff done.  We were right!  

Our five stories, filming this summer on a picturesque, ensnare us in the watery world of the Siren.  She’s an elusive and dangerous creature—a Nymph, a Mermaid, a Nereid, a Sylkie—and she beckons us in every seafaring country on Earth. 

Our web series, Siren Call, has two great things going for us right now: a beautiful location in a house on Shelter Island which connects to a beach, and five stories that take a fresh, feminist approach to the classic construct of the Siren. The first season is a seed that we hope will foster more episodes shot around New York’s many waterfronts. We hope to showcase the many actors, writers and directors within our network and continue this poignant series showing three dimensional female characters dealing with supernatural elements that feel mighty yet reminiscent of real life.


Our goal?

To showcase as many female writers, actors and directors as possible (while not ignoring the talented men in our midst!)  To quote the Dramatists Guild report on The Count, an ongoing study to track and push for gender parity in theater: “Only 22% of produced plays are written by women.  If life worked like the theater, four out of five things you’d ever heard would have been said by men.  That means you would have missed a lot, given the kinds of things you learn from women.”  Not to mention Sirens.


Who are we?

The five us are:

We're all co-producing and co-writing this together, and our additional hats are:

Catherine Castellani: Treasurer
Shaun Bennet Fauntleroy: Co-Head of Marketing
Erica Jensen: Head of Casting
Martha Pichey: Location Scout, & Set Designer
Piper Werle: Co-Head of Marketing

You can read our complete bios here! In short, we're five women who are passionate about excellence, vibrant storytelling, and diversity in the arts. 
We take our constraints as creative challenges, not limits. That said we do need money.

Where Your Money Will Go

Paying our talented CAST and CREW! The only thing we love more than working with great artists, is paying great artists.

FOOD for our lovely cast and crew. Creativity is hungry work! 

PERMITS and INSURANCE to keep everything above board

CASTING requires renting a space for Erica to work her casting magic.

WARDROBE & MAKEUP to add the finishing touches on the worlds we've created

TRANSPORTATION to get everyone safely to set.

ART/WEB HOSTING/Marketing

POST-PRODUCTION Editing, color-correction, and sound editing. 

INDIEGOGO'S FEE IndieGoGo takes a fee (4% of our budget if we make our goal, 9% if we don't!) 

Gratitude

Thank you so much for checking out our page! If you've made it this far, you're a kind soul. Have a look at our perks on the right and see how we plan to put our money where our mouth is!

We really appreciate your support, and will definitely keep everyone posted on our progress! Watch this space for casting updates!

We're all co-producing and co-writing this together, and our additional hats are:

Catherine Castellani: TreasurerShaun Bennet Fauntleroy: Co-Head of MarketingErica Jensen: Head of CastingMartha Pichey: Location Scout, & Set DesignerPiper Werle: Co-Head of Marketing

You can read our complete bios here! In short, we're five women who are passionate about excellence, vibrant storytelling, and diversity in the arts. 
We take our constraints as creative challenges, not limits. That said we do need money.

Where Your Money Will Go

Paying our talented CAST and CREW! The only thing we love more than working with great artists, is paying great artists.
FOOD for our lovely cast and crew. Creativity is hungry work! 
PERMITS and INSURANCE to keep everything above board
CASTING requires renting a space for Erica to work her casting magic.
WARDROBE & MAKEUP to add the finishing touches on the worlds we've created
TRANSPORTATION to get everyone safely to set.
ART/WEB HOSTING/Marketing
POST-PRODUCTION Editing, color-correction, and sound editing. 
INDIEGOGO'S FEE IndieGoGo takes a fee (4% of our budget if we make our goal, 9% if we don't!) 
   Gratitude Thank you so much for checking out our page! If you've made it this far, you're a kind soul. Have a look at our perks on the right and see how we plan to put our money where our mouth is!
We really appreciate your support, and will definitely keep everyone posted on our progress! Watch this space for casting updates!

story:
Kwanzaa: 20 Years of Excellence at The Ordway

WE WIN Institute is a nonprofit, community-based organization dedicated to the mission of creating academic and social success for all children. For the last  20 years, through literacy, mentoring, and educational activities, WE WIN has helped thousands of marginalized youth in the Twin Cities here in Minnesota. We give youth an understanding of their rich culture and history, develop their leadership skills, and improve reading and math scores; we help our children become strong, capable adults!

During these past 20 years, WE WIN has used the principles of Kwanzaa through spoken word, dance, drum, visual arts, and storytelling to exhibit the excellence of urban youth of color. Local, national, and international talents have performed with WE WIN youth to teach in artful ways the seven principles of Kwanzaa, which emphasize the importance of speaking with one voice: Umoja (Unity), Kujichagulia (Self-Determination), Ujima (Collective Work and Responsibility), Ujamaa (Cooperative Economics), Nia (Purpose), Kuumba (Creativity), and Imani (Faith). 

 

For the first time, on December 26 at 7:00 pm, we are scheduled to perform at the Ordway! To make it even better, our youth will be joined by some stellar artists: 

  • Sounds of Blackness
  • Thomasina Petrus
  • Tonia Hughes
  • Black Storytelling Alliance
  • Voice of Culture
  • Longshot
  • Tamiko French

And the entire event will be hosted by the great T Mychael Rambo! 

We were expecting a grant for our program at the Ordway, but that fell through. So, we are now turning to all of you as a part of our first crowdfunding campaign to ask you to partner with WE WIN Institute and our youth to make Kwanzaa: 20 Years of Excellence happen! Simply put, without you, the show cannot go on. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

All of the funds raised through this campaign will cover the cost of putting on our show at the Ordway. As appreciation for your support, we are offering some fun perks. Take a look on the right side of your screen. Over there --->

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk for us is that if we do not raise the funds, there will not be a Kwanzaa celebration this year at the Ordway. Nevertheless, we believe that the friends of WE WIN, Ordway, Sounds of Blackness, Thomasina Petrus, Tonia Hughes, Black Storytelling Alliance, Voice of Culture, Longshot, Tamiko French, and T Mychael Rambo are our greatest partners. In other words, we know you got our backs!

Thank you for your support, and please help us to spread the word about this campaign to bring Kwanzaa: 20 Years of Excellence to the Ordway! 

About WE WIN Institute

WE WIN Institute (WE WIN) is a nonprofit, community-based organization dedicated to the mission of creating academic and social success for all children. WE WIN provides a safe and nurturing environment for young people and works to increase parental involvement in the lives of their children and in their child’s schools. WE WIN gives children a base of knowledge in core subjects and assists them in developing the skills that they need to grow into successful and responsible adults. Our programs are focused on giving youth and families tools to create long-term and systemic change in their lives and communities. WE WIN’s program goals are centered on challenging young people to reach their highest potential. We strive to ensure the youth involved in our programs, many of whom are not typically involved in out-of-school time programming, make their communities brighter for the future. Through literacy, mentoring, and educational activities WE WIN strives to achieve these goals:

  • Support the academic, social, emotional, and physical growth of youth participants.
  • Develop the leadership skills of youth through active involvement in WE WIN’s curriculum and through contributions to the community.
  • Provide youth with academic and life readiness skills that help youth succeed in school and in life.

Click here to learn more about the WE WIN Institute.

story:
The Program

Since 2005, Al Johnson has been opening the world of art to students, young and old – making  it possible for them to explore and enhance their artistic capabilities. He now wants to introduce art as a means of expression to the disenfranchised in North Philadelphia. By contributing to A Return Ticket to Hope art mentoring program, you will help with the purchase of much needed art supplies and help offset operating expenses.

The Benefits of Unlocking Hidden Artistic Talent

  • Learning how to draw and paint is the first step toward a lifetime of creativity.
  • Quality drawing and painting along with fine art instruction enhances academic success and instills the self-confidence needed in future endeavors.
  • The arts teach vital modes of seeing, imagining, inventing, and thinking.
  • Those who have learned the lessons of the arts see new patterns, learn from their mistakes, and are most likely to come up with the novel answers to solving problems when faced with adversity.

Yet, fine art programs are vanishing from our schools.  All too often, children, teens and even adults wind up glued to the television or playing video games for hours on end while they could be enhancing their lives through creative pursuits like drawing and painting.

Curriculum

A Return Ticket to Hope is a four week introductory arts program (two day per week, two hours per day).

Phase I - Pencil Drawing (2 weeks)

  • Establish goals and the interest of each student. Introduction to the materials.
  • Discussion of line definition. Establishing fine line and thick line consistency. Creating shapes. Finding light and shadow.
  • Defining structures/proportions and perspectives.
  • Review/sharing of individual portfolios.

Phase II – Painting (2 weeks)

  • Establish which drawing they want to choose for their painting. Introduction to primary colors and methods of color mixing.
  • Paint.
  • Art Exhibition 

Outcomes of Involvement

  • Increase self-esteem and ability. Helps bridge the gap between perceiving what a student can't do and realizing all the things they can do. This journey allows self-discovery, imagination building of greater self-esteem skills.
  • Improve academic performance and skills.  Children and teens see a vast improvement in their academic school work and for adults, a desire and willingness to live a more focused and productive life.
  • Inspires interest in specialized art middle and high schools. School-aged students can work on their portfolios to include a still life, a drawing of a person, a landscape, and an architectural piece emphasizing the versatility of their artistic talent.
  • Gain an awareness of careers in visual arts. .The serious art student gets to explore possible career paths in design and fine arts, and prepare for entry into a college or art school program. Every student will discover and develop their own sense of direction in art.

Previous Work within Various Communities

Al Johnson has provided art mentoring for youth and adults at The Brooklyn YMCA, and the Patricia Robinson Music Theatre, Brooklyn, N.Y. He has facilitated lecture and gallery presentations for the after school program of The Salvation Army and conducted group art mentoring workshops for the Jack and Jill Organization of Queens and for the Department of Education throughout the New York City area.

Foreseen Challenges

This community project is garnering lots of interest even before its official launch.  Currently, classroom space is limited and a much larger space will be needed. This will result in funds needed for additional art supplies and operating expenses since this is a free program for budding artists in the community.  Plans are underway to seek grants and partner with community leaders and local businesses to help expand the program in order to offer this program to more underserved in the community.   

What You Gain by Contributing to This Campaign

Contribute to A Return Ticket to Hope and own any one of the following paintings:

  • High-quality reproductions that are personally signed by the artist and embossed with his logo: 

Just A Kiss

The Healing Sister

Hot Buttered Soul

The Divine Universe

A Sense of Being

Harvest Bird

  • Original Works on Paper:

Tears of Thee

Mothers of Invention

  • Small "Studies" that the artist paints as guidelines before he paints his larger paintings:

Construction Mama

Closet Case

Strode Road

  • The artist's Original Artwork created with a mix of color and shapes through abstract expressionism allowing you to interpret what you see and feel. 

Night of the Bid Wishers

Seeking the Red Moment

The Beast with Two Backs

To Dance with Balance

Digital Infant

Manchild Rebirth

Snow Queen Energy Tile

For more information about Al Johnson and his work, go to http://Aljohnsontheartist.com or email al.aljohnsonart@gmail.com.

story:
Grounded Art & Collectibles, is a start-up retail store offering items from Pop Culture, and Underground and Graffiti Artists specializing in limited edition, and exclusive: artwork, clothing, toy collectibles, vinyl and glass. 

The retail location will also become a destination for individuals that support the pop culture and underground art market.

We have profound passion for art and music, it has not only shaped our lives, but at times saved our lives. We want to bring that passion, and our knowledge and experience to Fort Wayne, with the intent of not only supporting the art and music we love, but also allowing people to find pieces that speak to them and their lives. 

The store will be located in Fort Wayne, Indiana, catering to the consumers who look beyond the congested retail malls and online retailers, for the special shopping experience. In addition to offering a wide array of unique, quality products, the customers will enjoy friendly and knowledgeable customer service in a convenient, uncongested location.

We intend to expand our business by carefully building a repeat customer base and provide the products and merchandise they wish to purchase. We feel it is important to offer personal customer support and services to achieve our business philosophy. We also intend to expand the business by participating in community support initiatives and improvements.

Our future goals will include donations and special events that raise both money and awareness for organizations that matter to us, including animal shelters, homeless in our community and veterans. We will also be adding a garden for the community. 

Here are some Rough drafts of the inside of the store, as well as the back. The back will contain a garden, one that will provide produce to the community . 

 

The supply and demand for these products is overwhelming and unattainable for consumers in this area. Shoppers are overwhelmed by choices online, and lack the knowledge to be able to locate and purchase limited, rare and non-mainstream inventory. Consumers want the tactile experiences offered by physical stores. 

We will connect customers to limited edition arts, collectibles, blown glass, vinyl’s and artists. Customers will be able to touch it, see it, feel it. We will provide the instant gratification of being able to “find” and purchase the piece. Shoppers tend to look for trustworthy sources to inspire their purchases, and will be making purchases from individuals with knowledge and experience. The retail location will also become a destination for individuals that support the pop culture and underground art market.

The funds will go toward securing the location, as well as start up inventory.

story:
Beginning in 2011, South Bay Burners have brought honoraria art installations to Black Rock City: 
2011’s Laptop Man
2012’s Valley of Heart’s Delight
2013’s Mission Umbrae
2014’s Occidental Oasis
2015’s Hare Today, Gone Tomorrow

In 2017, we’re bringing another community art installation to black rock city, and it we invite everyone to participate and

ENJOY THE BURN!

What We Need & What You Get

This year, we didn't get an honorarium art grant.  So we need your help more than ever!  We have already bought some of the lumber we need, and are on Build Day #5 already.  But we could really use your help to fund this project.  pARTicipate, and come watch it burn with us!

If we don't reach our goal, this will be an out-of-pocket project.  We could really use your help!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, you can still join us with your sweat equity.  Come help us build during the summer, or help us on-playa with Burn Day and clean-up!  Write to southbay@burningman.org and let us know how you'd like to be involved.

Or, just share this link with your friends who might want to help out!
