story:
https://www.generosity.com/community-fundraisin...

Taiwanese artist Vincent J.F. Huang,  is an artist and environmental advocate, a frequent traveler to Tuvalu and official representing Tuvalu nation in United Nations Frameworks Convention on Climate Change, Conference of Parties (UNFCCC COP) since 2012, and representing artist for Tuvalu Pavilion at Venice Biennale in 2013 and 2015. He has been working on eco art for very long time and seeking to rise environment awareness of current rapid rising of sea level treating the inhabitants of small pacific island nation of Tuvalu. 

 

"Year on year, the impacts of climate change are hard to see:air temperatures warming by a few tenths of a degree here, sea levels rising by a few millimeters there. This poses a challenge to the artists who tackle climate change - a challenge that Taiwan's Vincent J.F. Huang address steamrolling right over it..."---The Wall Street Journal

"First New York, then other cities around the world. Now the Occupy movement has spread underwater and it doesn't even involve humans. Taiwanese artist Vincent J.F. Huang has created and installation that uses marine animals to examine the burgeoning protest movement. "          ---Huffington Post

"Tuvalu's entry for the Venice Art Biennale next week will see artist Vincent J. F. Huang raising awareness of the climate crisis engulfing the island with his massive oil pump interactive/slaughter machine. People fill up for "petrol" while simultaneously "guillotining" Barack Obama's head."---The Independent

"The tiny Pacific nation of Tuvalu this year has a presence at the Venice Biennale, intent on raising awareness abut the climate crisis threatening to engulf it. Tuvalu's Government has teamed up with Taiwanese artist Vincent J.F. Huang who uses dark humor to convey the nation's environmental messages."---ABC TV NEWS

"In addition to his artistic contribution to the conference, Huang is also an official delegate for the island nation of Tuvalu... Huang was drawn to the country because of what he saw as its tragic situation"a non-industrialised country that produces nearly zero carbon emissions would be perhaps the first to perish as a consequence of emissions... To further press home his message, Huang has arranged for animals 'to host a press conference' today at 1:30pm to convey their message to the human delegates at COP18/CMP8 Doha."---Gulf Times

For more coverages of Vincent please check the links below (at the end of this page).

What are you going to do?

Vincent’s aim is to planting 7000 mangrove trees at Funafala beach, where he will arrange the plants into QR code pattern with a web link to an environmental website for more relevant information.  Like 7,000 oaks by Joseph Beuys, so this project will not only promote awareness to a larger audiences as social sculpture but also at the same time will help to slow down soil erosion causes by raising sea level.

Ice melt caused by a warming atmosphere is making sea levels rise, which will cause problems globally. When we believe this perhaps nowhere more acutely than the low-lying islands like Tuvalu, in fact there are at least 22 more lying island nations like Tuvalu and it influences 7 million people.  What happened to Tuvalu is what happens to our planet tomorrow. We are calling for your action to face the extreme weather together. 

Why Tuvalu? Is Tuvalu a country?

Tuvalu is a island nation located in Pacific Ocean, it's a group of nine tiny islands in the South Pacific, locates between Hawaii and Australia, which won independence from the United Kingdom in 1978. It's population is less than 10,000. Five of the islands are coral atolls, the other four consist of land rising from the sea bed and it's threaten to engulf the nation.

Recently, Tuvalu has gained significant media attention worldwide because its low-lying land is so susceptible to rising sea levels. The beaches surrounding the atolls are sinking due to erosion caused by waves and this is exacerbated by rising sea levels. In addition, because the sea level is rising on the islands, Tuvaluan must continually deal with their homes flooding, as well as soil salinisation. Soil salinisation is a problem because it is making it difficult to get clean drinking water and is harming crops as they cannot grow with the saltier water, and be forced to change their diet habits. As a result, the country is becoming more and more dependent on foreign imports.

Why should I contribute?

This art project will help Tuvalu to face to threaten of sea level rising, and for other island nations too. It’s a part of estimation for extreme weather.

We humbly ask you join us for this eco-friendly event and please spread the words, share Tuvalu's story on your social media! Let’s work together on making our environment a better place, for a better future!

Start it now!

We aim to raise $30,000. Every $10 you donate we plant a Mangrove on the coast for you, and all the mangroves will be arrange to a QR code shape. To scan this QR code you will be lead to more relevant information about climate change. For more donation we are plant more mangroves surely. The more important thing is all the money you spend not only slow up the sea level rising, also help Tuvaluan to save their home.  

Your contribution goes 100% to art materials, mangroves, logistic, transportation, insurance, and a documentary shooting equipment rental for the project. Everyone participating in the project with a commitment to the transformative power of eco art, to against climate change. Our team is so grateful for your contribution and support.

Stories

 

紅樹林巨型QR code護岸 台藝術家巧思救吐瓦魯

環境危機 水筆仔計畫籲正視吐瓦魯危機

Giant barcode on Tuvalu to raise awareness about climate

Artist to plant 7000 trees in Tuvalu

Climate art: Tuvalu plan for giant mangrove QR code

Artist Vincent J.F. Huang embarks on project to protect Tuvalu

Taiwanese Artist Highlights Global Climate Change Through QR-Code Art

Global warming: Thousands flee Pacific islands on front line of climate change – Independent

Paris climate talks: Tuvalu PM Enele Sosene Sopoaga criticises demand for evidence of claims - ABC

South Pacific seeks action to solve climate 'terror' not of its making

Brexit means little to refugees prepared to die fleeing climate change

How are our Pacific Island neighbours facing climate change?

 

To know more about Vincent J.F. Huang

Getting wet feet for Tuvalu - BBC News

Tiny Tuvalu Gets the Eco-Art Treatment - Scene Asia - WSJ

ABC TV NEWS - Tuvalu teams up with Taiwanese artist for exhibition

DW - Taiwanese artist tries to save Tuvalu in Venice

SBS TV- Venice Biennale installation highlights Tuvalu's battle with rising seas

Blouin artinfo - Island Nations Seize the Venice Biennale Spotlight to Decry Climate Change

One million people expected at Tuvalu's Venice Biennale

Tuvalu takes climate challenge to Venice art festival

story_txt:
https://www.generosity.com/community-fundraisin...Taiwanese artist Vincent J.F. Huang,  is an artist and environmental advocate, a frequent traveler to Tuvalu and official representing Tuvalu nation in United Nations Frameworks Convention on Climate Change, Conference of Parties (UNFCCC COP) since 2012, and representing artist for Tuvalu Pavilion at Venice Biennale in 2013 and 2015. He has been working on eco art for very long time and seeking to rise environment awareness of current rapid rising of sea level treating the inhabitants of small pacific island nation of Tuvalu.  "Year on year, the impacts of climate change are hard to see:air temperatures warming by a few tenths of a degree here, sea levels rising by a few millimeters there. This poses a challenge to the artists who tackle climate change - a challenge that Taiwan's Vincent J.F. Huang address steamrolling right over it..."---The Wall Street Journal"First New York, then other cities around the world. Now the Occupy movement has spread underwater and it doesn't even involve humans. Taiwanese artist Vincent J.F. Huang has created and installation that uses marine animals to examine the burgeoning protest movement. "          ---Huffington Post"Tuvalu's entry for the Venice Art Biennale next week will see artist Vincent J. F. Huang raising awareness of the climate crisis engulfing the island with his massive oil pump interactive/slaughter machine. People fill up for "petrol" while simultaneously "guillotining" Barack Obama's head."---The Independent"The tiny Pacific nation of Tuvalu this year has a presence at the Venice Biennale, intent on raising awareness abut the climate crisis threatening to engulf it. Tuvalu's Government has teamed up with Taiwanese artist Vincent J.F. Huang who uses dark humor to convey the nation's environmental messages."---ABC TV NEWS"In addition to his artistic contribution to the conference, Huang is also an official delegate for the island nation of Tuvalu... Huang was drawn to the country because of what he saw as its tragic situation"a non-industrialised country that produces nearly zero carbon emissions would be perhaps the first to perish as a consequence of emissions... To further press home his message, Huang has arranged for animals 'to host a press conference' today at 1:30pm to convey their message to the human delegates at COP18/CMP8 Doha."---Gulf TimesFor more coverages of Vincent please check the links below (at the end of this page).What are you going to do?Vincent’s aim is to planting 7000 mangrove trees at Funafala beach, where he will arrange the plants into QR code pattern with a web link to an environmental website for more relevant information.  Like 7,000 oaks by Joseph Beuys, so this project will not only promote awareness to a larger audiences as social sculpture but also at the same time will help to slow down soil erosion causes by raising sea level.Ice melt caused by a warming atmosphere is making sea levels rise, which will cause problems globally. When we believe this perhaps nowhere more acutely than the low-lying islands like Tuvalu, in fact there are at least 22 more lying island nations like Tuvalu and it influences 7 million people.  What happened to Tuvalu is what happens to our planet tomorrow. We are calling for your action to face the extreme weather together. Why Tuvalu? Is Tuvalu a country?Tuvalu is a island nation located in Pacific Ocean, it's a group of nine tiny islands in the South Pacific, locates between Hawaii and Australia, which won independence from the United Kingdom in 1978. It's population is less than 10,000. Five of the islands are coral atolls, the other four consist of land rising from the sea bed and it's threaten to engulf the nation.Recently, Tuvalu has gained significant media attention worldwide because its low-lying land is so susceptible to rising sea levels. The beaches surrounding the atolls are sinking due to erosion caused by waves and this is exacerbated by rising sea levels. In addition, because the sea level is rising on the islands, Tuvaluan must continually deal with their homes flooding, as well as soil salinisation. Soil salinisation is a problem because it is making it difficult to get clean drinking water and is harming crops as they cannot grow with the saltier water, and be forced to change their diet habits. As a result, the country is becoming more and more dependent on foreign imports.Why should I contribute?This art project will help Tuvalu to face to threaten of sea level rising, and for other island nations too. It’s a part of estimation for extreme weather.We humbly ask you join us for this eco-friendly event and please spread the words, share Tuvalu's story on your social media! Let’s work together on making our environment a better place, for a better future!Start it now!We aim to raise $30,000. Every $10 you donate we plant a Mangrove on the coast for you, and all the mangroves will be arrange to a QR code shape. To scan this QR code you will be lead to more relevant information about climate change. For more donation we are plant more mangroves surely. The more important thing is all the money you spend not only slow up the sea level rising, also help Tuvaluan to save their home.  Your contribution goes 100% to art materials, mangroves, logistic, transportation, insurance, and a documentary shooting equipment rental for the project. Everyone participating in the project with a commitment to the transformative power of eco art, to against climate change. Our team is so grateful for your contribution and support.Stories 紅樹林巨型QR code護岸 台藝術家巧思救吐瓦魯環境危機 水筆仔計畫籲正視吐瓦魯危機Giant barcode on Tuvalu to raise awareness about climateArtist to plant 7000 trees in TuvaluClimate art: Tuvalu plan for giant mangrove QR codeArtist Vincent J.F. Huang embarks on project to protect TuvaluTaiwanese Artist Highlights Global Climate Change Through QR-Code ArtGlobal warming: Thousands flee Pacific islands on front line of climate change – IndependentParis climate talks: Tuvalu PM Enele Sosene Sopoaga criticises demand for evidence of claims - ABCSouth Pacific seeks action to solve climate 'terror' not of its makingBrexit means little to refugees prepared to die fleeing climate changeHow are our Pacific Island neighbours facing climate change? To know more about Vincent J.F. story:
Help us make the pilgrimage to Burning Man 2016!

Our Guild's art manifests in spectacle, performance, and the creation of beautiful portraits in wood, transformed by fire. 

We will be one of 28 workshop Guilds located on the central plaza, around "The Turning Man", following this year's Art Theme "Da Vinci's Workshop". Using chainsaws, we carve the portraits of patrons as they sit in a moop (matter-out-of-place) proof chamber on the "chair of death". In 15 minutes or less we render a likeness in a slab of wood. The sound and finesse of the chainsaw in the artist's hands is mesmerizing and a bit unnerving. 

The experience of the sitter/audience is mediated as they see their image being carved via the video stream from an action camera that the carver wears. They are watching and they are being watched. 

At an appointed hour after dark, we rendezvous again for a ritualistic transformation of the wooden portrait by the purifying flames of a propane torch.  The image is animated in the darkness as a glowing ember likeness,  a celebration of each creative spark in the dark with the carvers. 

We will be driving a large truck to transport the materials and setup for the Guild, from Virginia to Black Rock City, Nevada. Our costs include the purchase of action cameras, tablets to use for video monitors, dust protection for a/v equipment, 2 additional chainsaws, costume and lights for the Guild space/performance, and gas to get us there.  

Burning Man is a place for creativity and astounding art!  For 10 days a barren desert becomes a city of art, self-expression, giving, volunteering, and celebration.  We are honored to be a central part of this year's gathering. 

Be a part of this experience! Support your Guild!

story:
Short Summary

In January 2015, I had an idea to create an event to share my love of hip-hop, comedy and BBQ.  We decided to make it reality and the Chicago comedy community came through and help us fund our goal.  We've done this 3 times already, and the 4th will be bigger and better than before!  

What We Need & What You Get

At our last event we had  a 22 LB Brisket, 20 Lbs of Pulled Pork, 22 Racks of Ribs, and 5 Chickens. They we're all hand rubbed and slow smoked. On top of that, we had burgers, dogs, sausages, veggies, and sides.  That's not counting  smoker rentals, wood, coal, cleaning supplies, and incidentals. 

With your donation, we can make sure that all of our performers, volunteers, and audience members will be able to enjoy the  comedy rap crews, the stand ups, and the 32-Person Character rap battle all day long.

The Impact

There is nothing like this in the city. What turned out as a dumb idea turned into something of a rally point for local improvisors. For some of us it's a way to step out of our comfort zones, and for others it's a place for us showcase our work for our peers, but everyone agree's that this is one the most lit days of the year.

story:
When One Door Closes Another Will Open

This campaign is now closed and we are grateful for all our backers! We raised 66% of our goal in the 60 days allotted. We have opened a new campaign to complete the project. Please visit our March of the Deplorables: Let Our Voices Be Heard at: https://igg.me/at/deplorables/x/15717732 for more details.

Please check the UPDATES section for information on our progress.

Marnie Freeman is a talented artist who is know as the "Artist of Liberty®" because the subject matter she is passionate about reflects the founding values of our great nation.  The election of Donald J. Trump as the 45th president was historic at many levels. Many never thought he would ever even have a chance, but he tapped into a core of supports who came out in force to win the White House and start a new chapter in the American story.

During the campaign the supporters of Trump/Pence ticket were likened to a "basket of deplorables." This became a rallying cry for many who were on the fence with their support. These supporters prayed for candidate Trump and turned out in record numbers with a desire to "Make America Great Again" as One Nation Under God. Now, they want to send a resounding message to President Trump: "We are praying for you."

For the first time Marnie Freeman is accepting a public commission to create a special painting that commemorates this historic election. Her painting is titled "March of the Deplorables". It will depict a line of supporters praying for and marching alongside President Trump and Vice President Pence on their journey to the White House. She will also include key figures who were instrumental in this historic victory such as Kellyanne Conway, Melania Trump, Ivanka Trump, Lt. General Flynn, Steve Bannon, Katrina Pierson and Karen Pence. Much like the campaign was targeted to giving a voice to the average American rather than the privileged few, this painting is being funded in the same way. By opening this up to the public more people can participate in this historic painting. The idea came from Lt. Colonel E. Ray Moore, a retired Army Chaplain. Colonel Moore asked Marnie to paint this to honor the men and women who made the 2016 victory happen. He felt that it should be "commissioned by the people."

Marnie plans to present this painting to President Trump and Vice President Pence when it is completed. She believes that it will be a cherished memento of what many believed was impossible.

Please check out the various ways you can participate in this amazing project.

 

More about Marnie

You can learn about other works of Marnie Freeman at MarnieFreeman.com.

story:
Hello,

I’m Sarah Ellis, a natural history illustrator from Somerset in the U.K. I’m running this crowdfunding campaign to seek help in funding a 3 week trip to New Zealand where I have been offered a free stand to exhibit my paintings at the ‘Sika Show’ Exhibition in Taupo, which I have arranged to share with Peter Ryan whose recent book (Hunting New Zealand: Parts Unknown)  contains a number of my illustrations.

My aim for the trip (alongside the exhibition) is to collect reference images and experiences for my ‘Trophy Deer Species’ series of paintings, that I intend to turn into an artistic trophy reference guide which will collect the paintings I have made over the last 5 years.

 

 

 

The Trip

After the exhibition I’ll drive across the islands (all the way down to Southland and back again) to meet with hunters, farmers and friends, who have offered to take me on hunts and field walks, on which I want to collect sketches, notes and photographs of the deer, of their habitat, and of the whole process of the stalk and after. I want to see the colours, the process and care, and the skill involved in the preparation of the animals.

After the Sika Show I’ll be driving from Taupo to Southland with a few stops in between. I’ve arranged to meet with a Red Deer specialist, writer and conservationist in Christchurch; with a venison hunter in Otautau; and I’ll be having guided stalks in Southland with Red and Fallow deer professional guides, where I’ll also be helping out with the lambing.

I’m also in email conversations with offices of the Department of Conservation, and I have arranged meetings with galleries in Taupo, Christchurch, Auckland and Southland.

 

Why I need your help.

Showing my work at the Sika Show will put me in front of around 5000 people interested in Trophy Hunting. Your help here and a positive reception there will give me the best chance of being able to continue and finish the series which has been so well received and has been a joy to paint.

The first step (painting 14 species) has already been made, and was made possible thanks to a lot of you who are reading this now. This trip is part two. With the increased exposure from the show and the sales I hope to make, when I get home I can crack on and paint the remaining species that many of you have asked for.  

 
 

In return

£4000 is a lot of money, though as I’m not asking each of you for that, it’s considerably less. But as you’re helping me, as a thank you and as a tease to make you think ‘well, if I just pledged a little more I could get one of those’, I’m offering these levels of pledge.

 

£5 Help out.

By contributing £5 to my trip you'll have moved me 1/800th closer to my goal, and as I'll be driving nearly 3 times that distance I’ll dedicate one of those miles to you, as thanks.

 

UK or NZ Trophy Deer Poster Download (100 of each). £10

1 Download of your choice of either the UK or NZ Trophy Species Poster (unsigned, A4).

Get in quick because these posters are popular. If you contribute £10 you will be sent a link to download either the UK or NZ Trophy Species poster (the choice is yours). You can print that image out yourself (once only please) or use it as a home screen background. Contributing at this level means you get something for yourself and I save on printing and postage costs, which means the whole amount goes toward my trip.

 

UK Trophy Deer Species Poster. Available as a download (A4, unsigned), and as a  printed signed poster (A3, A4). The download and print will not be watermarked.

New Zealand Trophy Deer Species Poster. Available for download (A4, unsigned), and as a  printed signed poster (A3, A4). The download and print will not be watermarked.

 

Printed UK Trophy Deer Species Poster (signed). 

If you would like a printed and signed copy of the UK Trophy Species Poster (Sika; Red; Roe; Fallow; Muntjac (In Progress); Chinese Water) those are also available. The UK poster is a new poster specially created for this campaign, and is available in two sizes: A4 (21 x 29.7cm) &  A3 (29.7 x 42.0cm). The printed posters will all be hand signed and will posted out once I return.

Please note: This poster is different to the existing 'Trophy Deer Features' poster which remains available on my website.

Options available:

1 A4 print of the UK Trophy Species Poster. £19 (incl. postage)

1 A3 print of the UK Trophy Species Poster. £28 (incl. UK postage; +£4 for international postage )

 

Printed NZ Trophy Deer Species Poster (signed). 

If you would like a printed and signed copy of the New Zealand Trophy Species Poster (Sika; Red; Sambar; Fallow; Rusa; Wapiti) those are also available. I've put together this poster of heads especially for this campaign, and two sizes are available: A4 (21 x 29.7cm) &  A3 (29.7 x 42.0cm). The printed posters will all be hand signed and will posted out once I return.

Options available:

1 A4 print of the NZ Trophy Species Poster. £19 (incl. postage)

1 A3 print of the NZ Trophy Species Poster. £28 (incl. UK postage; +£4 for international postage )

 

Limited edition print (A4) of an image captured during my trip. £45.

Edition limited to 50. Postage included.

The walks I have organised will bring me into contact with Red, Fallow, Sambar, Sika, Wapiti, Whitetail & Rusa species. Along these walks (when possible) I will be taking reference photographs for future Trophy Species paintings, and as source material for my book. I will chose and paint one photograph that I feel embodies the trip (whether that be of head in pose; a small grouping; or of a part of the process (e.g. grollicking etc.)). For a pledge of £45 I will post to you an A4 limited edition print of that work.

 

Original art commission of a natural history subject of your choice.

I also welcome commissions to paint other natural history subjects. My past works have included: gun dogs, beetles, birds of prey and flower studies. Perhaps you have a particular subject in mind or perhaps you have an idea and you’d like to discuss finding a reference image. I’ve listed options for commissions at 3 sizes (A5, A4, & A3), but if you’d like something larger (I’m about to begin a 109x50 cm piece) just send me an email and I’ll add it to the list for you.

I will schedule the commissions in the order in which they come in, but I'll get to each as quickly as possible when I return.

Options

A5 commission of a natural history subject of your choice. £200.

A4 commission of a natural history subject of your choice. £350.

A3 commission of a natural history subject of your choice. £550.

 

Wapiti (Elk): Features – A2 original. £1200

For £1200 you could own the original Wapiti (Elk): Features painting (A2, 42.0 x 59.4cm). If the original has already been claimed, send me an email with the trophy species you’d like me to paint and I’ll make it available as an option.

The Wapiti is the 7th deer in my Deer Trophy Species series. 

Budget.

Flights; motorhome hire for 20 days; petrol for 2587km; a ferry; campsite parking; and 1 internal flight. I’ve scoured and compared and asked and followed advice, and I’m pretty confident I’ve got the best prices I can for each. Here’s a quick breakdown:

Thank you.

I love my work and I’m continually surprised with people’s response and interest. This trip is the big one, it’s the opportunity I need to keep the series going. I have to go, even if only for the week of the show, I have to go and make it work. But as a mother of 3 I don’t want to come home laden with debt, which is why I’m here.

I hope you've found something that interests you in the contribution levels offered. And remember, those items aren't just themselves, they're each a little part of my trip, and each will be sent with my gratitude and thanks, and the promise of future work to come.

 

And here is a handy little currency conversion guide for the exchange rates on 22/08/17.
story_txt:
Hello,I’m Sarah Ellis, a natural history illustrator from Somerset in the U.K. I’m running this crowdfunding campaign to seek help in funding a 3 week trip to New Zealand where I have been offered a free stand to exhibit my paintings at the ‘Sika Show’ Exhibition in Taupo, which I have arranged to share with Peter Ryan whose recent book (Hunting New Zealand: Parts Unknown)  contains a number of my illustrations.My aim for the trip (alongside the exhibition) is to collect reference images and experiences for my ‘Trophy Deer Species’ series of paintings, that I intend to turn into an artistic trophy reference guide which will collect the paintings I have made over the last 5 years.
 

 
 The TripAfter the exhibition I’ll drive across the islands (all the way down to Southland and back again) to meet with hunters, farmers and friends, who have offered to take me on hunts and field walks, on which I want to collect sketches, notes and photographs of the deer, of their habitat, and of the whole process of the stalk and after. I want to see the colours, the process and care, and the skill involved in the preparation of the animals.After the Sika Show I’ll be driving from Taupo to Southland with a few stops in between. I’ve arranged to meet with a Red Deer specialist, writer and conservationist in Christchurch; with a venison hunter in Otautau; and I’ll be having guided stalks in Southland with Red and Fallow deer professional guides, where I’ll also be helping out with the lambing.I’m also in email conversations with offices of the Department of Conservation, and I have arranged meetings with galleries in Taupo, Christchurch, Auckland and Southland. Why I need your help.Showing my work at the Sika Show will put me in front of around 5000 people interested in Trophy Hunting. Your help here and a positive reception there will give me the best chance of being able to continue and finish the series which has been so well received and has been a joy to paint.The first step (painting 14 species) has already been made, and was made possible thanks to a lot of you who are reading this now. This trip is part two. With the increased exposure from the show and the sales I hope to make, when I get home I can crack on and paint the remaining species that many of you have asked for.    In return£4000 is a lot of money, though as I’m not asking each of you for that, it’s considerably less. But as you’re helping me, as a thank you and as a tease to make you think ‘well, if I just pledged a little more I could get one of those’, I’m offering these levels of pledge. £5 Help out.By contributing £5 to my trip you'll have moved me 1/800th closer to my goal, and as I'll be driving nearly 3 times that distance I’ll dedicate one of those miles to you, as thanks. UK or NZ Trophy Deer Poster Download (100 of each). £101 Download of your choice of either the UK or NZ Trophy Species Poster (unsigned, A4).Get in quick because these posters are popular. story:
Dear friends and fashion lovers,

I am raising money to help finance my new collection of ready-to-wear clothing, Dance: The Line. The collection is inspired by the legendary ballerina Wendy Whelan, one of the most important figures in the world of ballet and contemporary dance. My goal is to launch the line of clothing in the spring of 2018. But to do that, I need your help to raise $20,000. This money will help pay for fabric,  pattern making, sample making, and construction. I am offering fun perks for your donations, including pieces from the current collection (please check out the list). With your help, I can realize this new line of movement-inspired clothing. My personal ethos has always been "Move well. Live well." I hope you will join me on this new adventure.

About Dance: The Line

Dance: The Line is a new collection of ready-to-wear clothing that continues my conversation with high fashion and dance. My muse for this collection is Wendy Whelan, former prima ballerina for the New York City Ballet. Wendy and I met when she and her husband, visual artist David Michalek, came to visit me at my new atelier in Hudson, NY. When David fell in love with one of my coats, the idea to photograph Wendy in my clothing took shape. Since then, she has become my muse for the entire collection. Launching in Spring 2018, the collection will sell online and from the atelier. I will be sourcing fabric from the best imported Italian wool and Japanese cotton. The collection will be fabricated and produced in midtown NYC by my long-time collaborators pattern maker, sample maker and small production company, with whom I have worked for over 15 years.

About Marine Penvern Atelier

When I first opened my atelier Penvern in the lower east side of Manhattan, it quickly became an after hours hangout for young dance students from Juilliard. They would try on clothes and dance in the window. It was then that I realized dancers made great models because they bring out the way clothing wants to move. Dance continues to take on a center stage in my process, as I aim to create original pieces designed to move well in everyday life and on contemporary dance stage. The new Hudson atelier, Marine Penvern, is a space to create and to build intimate relationship with clients, friends, and members of the local community. I have been living part time in the Hudson Valley for the last 15 years, and have forged meaningful relationships with so many inspiring people. Moving my family and work space up here seemed like the next sensible chapter in my life. I love this artistic and queer-friendly town, and its beautiful Hudson Valley surrounding.

The atelier is a small business founded on the goal of bringing creativity into the world, generating collaborative work and representing artisans and artists living and working in the area. In the past year, I have had the immense pleasure of working with choreographer, dancer and Hudson local Adam Weinert, designing costumes for his acclaimed piece MONUMENT, which was performed at the renowned Jacob’s Pillow this fall. I also designed for choreographer Emery LeCrone and New York City Ballet dancer Megan LeCrone for the Ballet Dance festival at the Joyce Theater in NYC. I am also looking forward to forthcoming collaboration with local painter Meg Lipsky.

story:
ABOUT THE ARTIST      

Hi, my name is Lori Shorin. I'm  a figurative sculptor. My passion to sculpt the human form led me to study at the Florence Academy of Art in Florence, Italy from 2006-2010.  For four years, I was immersed in sculpting, drawing, and studying the anatomy of the human figure.  Countless hours of training prepared me to express my inner visions through the medium of sculpture.

WHY THE MEAM MUSEUM IN BARCELONA, SPAIN?

The sculpture Spiritual Sisters participated in a three-month  exhibition called Figurativas 2015 at the Museu Europeu d’Art Modern (MEAM museum) in Barcelona, Spain.  Over 2,500 artists competed to have their artworks displayed in this beautiful venue in the Borne section of Barcelona, near the Picasso museum.  MEAM attracts thousands of international visitors each year. Having my sculpture in the permanent collection at MEAM will greatly increase the exposure of my art to a wide variety of individuals from around the world.  When I saw my sculpture in the museum for the opening ceremony of the exhibition, I realized that I had found a new and special home for Spiritual Sisters.

MEAM was created by restoring the old Gomis Palace and has been open to the public since 2006. Restoration and purchasing artworks to build a permanent art collection for the museum has been a very costly undertaking.

It's important to me that the sculpture is in a collection with other figurative artworks created by my contemporaries. The sculpture will be well maintained and available for many to appreciate now and in the future. Your contributions will help my artwork to be in a place where it can be seen by a large audience.

FUNDING GOAL

My funding goal is $15,000

My first Indiegogo campaign raised over $9,000. That money went towards the covering the costs of the professionally made silicone mold.

The Spiritual Sisters sculpture costs me $29,000 to create in bronze and ship to the museum in Spain, additional related expenses are detailed below. The MEAM museum will contribute $5,000 towards the purchase of my sculpture.  Your contributions will help to cover the remaining costs to fabricate this sculpture, specifically the bronze casting and shipping.

Any amount of money we raise beyond the $15,000 funding goal will compensate me for my hands on creative time.  This sculpture took about 18 months from the original conception of the idea to final casting in bronze.  I spent many a late night sculpting,  sometimes until sunrise. Beyond my creative time, there were a lot of costs involved in making this sculpture.

 

COSTS:

$9,800 for a Silicone mold by professional mold maker. Costs Covered in first Indiegogo.

$300 delivery of clay sculpture to the mold maker 

$12,000 for Bronze casting at the foundry.

$2,775 Shipping USA to Spain, Customs Broker fees

$500 Sculpting materials

$800 Model fees

$650 Videographers for the first Indiegogo campaign.

$2,500+ Fabrication of the perks. This amount will be higher or lower depending on the quantity of artworks contributors order.

TOTAL COSTS=$29,325 USD

A total of 8% plus transactions fees will be deducted from the total amount raised.

Indiegogo’s platform fee = (5%).

Third party fees for payment processors = 3% plus 30 cents per transaction for credit card.

THE PROCESS OF MAKING SPIRITUAL SISTERS

The initial stages included making drawings and small clay composition sketches until I arrived at the final design. Next, I built the stand and armature, the structure that hoods the clay. The bulk of my creative time,  represents approximately 1,600 hours, was spent sculpting the two figures in clay. I worked with live models, and from imagination. I primarily worked with professional models and periodically had pregnant women pose to better portray the unique qualities of pregnancy.  The mold making process  was done by a professional mold maker.  The next  part is called chasing the wax, which is a preparation for the bronze casting. Once the bronze is cast, metal workers have a big job to weld, grind, hammer, and chase the metal in preparation for the patina. The patina is a chemical process in which oxidizes the bronze to give it the rich warm browns and light dusting of green.     

Here's a link to see some of the steps involved in the creative process  https://vimeo.com/192282086 .

In total it was a truly a wonderful experience and a labor of love and I hope you will be inspired to contribute.

THE PERKS
Please select a reward for your contribution

BRONZE PORTRAIT on Black Belgian Marble base from Spiritual Sisters. Contribution: $4,750.  Free shipping in the USA.

This bronze sculpture, signed by the artist, has a classical patina that will get more beautiful over time. Cast in Pietrasanta, Italy.  This portrait sculpture measures approx. 12"h x 5" w x 7"deep. This sculpture comes with a certificate of authenticity.
In addition to owning the sculpture, your name will appear on a bronze plaque at the MEAM museum in Barcelona, Spain to honor the major supporters of this project.
Currently only shipping in the United States.   An inspired thank you note will also be sent to your home. 

                

 

Portrait Bust from Spiritual Sisters in Aqua-Resin  $1,000 This sculpture has a bronze metal coating on the aqua-resin cast of the portrait from "Spiritual Sister", it looks like bronze because the metal coating contains bronze particles. The metal coating is an acrylic based.  The patina is a  a classical brown bronze with hints of  light green. The portrait bust will be mounted on a wood base signed by the artist. Free shipping in the USA.

Plaster portrait bust of Spiritual Sisters on wood base.  $450 The plaster portrait of Spiritual Sister is available and will have the same composition as the aqua-resin in the above video. 

Male Torso $1450   *Free shipping in the USA.

This sculpture is a half-life size male torso cast in aqua-resin with bronze metal coating on a dark wood base. The traditional brown bronze metal coating is accented lightly with a tiffany green patina.  Size is 16" h x 10"w x 6" d. *Please note this photo is of the bronze torso, new photo of aqua-resin Male Torso coming soon. 

9" Lady Lotus in Gold or Metallic Blue $400.
Cast Aqua-resin  in either Gold tone on wood or Metallic blue on mirror base. PLUS an Inspired Thank You Card.

Mother's Love $1,250  *Free shipping in the USA.
Mother’s Love, Bronze metal coating on cast aqua-resin on a wood base, 2008, edition of 20, Signed by the artist. Plus your name on a special bronze plaque at the MEAM Museum in Spain, honoring the major contributors to this Indiegogo,  and an inspirational thank you card sent via snail mail!

Manna from Heaven Medallion $200

Manna from Heaven medallion.  Bronze metal coating on aqua-resin.  This medallion is a bas-relief of my sculpture titled Manna from Heaven and is ready to hang on your wall. Plus an inspired Thank You card.

Let me know if you are planning to give this as a gift to someone special. I'll gift wrap it and ship to you or the person receiving the gift.

Limited Edition Etched Plexiglass $100
Limited Edition  of 50. Special etched plexi-glass for Indiegogo backers for all the campaigns related to Spiritual Sisters.  Laser-Etching uses a new technology that creates the image of "Spiritual Sisters" in plexi-glass. 40 of the edition of 50 remain. PLUS an Inspired Thank You Card.

Small Figure Study

*More drawings will be added soon.

Small Pencil Drawing

SMALL FIGURE STUDY PENCIL DRAWING  on paper. These drawings were done during my studies at the Florence Academy of Art and were done from observation of a live model. Please let me know which drawing you have selected by indicating the number that appears on the image of the drawing of your choice. Size and color of the paper varies (white, grey and beige). Approximate size is 12" x  8".

PRINTABLE BOOKMARK $1

We're on the same page!  Print out and create your own bookmark with an image of "Spiritual Sisters" on the front and back. Just follow the easy instructions.  I'll be giving you a shout out on social media via Facebook!  

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

There are no risks associated with the sculpture, as the bronze sculpture Spiritual Sisters has successfully been created and shipped to the museum.  

Risk with the perks apply to the delivery time.  Most of the perks will be made to order, while others have been created already and waiting for you to select them.  Feel free to email me with any questions related to your selection.  Lshorin@gmail.com.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Spread the news about this project by word of mouth, email, text, social media to 10 people you feel would most likely support this project. Sending good vibes is welcome too! : )

The bulk of my creative time,  represents approximately 1,600 hours, was spent sculpting the two figures in clay. I worked with live models, and from imagination. I primarily worked with professional models and periodically had pregnant women pose to better portray the unique qualities of pregnancy.  The mold making process  was done by a professional mold maker.  The next  part is called chasing the wax, which is a preparation for the bronze casting. Once the bronze is cast, metal workers have a big job to weld, grind, hammer, and chase the metal in preparation for the patina. The patina is a chemical process in which oxidizes the bronze to give it the rich warm browns and light dusting of green.     Here's a link to see some of the steps involved in the creative process  https://vimeo.com/192282086 .In total it was a truly a wonderful experience and a labor of love and I hope you will be inspired to contribute.THE PERKSPlease select a reward for your contributionBRONZE PORTRAIT on Black Belgian Marble base from Spiritual Sisters. Contribution: $4,750.  Free shipping in the USA.This bronze sculpture, signed by the artist, has a classical patina that will get more beautiful over time. Cast in Pietrasanta, Italy.  This portrait sculpture measures approx. 12"h x 5" w x 7"deep. This sculpture comes with a certificate of authenticity.In addition to owning the sculpture, your name will appear on a bronze plaque at the MEAM museum in Barcelona, Spain to honor the major supporters of this project.Currently only shipping in the United States.   An inspired thank you note will also be sent to your home.                  Portrait Bust from Spiritual Sisters in Aqua-Resin  $1,000 This sculpture has a bronze metal coating on the aqua-resin cast of the portrait from "Spiritual Sister", it looks like bronze because the metal coating contains bronze particles. The metal coating is an acrylic based.  The patina is a  a classical brown bronze with hints of  light green. The portrait bust will be mounted on a wood base signed by the artist. Free shipping in the USA.Plaster portrait bust of Spiritual Sisters on wood base.  $450 The plaster portrait of Spiritual Sister is available and will have the same composition as the aqua-resin in the above video. Male Torso $1450   *Free shipping in the USA.This sculpture is a half-life size male torso cast in aqua-resin with bronze metal coating on a dark wood base. The traditional brown bronze metal coating is accented lightly with a tiffany green patina.  Size is 16" h x 10"w x 6" d. *Please note this photo is of the bronze torso, new photo of aqua-resin Male Torso coming soon. 9" Lady Lotus in Gold or Metallic Blue $400.Cast Aqua-resin  in either Gold tone on wood or Metallic blue on mirror base. PLUS an Inspired Thank You Card.Mother's Love $1,250  *Free shipping in the USA.Mother’s Love, Bronze metal coating on cast aqua-resin on a wood base, 2008, edition of 20, Signed by the artist. Plus your name on a special bronze plaque at the MEAM Museum in Spain, honoring the major contributors to this Indiegogo,  and an inspirational thank you card sent via snail mail!Manna from Heaven Medallion $200Manna from Heaven medallion.  Bronze metal coating on aqua-resin.  This medallion is a bas-relief of my sculpture titled Manna from Heaven and is ready to hang on your wall. Plus an inspired Thank You card.Let me know if you are planning to give this as a gift to someone special. I'll gift wrap it and ship to you or the person receiving the gift.Limited Edition Etched Plexiglass $100Limited Edition  of 50. Special etched plexi-glass for Indiegogo backers for all the campaigns related to Spiritual Sisters.  Laser-Etching uses a new technology that creates the image of "Spiritual Sisters" in plexi-glass. 40 of the edition of 50 remain. PLUS an Inspired Thank You Card.Small Figure Study*More drawings will be added soon.Small Pencil DrawingSMALL FIGURE STUDY PENCIL DRAWING  on paper. These drawings were done during my studies at the Florence Academy of Art and were done from observation of a live model. Please let me know which drawing you have selected by indicating the number that appears on the image of the drawing of your choice. Size and color of the paper varies (white, grey and beige). Approximate size is 12" x  8".PRINTABLE BOOKMARK $1We're on the same page!  Print out and create your own bookmark with an image of "Spiritual Sisters" on the front and back. Just follow the easy instructions.  I'll be giving you a shout out on social media via Facebook!   RISKS AND CHALLENGESThere are no risks associated with the sculpture, as the bronze sculpture Spiritual Sisters has successfully been created and shipped to the museum.  Risk with the perks apply to the delivery time.  Most of the perks will be made to order, while others have been created already and waiting for you to select them.  Feel free to email me with any questions related to your selection.  Lshorin@gmail.com. OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPSpread the news about this project by word of mouth, email, text, social media to 10 people you feel would most likely support this project. Sending good vibes is welcome too! : )

story:
Project Summary

Children of the Mist is a project that comes from two goals. The first is to document and record the Highland and Island communities, and the second is to affect change through art and its exhibition. By distributing and displaying the final product, we hope to raise awareness of the damaging effects of centralisation on these communities.

We will travel along the coast, stopping in small communities along the way, circling up through Sutherland, the Northern Isles and passing finally through the Western Isles and the west coast. We’ll be locating and staying in bothies, camping in the wild, and walking off-road, navigating through less explored regions. In these isolated places we’ll be knocking on doors, talking to communities, and photographing people in their natural environments, in the spirt of the American FSA photographers of the 1930s.

Our goals include compiling the photography and writing into a self-published book or zine, and exhibiting the works, as well as digitally distributing any short film(s) that we might make.

 

Who Are We?

We are Erasmus Mackenna and Theodore Wilkins-Lang, fellow artists and collaborators from Dundee who have been working together for the past year. Last year we both worked on separate projects which involved both fundraising and traveling. Theodore went to America (his homeland), to photograph the Republican Convention, raising money through IndieGoGo, and Erasmus walked on Skye and North Uist to raise money for Highland Hospice and research the history of the region. Children of the Mist would be our first major collaborative undertaking, following a series of short films made in Dundee.

 

Funding: Where is Your Money Going?

We are raising £5000 for this project. The money will be split into several categories: travel, accommodation, supplies including food, film (the project will be shot of analogue film), and distribution costs (from developing the photos to printing a publication). We believe £5000 will cover these costs sufficiently. This amount will also give us the flexibility to invest more time in researching history, travelling, and diving deeper into the secrets of the communities.

 

Why Should I Donate?

We believe that is incredibly important to bring the voices and the culture of the people of the Highlands & Islands to a wider audience, namely the central belt of Scotland, through art. Due to centralisation, people are often left without true representation, forced to toil in silence. As we are both artists, we feel the best way we can help is to use our mediums of writing, spoken word, photography and cinema to raise awareness. You will be aiding our efforts as well as helping two upcoming artists with their first major work in collaboration.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are fully aware that not all of you reading this have the money to donate, even if you want to support us. If that is the case, sharing and spreading the word can have a massive impact.

If you want to know any more about the project, our aims, or anything else, don’t hesitate to contact us via Erasmus’ email: erasmusmackenna@outlook.com.

Thanks so much, and solidarity forever,

-Theodore and Erasmus

story:
Story 

 

I created this gadget inspired by Italian gesture, a fun toy that encapsulates Italian  expressiveness.

 

                                                                                            

I am Emiliano Rubinacci, an Argentine Artist.

I live in Italy for several years now, I came here in 2002 to attend the Academy of Fine Arts in Brera, where I graduated in 2007.

Since 2007, 10 years have passed, years of productions and exhibitions.

I worked on replicas of hands for many years, I believe hands enclose the personality of people, tell who and what we do.

You can find all my work on my web-site

photo of works and exhibitions, videos of making off and much more.


And when I found the "how Italians" network I thought it was the right time to present this work. 
 

What I Need & What You Get

 

My work grows, and I need more materials and tools to facilitate my job, Therefore I turn to you, for help, please "give me a hand"  to be able to continue on my path and continue to create art-works.

              

 

You will receive a Gadget, Made Entirely by Hand in Italy

 

                

With this Gadget, you will have fun with your friends ...

and your day will be fantastic!

 

      

A gesture is a form of non-verbal communication or non-vocal communication in which visible bodily actions communicate particular messages, either in place of, or in conjunction with, speech.

Gestures include movement of the hands, face, or other parts of the body. Gestures differ from physical non-verbal communication that does not communicate specific messages, such as purely expressive displays, proxemics, or displays of joint attention.

Gestures allow individuals to communicate a variety of feelings and thoughts, from contempt and hostility to approval and affection, often together with body language in addition to words when they speak.

             

Thanks ...

story:
Short Summary

Our non-profit association has purchased 50,000 sq. ft. of warehouse space in order to renovate them into art studios of all disciplines as well as community educational spaces.    We have a waiting list of more than 150 artists, from Florida and beyond, ready to move in but right now the usable space is empty.  Become part of our team to renovate these studios.  You can make art happen!  Your support will have life-changing impact on artists and the arts community as a whole for years to come.  

What We Need & What You Get

    • Phase 1a plans are to build 28 art studios at $10,000 each.
    • All donated funds will go toward the cost of building the studios. Once we reach our goal, donors to this campaign will have their names on a finished studio.
    • We have unique perks for donors from beautiful handmade mugs to wall or paver dedication etchings at the ArtsXchange property. 


The Impact

Imagine having artists creating a variety of work in their studio where tourists, students and art collectors and the community can see “where art is made”, learn about their inspirations and interact with the process.  Visitors can purchase these creations directly from the artists. St. Pete, FL is developing a national reputation as not only an arts destination, but also a welcoming community for new artists to relocate and open up shop. Did you know that for every dollar invested in the arts it is returned five-fold in economic impact? 

The Challenge

“Big picture problem: Artists and the arts they create often serve as a catalyst for economic and urban development. Yet a cyclical phenomenon occurs in cities nationwide whereby rents soar and artists can no longer afford the very neighborhoods they helped develop.  One solution: St. Petersburg, a Florida city with an international reputation as a cultural hub, is teaming up with a nonprofit arts organization to break the cycle and ensure that St. Pete artists have a place to continue to create in the heart of the city at sustainable rents.” -Kendra Langlie, 83 Degrees Media

Other Ways You Can Help

If you do or don't make a contribution, please let your friends know about this unique project called the ArtsXchange and how important it is for artists and the economy.

story:
Short Summary

Bleu Art Gallery is in the starting process of becoming a reality and no longer a dream. Since my move from Chicago, IL to Palm Beach, FL I noticed the lack of art towards the young population. A lot of Galleries around the Tri-County area carter to the high-end art retail businesses and the others to the tourists, leaving the middle class local population in-between empty and not involving the community residents.

Bleu Art Gallery wants to bring art and people together for enjoyment, discovery healing and learning throughout a professional environment. Blue Art Gallery wants to create a place where people of every background can be touched by art. Our two main goals are to ensure a safe and positive environment for art classes and new exhibitions in our gallery space. 

What We Need & What You Get

Right now we need $8000.00 for our basics this includes: permits, art supplies, walls for the gallery space, chairs, easels, credit card machine, t-shirts, advertising brochures and cards, banners, insurance. 

For every person that contributes a free T-shirt will be sent or a free art class session if your are in the South Florida area.

The Impact

1.  Art Space - Call to artists and exhibition space.

2.  Art Classes for all ages.

Keys to success and critical factors are, in order of importance:

•  Penetration into the daytime market for art lessons.

•  Allowing emerging artists to show their work in a professional setting at an affordable cost.

•  Community involvement with local not for profit establishments, classes designed for children around the community, student volunteers and scholarships.

Risks & Challenges

As a start up business, a lot of highness business centers will not give you the time of day to pitch your dream idea. They want several 1000's of $ in your bank account to validate you.  I believe  is not about the $$$ in your account but the drive and determination to make a dream a reality.  Yes.. $$ is needed to start anything these days, but the rewards of teaching art  and seeing someone flourish in this field is priceless.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this link on your page!  Or help us get the starting necessities at a discounted price.

story:
About Plata

Plata was conceived in January 2016 by Lady Zen, as a venue to support LGBTQ+ artists in San Miguel De Allende and throughout Mexico. The space, a 75 person capacity underground venue, has been transformed from dark, circus themed decor, to a colorfully lit, hip and welcoming venue that features live music, DJ's and producers, fashion, dance, drag shows, film, visual art, and much more. 


Lady Zen has been in the performing arts since the age of 7, holding a BA in Music Business and an MFA in Creative Writing. (www.theladyzen.com) She returned to San Miguel for the second time in November 2015 to perform and explore entrepreneurial opportunities. Her incredible talent as a vocalist and creative entity opened the doors to owning a venue in SMA. The community has received her with open arms, and it has always been her dream to own a performing arts venue. With the help of her fiancee, Lilia, and others, the first phase of opening the bar began in February 2016, with a grand opening the first week of March.


Plata's birth has been made possible by the investments of San Miguel residents and visitors, and these initial contributions have been a major kickstart in getting the space cleaned, painted, light renovations, promotion, staff training and stock. Our next phase of renovation and streamlining is crucial to establishing Plata as a part of the the SMA community as well as expanding our revenue streams and ensuring the stability of the business. Your contribution, however large or small, will help us take the venue up a notch so we can provide the experience we've envisioned for our patrons.


Our Current Goals

We plan to raise 12,000 for this expansion project. We can accomplish the major needs of the venue with this amount, while we continue to grow into the space. The main reasons we are raising funds are:


  • To build out and soundproof the rear area of the venue. Currently, the back area of the space is a patio with a canvas awning, which leaks sound to our neighbors. We are working with interior designers and a contractor to maximize airflow & cooling, enclose and soundproof this area, as well as create a dressing room adjacent to the stage. This improvement will allow us to entertain our guests at an ideal volume without being a disturbance to the neighborhood, keep the space properly ventilated, and allow our performers a comfortable, private area to get ready.

  • To begin a major outreach and publicity campaign. So far, Plata's main promotion has been through word of mouth and Facebook. We have been amazed at the response simply from these forms of advertising, but it is time to start investing in larger publicity channels. We need to begin reaching out to the residents of nearby cities such as Celaya, Queretaro, Guanajuato, Guadalajara, and Mexico City, to truly put Plata on the regional map.


  • To extend our hours. We are able to purchase the permits to extend our Friday and Saturday hours of operation until 2 AM. Up until now, we have had to close our doors at Midnight, exactly the time when most of our patrons want to come in for a drink. The extension will keep us open at the busiest time of the night, keeping the customers happy and helping our bottom line.


  • To complete the entryway. This includes signage, minor renovation, lighting, handrails, decor, and an area to promote upcoming shows. An update to this area will help us with visibility, create an entrance that will pull in more people walking by, and give a great first impression of the venue.


In the case we don't reach our goal, we will invest first into the renovations for the rear of the building, and the remaining improvements will come afterward, with an emphasis on publicity and the extension of hours.


The Impact

Plata is the only dedicated LGBTQ+ venue in San Miguel, and it is also unique in its focus on performance, creativity and other artforms coming directly from this community in San Miguel. The value of a space like this for individuals who are often marginalized goes beyond monetary worth. Plata is an investment in the gay community, a place for creatives to connect and create, and a home for those who don't always have a place to go. 

The feedback from our patrons has been unbelievably incredible. Gay, straight, trans, queer, and everyone in between, they all feel at home when they walk in. So many patrons comment on how we have created something so different in San Miguel, and how happy they are to be here and support its growth. This is the greatest and most humbling feeling, to be welcomed and treasured for what we are doing. 

The community element of Plata is extremely important to us, and this is why we have partnered with Colectivo 41, (www.colectivo41.org) the first and only youth-led, community-based organization for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, and intersex (LGBTQI) people in San Miguel de Allende. Their mission and values align with ours, and we have created programming to support them in creating safe spaces and activism for LGBTQ rights in Mexico. This is why we created Plata, and the impact of having this gathering place is monumental for the LGBTQ community here.


The Nitty Gritty

We've had our fair share of challenges, from leaking pipes, to noise complaints, and delay of construction. The two of us have been working hard for 3 months straight, cleaning, painting, renovating, as well as building the social media, booking performances, seeking funding, and putting Plata on the map. We have done most of this on our own, with the help of some friends and volunteers along the way. 

This fundraising effort will help us get the proper systems and people in place to make Plata run more smoothly, and take some of the pressure off of us.  With every challenge, there has been a lesson and a opportunity for growth. We know what we need to move forward, and the investment that we've made into the space, of time, energy, love, commitment and positivity has given us the tools to make Plata a continued success.


Every Bit of Energy Helps

We know that it's not always possible to make a monetary contribution. But positive energy is a huge reason why we are here now, Without the support that we have had so far, Plata could have all the money in the world and still fail. 

Even if you are not able to donate, sharing this fundraiser, telling your friends, or just giving us some good vibes makes you a contributor. 


We hope to see you at Plata!

To build out and soundproof the rear area of the venue. Currently, the back area of the space is a patio with a canvas awning, which leaks sound to our neighbors. We are working with interior designers and a contractor to maximize airflow & cooling, enclose and soundproof this area, as well as create a dressing room adjacent to the stage. This improvement will allow us to entertain our guests at an ideal volume without being a disturbance to the neighborhood, keep the space properly ventilated, and allow our performers a comfortable, private area to get ready.


To begin a major outreach and publicity campaign. So far, Plata's main promotion has been through word of mouth and Facebook. We have been amazed at the response simply from these forms of advertising, but it is time to start investing in larger publicity channels. We need to begin reaching out to the residents of nearby cities such as Celaya, Queretaro, Guanajuato, Guadalajara, and Mexico City, to truly put Plata on the regional map.




To extend our hours. We are able to purchase the permits to extend our Friday and Saturday hours of operation until 2 AM. Up until now, we have had to close our doors at Midnight, exactly the time when most of our patrons want to come in for a drink. The extension will keep us open at the busiest time of the night, keeping the customers happy and helping our bottom line.




To complete the entryway. This includes signage, minor renovation, lighting, handrails, decor, and an area to promote upcoming shows. An update to this area will help us with visibility, create an entrance that will pull in more people walking by, and give a great first impression of the venue.


In the case we don't reach our goal, we will invest first into the renovations for the rear of the building, and the remaining improvements will come afterward, with an emphasis on publicity and the extension of hours.
   The Impact 
Plata is the only dedicated LGBTQ+ venue in San Miguel, and it is also unique in its focus on performance, creativity and other artforms coming directly from this community in San Miguel. The value of a space like this for individuals who are often marginalized goes beyond monetary worth. Plata is an investment in the gay community, a place for creatives to connect and create, and a home for those who don't always have a place to go. 

The feedback from our patrons has been unbelievably incredible. Gay, straight, trans, queer, and everyone in between, they all feel at home when they walk in. So many patrons comment on how we have created something so different in San Miguel, and how happy they are to be here and support its growth. This is the greatest and most humbling feeling, to be welcomed and treasured for what we are doing. 
The community element of Plata is extremely important to us, and this is why we have partnered with Colectivo 41, (www.colectivo41.org) the first and only youth-led, community-based organization for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, and intersex (LGBTQI) people in San Miguel de Allende. Their mission and values align with ours, and we have created programming to support them in creating safe spaces and activism for LGBTQ rights in Mexico. This is why we created Plata, and the impact of having this gathering place is monumental for the LGBTQ community here.
   The Nitty Gritty  We've had our fair share of challenges, from leaking pipes, to noise complaints, and delay of construction. The two of us have been working hard for 3 months straight, cleaning, painting, renovating, as well as building the social media, booking performances, seeking funding, and putting Plata on the map. We have done most of this on our own, with the help of some friends and volunteers along the way. 
This fundraising effort will help us get the proper systems and people in place to make Plata run more smoothly, and take some of the pressure off of us.  With every challenge, there has been a lesson and a opportunity for growth. We know what we need to move forward, and the investment that we've made into the space, of time, energy, love, commitment and positivity has given us the tools to make Plata a continued success.
   Every Bit of Energy Helps We know that it's not always possible to make a monetary contribution. But positive energy is a huge reason why we are here now, Without the support that we have had so far, Plata could have all the money in the world and still fail. 
Even if you are not able to donate, sharing this fundraiser, telling your friends, or just giving us some good vibes makes you a contributor. 

We hope to see you at Plata!

story:
Help IAPMA Boost the Bulletin!

IAPMA is producing our 55th Bulletin, a deluxe edition celebrating 30 years of paper art from around the world and featuring a special fold-out poster with 12 handmade paper swatches made by our members! Produced annually, the Bulletin is a gorgeous full-color publication, traditionally with a handmade paper cover, which includes articles, exhibition and book reviews, and scholarly research by leading international contributors in the world of handmade paper and paper art. We are trying to reach new members and reach a wider audience for the Bulletin. We are asking current members to contribute to the Bulletin so we can sustain and exceed the high quality of printing, design, and editorial work going far into the future. If you are not yet a member, consider joining our association or make a donation to receive your own copy of this incredible publication about paper art today!

  • IAPMA—the International Association of Hand Papermakers and Paper Artists—is a not-­for-­profit arts organization dedicated to expanding the relevance of paper as a means of artistic expression, community engagement, and communication across cultural borders.

  • Founded in Germany in 1986, IAPMA’s membership base is comprised of leading international creative paper professionals—contemporary artists, researchers, and craftspersons—working with handmade paper in their communities. IAPMA's mission is to promote knowledge and appreciation of handmade paper, its history, its future, and its boundless artistic applications. 

Our 30th anniversary BOOST THE BULLETIN campaign is both a Bulletin fundraiser and membership drive.

 We're looking for friends and colleagues to help get our unique, ink-on-paper publication into as many hands as possible. We also aim to broaden the dialogue among papermakers, as well as between artists and designers who work with paper. 
  • To date, the IAPMA Bulletin has been a members-only publication. We aim to broaden our scope as we include others doing intriguing work in paper, highlighting both our members as well as other makers who might benefit from involvement.
  • While IAPMA predates the Internet, several founding members still remain actively involved. Our multigenerational membership is thrilled to be exploring the possibilities of what can happen when a technology over two millennia old meets the power and passion of new minds and possibilities.

Artworks included in the "Inspired by Paper" IAPMA 30th anniversary touring exhibition.
On tour in Europe, April 2016 - 2018.

Goals & Gifts

The €9,000 raised helps us cover:

  • Increasing our limited print run from 500 to 1,000 copies
  • A special 30th-anniversary fold-out poster with tipped-in swatches of 12 different handmade papers
  • Targeted outreach to related arts communities
  • Editorial preparation, €3,000
  • Design fees, €5,000
  • Source materials, fibers, €1,000
  • Hand finishing, tip-ins, etc., €1,000
  • Printing, binding, and shipping: €20,000


Thank-you Perks

Handmade notebooks with 30th anniversary papers // Past issues of the IAPMA Bulletin

  • Gift membership, various levels available
  • Gift bulletin subscription, 1 year or multi­-year
  • ­Your name and link to your website listed in IAPMA’s digital newsletter
  • ­Your name listed in the print Bulletin, various levels available
  • Past Bulletins and exhibitions catalogs from our 30 years of paper art
  • An original paper artwork donated by an IAPMA member
If we don't meet the entire goal:
  • Your funding still makes an impact!  We'll scale the size of our print run and outreach efforts to fit whatever amount we do raise, and continue to plan for the future.
(Y)our Impact?
  • Interest in IAPMA on social media has shown that our mission is valuable to a broad range of people all over the world, and with additional funding we will be able to expand our publishing  and distribution activities.
  • IAPMA has been producing the bulletin on a very tight budget for three decades. Now, with your help, we can take our publication and activities to the next level!
  • You care about paper? Let us know! Additional support will enable us to cover new territory, both geographically and intellectually.

Content from previous issues of the IAPMA Bulletin



Risks & Challenges

The main risk we run is that, should we not meet our goal, we'll have to stick to the status quo. Admittedly, our status quo is still pretty stunning, but it would sadden us to know that a material so many people—especially young students—are interested in will have to remain a luxury item for an elite few.

  • Challenge #1: get the word out to people already involved in papermaking
  • Challenge #2: mobilize our community to tap into all of its resources
  • Challenge #3: make the Bulletin bigger and more beautiful than ever
The structure is in place to accomplish all this—we just need YOUR help!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know many people cannot contribute money, but you can help us get the word out about how great handmade paper is!

  • Find and follow us on Facebook and Instagram 
  • Have paper-related ideas? Send them to our Bulletin editor!
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools
