story:
A collection that merits our commitment and investment...

 

San Francisco Ballet Snow Queen costume designed by Leonard Weisgard (1954)    

 

Located in San Francisco, the Museum of Performance + Design stands out as one of the largest collections of the performing arts in the US. Founded in 1947 by Russell Hartley, a dancer and designer with San Francisco Ballet, MP+D has served the arts community for nearly 7 decades. Our museum's collection covers 165 years of history on performance and theater design and includes a large number of original and unpublished materials.

 

Last winter, with the financial help of the Institute of Museum and Library Services, we worked with a professional conservator to survey our 500-piece stage costume holdings. In the process, we re-discovered costumes that had not been seen since their arrival at MP+D. We also learned that 3/4 of the costumes were in need of preservation and conservation treatment(s) for a total cost of $75,000.

 

Our campaign to preserve this precious collection begins now with a subset of 110 costumes. Reaching out to our community through Indiegogo gives us the exciting opportunity to inform the public about this important initiative, rally financial support for it, and get people personally involved in preserving our shared cultural heritage. The success of our immediate efforts depends on your generosity. Give today and make history an important part of our future!

 

"The costumes merit the investment and expense of appropriate conservation treatment, environmental mitigation and pest management, along with adequate archival and conservation-safe long and short-term storage housing,"  says textile conservator Elyse Rousseau. "Implementing these goals will allow for better collection management, with easier safe handling practices for research and exhibition."

 

 

Costumes unpacked during the assessment survey (2015)

 

 

Help us reach our $28,500 goal!

 

Your donations will make it possible for us to perform time-sensitive mold and pest abatement and remediation on 110 costumes. These conservation treatments are done using proven scientific methods that require special equipment and need to be performed by skilled professionals. They include:

 

  • professional CO2 Anoxia Oxygen Deprivation Ecapsulation and Dry Thermal Vacuuming Freezing ($25,000)
  • new archival storage and housing materials for long-term storage ($3000) 
  • retrieval/restocking fees from cold storage and delivery charges ($500)

 

 

Winged ornamented black cape worn by Serge Oukrainsky in Dance Macabre (c. 1920s)

 

Giving a new lease on life to 110 historically significant stage costumes is no small thing. It involves pulling large boxes out of cold storage, hiring a professional conservator with specialized skills and equipment, and time.

 

The work would look like this:

 

1. The winged ornamented black cape worn by dance innovator Serge Oukrainsky in Dance Macabre, for example, would be one of 110 costumes pulled out of cold storage. 

 

2. Our professional conservator would group the cape with a few other costumes based on like materials and dimensions.

 

3. She would individually vacuum-wrap and seal each group item in polypropylene plastic, and place them as a group in a freezing chamber at -20 degrees centigrade for 3 weeks.

 

4. Once out of the freezing chamber, she would unwrap each group item and place them still as a group in the anoxia chamber for oxygen deprivation for 3 - 5 weeks.

 

5. She would ensure that all insects or microbial species are abated and remedied before properly folding each costume using new archival grade materials and boxes. 

 

6. She would repeat these same steps with the 100 and some other costumes.

 

With your financial support, we are ready to do the unglamorous, dirty work so these costumes continue to shine in exhibitions, academic research, and the hearts and minds of history lovers for generations to come! We can achieve our goal quickly if all of you give.

 

Even a small contribution of $5 or $10 can help. If a contribution of $10 is out of reach, then reach out to your social network and let people know about our campaign. The sooner we succeed on Indiegogo, the quicker we can stop the degradation process of pests and mold on these 110 one-of-a-kind museum pieces. 

 

 

Follow in the footsteps of our Angel Project!

 

Ellen McLaughlin inTony Kushner's Angels In America: Millenium Approaches (Eureka Theater, 1991), wearing wings designed by Sandra Woodall, which are preserved at MP+D 

                 

The Costume Society of America/Western Region (CSA) is behind our efforts.  On Sept 18, CSA members donated 90 hours through its Angel Project towards vacuuming, folding and re-housing of 50+ costume pieces that did not need any other treatments. What's more, Hollinger Metal Edge donated archival supplies and boxes to the Project.  

 

We are inviting you to follow in their footsteps, pitch in, and help us save these costumes. As one of our campaign donors, you will be acknowledged in ways both humble and exciting, all unique to our campaign and our collection. You like history? You like unique experiences? You like collecting? You can find something that will strike your fancy!

 

Be creative and bring a group of friends together to make it to one of the higher donor levels! At the $2,500 level, you get to tour the mysterious setting of the archive and have a photo opportunity with a publicity set of the striking wings from Tony Kushner's Angels in America! 

 

At the $5,000 mark, you get a unique chance to adopt a costume and attach your name(s) indefinitely to the costume's records (the choice of the costume will happen in consultation with the MP+D Director and the MP+D Head Librarian ). MP+D is a registered 501 (c) (3) charitable organization, and all gifts are tax-deductible within the extent of the law.

 

 

An encyclopedic and comprehensive costumes collection

 

Violetta, La Traviata costume worn by Italian coloratura Luisa Tretrazzini (1871-1940)

 

The costumes held at the Museum of Performance + Design range from the early 1900s through the early 2000s, with the majority acquired between 1947 - 1982 by MP+D’s founder Russell Hartley, himself a dancer and costume designer. The costume collection consists of more than 500 individual pieces and accessories. It is an expression of the extensive and rich history of ballet and opera in 20th c. America.

 

The collection contains costumes worn by distinguished dancers and opera singers such as Alexandra Danilova, Luisa Tetrazzini, Blanche Thebom, Lily Pons, Leonide Massine, and Dorothy Kirsten. The collection also contains costumes from Ballets Russes, the company that revolutionized early 20th c. arts.; Pavley-Oukrainsky Ballet, the first independent ballet company in the U.S.; San Francisco Ballet, the oldest professional ballet company in the U.S. It also holds pieces used in productions by San Francisco Opera, one of the world’s leading opera companies for more than 90 years.

 

 

Oriental Boy pants designed by Natalia Gontcharova for Le Coq D'Or, Ballets Russes de Monte-Carlo (c. 1937)

                                                                   

 

Preserving the threads to our past

 

During our detailed assessment survey, costumes were evaluated and categorized with green, purple, and red tags according to their specific preservation and conservation treatment issues. Red tags were an instant alert— these objects were identified as having a severe to moderate microbial/mold or insect/pest infestation— both active and dormant. Purple tags indicated that the objects were in need of cleaning or fabric repair. And green tags recognized the need for urgent re-housing for both the short and long-term.

 

    Mold and pest abatement and remediation (red tags) is the single most costly treatment of this whole preservation project and the most time-sensitive. Micro-organisms and molds are contaminants that have the potential to spread throughout a collection if left to proliferate and colonize onto other adjacent and nearby surfaces. This means that, if left untreated, collection costumes will deteriorate rapidly and be unsuitable for exhibition and research. They will also be at great risk of being lost forever.

     

     

           

    Pavley-Oukrainsky Ballet vampire costume from the Serge Oukrainsky collection (circa 1920s)                    

                            

     

    Thank you!

     

    By backing our campaign, you contribute to preserving the threads to our past in a momentous way. Your participation will advance the stewardship of our costume collection and prepare it to be safely preserved for generations to come and displayed at the Museum of Performance + Design. 

     

    Visit our campaign page often so you may communicate with fellow contributors via comments and keep an eye out for updates on our progress and your perk fulfillment. You may also contact us via direct messaging.

     

    Indiegogo wants you to know that safeguards and monitoring are in place to maintain your safety, secure the information it collects online, and prevent unauthorized access. Indiegogo is TRUSTe certified. You may also access the Help center at any time. Indiegogo's amazing Customer Happiness agents will reply to any support query within 24 hours.

     

    Give generously,

     

    Thank you!

     

    Credits:

    Video credits: Patricia Keleher, performer; BenPierceCreative, camera; Rebecca Lillich, editing

    Photo credits: Museum of Performance + Design except Angels in America

    Campaign image: Contemporary Noh mask designed by Katherine Mezur in the June Watanabe Papers at the Msueum of Performance + Design

Indiegogo is TRUSTe certified. You may also access the Help center at any time. Indiegogo's amazing Customer Happiness agents will reply to any support query within 24 hours. Give generously, Thank you! Credits:Video credits: Patricia Keleher, performer; BenPierceCreative, camera; Rebecca Lillich, editingPhoto credits: Museum of Performance + Design except Angels in AmericaCampaign image: Contemporary Noh mask designed by Katherine Mezur in the June Watanabe Papers at the Msueum of Performance + Design

story:
We are the the Demon Within Production Team, students who work in team to strive for an accomplished film. This project is called “The Demon Within” and it is about a mother and daughter fleeing from their village after it has been taken over by a band of rogue ninjas. Seeking safety and revenge the mother leads her daughter down a path which leads to two shrines, one good the other....not so good; there, a choice must be made. The mother, hell-bent on vengeance makes the wrong choice and allows her anger to consume her, whereas the daughter, guided by love and forgiveness, learns a lesson far more precious.. This campaign is crucial for this project because it will help drive the film forward, it will help us get the help and support from everyone.  

We need $30,000 to fund for our animation. The funding will go towards the venue to screen our animation, posters, and entering film festivals, getting the programs, and paying for a composer. We are a team of determined and talented artist. We laugh, we cry, and we cherish each other like a family. We use gags and jokes for entertainment to keep our spirit lively. We have a strong passion to fight each war and to tackle obstacles. However, the funding will still go towards our priority if all things failed.

Obstacles will be a bumpy road and everything will be a crying storm, but that will not stop us from achieving our goals. Our plan is to have a backup plan, external route, to solve problem, find options, and to take risks if no option is available.  

Thank you for contributing and supporting us! Please help share our website, projects, and spread the word around by clicking the Indiegogo share tool!

story:
Since its inception in 2007, Gallery 788 has grown to become a fixture in the Baltimore arts community. As many of you may know, we are an adaptive and fluid arts organization dedicated to presenting the breadth of artistic production unique to the region. Gallery 788 does this through a series of gallery spaces that highlight a rotating lineup of monthly art exhibits, musical performances, educational series, and interactive art events. Over the years, Gallery 788 has worked to build an inclusive and welcoming environment for a diverse and dynamic audience and we endeavour to create an experience that enlightens, engages, and builds lasting relationships between the Greater Baltimore community and the arts.

We are currently in the process of finding a new home to continue our mission here in Baltimore City. Rest assured, this is not the first time Gallery 788 has relocated with the purpose of progressing and growing as a gallery. Gallery 788 has found that moving to various venues around the city helps us to continue to innovate in order to produce the wide variety of events our patrons have come to expect from us. Whether as a participant, artist, or attendee, we work earnestly to provide engaging spaces, creative installations, and a truly welcoming and enriching environment in which to experience and interact with the arts. As we say goodbye to our current Hampden location, we look forward to landing in a new space and evolving the future of Gallery 788!

Towards that end, we’ve found a fantastic location that will provide us with the room to grow and continue our mission. However, our new place is a fixer upper. So far we've determined we will need to construct new wall space, improve the lighting to showcase original pieces, and add air conditioning to protect the art and transform the space into a creative oasis in the middle of our hot, humid Baltimore summers. It is for these things that we seek funding and support from the community and have launched this Indiegogo campaign.

While we finalize our next location, Gallery 788 will be holding pop up shows in temporary locations throughout the city and region. We value your patience and continued support during our transition. When we receive the funding needed to continue our mission, we will communicate a more detailed timeline as well as a date for our Grand Reopening!

Gallery 788 has never been defined by the walls that surround it, or the art it contains, but rather by the people that make it the amazing family that it has become. We look forward to growing with each and every one of you, as, without you, Gallery 788 is nothing!

story:
Who Am I and What Is an ArtMobile?

I am an art educator with many years of experience facilitating people of all ages in their journeys to express themselves visually, demonstrating how to use the tools and techniques of making art so they can release their creativity, regardless of their perceived level of talent. I believe that creative expression is very personal and needs only to benefit the creator - if Someone Else likes the outcome, so much the better - but it's the process of creating art that is of the utmost importance.

The idea for the ArtMobile was conceived while I was a student pursuing my Art Education degree 15 years ago. There are many remote communities in northern Arizona - small towns scattered over great distances throughout the entire area. Many of the residents cannot afford art lessons and art materials even if they were locally available. So I thought, What if there was a way to bring art to people in need the same way that books are brought to those who cannot come to the library? Like a book mobile but for sharing art!

There was no Indiegogo back then and I had no clue how to fund such an idea so I put it on the back burner of my mind, got my teaching certificate and became a public school art teacher. Many years later I participated in my first Burn and saw all the magnificent mutant vehicles. I was mesmerized by the variety of creative expression parading in front of me. These vehicles not only brought people out to the art of Burning Man - they were works of art in and of themselves! What a concept!

And so - originally thought of as only a vehicle for carrying art supplies - my humble ArtMobile idea evolved into the project I'm presenting here.

The ArtMobile is an interactive art experience gifting the opportunity to engage in creating artworks that will be displayed throughout the community before going home with the creators, modeling the Burning Man Principles everywhere it goes.

Your contribution will help bring the opportunity to practice Radical Self-Expression to countless men, women, and children for many years to come. Everything I've done in my professional  life has been in preparation of  creating  this project. It is my dream, my life's purpose. I hope  you will support me in making it a reality.

What We Need & What You Get

The first step in creating the ArtMobile is to purchase a StepVan. The asking price of a 1986 Ford Grumman that I found through a reputable dealer is $4,995, before taxes, insurance and related costs are applied. So, initial funds needed to buy a suitable vehicle will be about $7,500. This is the minimum requested in this campaign and if that goal is met, Indiegogo's InDemand feature will allow me to continue raising funds.

So then, to bring the ArtMobile to life, I'll need to raise an additional $7,500:
  • $2,000 will provide storage cabinets and equipment for the mobile Art Classroom and create an Observation Deck on the roof.
  • $1,000 will attach frames to the exterior of the van, creating a unique Gallery for displaying participants' works of art.
  • $1,500 will light up the Gallery and Classroom for night viewing and dressing up for celebrations.
  • $1,500 will provide durable afternoon shade for ArtMobile participants.
  • $1,500 will purchase all art supplies and fuel needed for the duration of Burning Man 2016, where the ArtMobile will make its debut.
After the ArtMobile is up and running, I will be filing for 501(c)(3) non-profit status in order to raise on-going funding through grants. This will cost an additional $400 in filing fees.

Funds raised above and beyond these basic needs will be used to purchase additional art supplies and fuel so that the ArtMobile can continue serving the needs of people in remote communities.

Perks range from ArtMobile stickers and shwag to limited edition prints of an original painting inspired by my Burning Man experiences. Check them out!

And of course...be sure to find the ArtMobile on the playa and participate in creating some artwork of your own!

Risks & Challenges

Life is full of challenges, and every good idea is fraught with trials and errors. It is through taking risks that we learn and grow...bringing the ArtMobile to life is no different.

What are the risks and challenges of this project? I cannot honestly say that I know. But I can honestly say that I will meet them, one by one, and persevere. For every problem that might come up, there IS at least one solution. By networking with people who are more experienced with mutating a vehicle, there is no challenge that I cannot overcome.

My biggest challenge is getting the word out to people who not only like the idea of the ArtMobile, but are willing to help make it happen by contributing to this campaign. However, if I don't reach my entire goal, your contribution will be transferred to a new campaign to meet the needs of funding this project. The ArtMobile WILL ROLL one way or another!

Other Ways You Can Help

Every donation is appreciated and builds toward my goal - every $1 counts! - but if  you can't contribute financially, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about the ArtMobile. Share this campaign every way and everywhere you can. Don't forget about the Indiegogo share tools - they make spreading the word easy!
  • Volunteer! The ArtMobile is not going to make itself and I can't do it alone. If you live in Northern Arizona or plan to visit the area, consider donating your time and talent to this project. Click the contact button above or leave a message on the ArtMobile Facebook page for more information.
  • Also, although I have found suitable vehicles online, most of them are a very long distance away from where I live...which means it would cost a lot of money just to check them out. If you know of a StepVan for sale - preferably a Ford motor with an automatic transmission - please let me know!
  • THANK YOU!

Volunteer! The ArtMobile is not going to make itself and I can't do it alone. If you live in Northern Arizona or plan to visit the area, consider donating your time and talent to this project. Click the contact button above or leave a message on the ArtMobile Facebook page for more information.

THANK YOU!

story:
Through my inward journey this past year I have realized my life’s purpose is to share messages of Love through creative expression.  To transform my thoughts, emotions and visions into art on canvas. To explore the rich lands of this world, to touch and inspire the lives of children across the globe, and to share my experiences, wisdom and Love through art, photos, videography and creative writing. 

Here is how you can help:

  • Send words or energy of encouragement my way.
  • Help me create a website (with the option to subscribe to a blog and e-commerce)
  • Give me advice on a new computer, (pc) mine is having a hard time supporting the passion pumping through my veins.
  • Donate or give advice on a good artists easel/ brushes.
  • Offer your empty space as a option for me to paint in.
  • Suggest where I can get access to a large printer.
  • Give advice on where to get high quality prints of art made.

I will be creating a video for this soon, but I was told I just need to open the door and get something basic up for now. 

I bow in the sincerest of gratitude for your time and any of your support. I will be showing love back to everyone who supports me during this vulnerable yet exciting time in my life. Thank you for believing in me.

Here are a few samples of my past and current work:

"Art speaks with a silent whisper channeled directly to the heart and soul. Art uplifts and inspires us. Art is an expression of creativity, which is the language of God. Art is a song of the Angelic Choir. Art opens our heart to the magic and mystery of life and Art connects us to the extraordinary beauty and power of the universe."

Instagram: @theedgyhippie

story:
The Idea Behind BanditFest'15 aka Quick Lithuanian Lesson

In Lithuanian, "BANDYTI" is a verb meaning "to try". So a person, who TRIES (in Lithuanian - "bando") to think, create and act is a BANDIT ("banditas"). Therefore we are bandits and our movement is BANDITISM. That's where the BanditFest comes from.

The idea of BanditFest‘15 is to help young and unknown Lithuanian music makers to try, be encouraged  and present their music to those who are interested, want to discover new concepts of music, and try by themselves. We are striving to create a unique opportunity in Lithuania to discover, get involved and participate in the creation process of a festival, which aims to cover various branches of art and invites all art enthusiasts as well as people and families that like spending their time in the right way to support young Lithuanian artists in an authentic historic environment. 

Your contribution is a very important part of making all this happen. Now we are struggling with the finances and are barely able to provide the very basics of a simple event, but every single contribution would push us further into being able to make this festival more professional and unforgettable.


What Do We Need?

We are very lucky to have such amazing artists perform at the festival only because they believe in this idea and are passionate instead of greedy, but we still have to provide them with a free ride there. So, we extremely need money to cover their transportation costs (500 Eur) as well as money to pay for the stage equipment (1200 Eur) and security (400 Eur). Of course there are other things, but these are the ones requiring the highest sums. The stage has to be payed for on the day of the event, but at least the fuel for the artists can be payed for a little bit later - that is why the campaign does not end with the event's date - we truly hope the initiative will not be ignored and You will help us bring the music and talents together!

What Do You Get?

We really want to believe there are people out there who like the idea of Banditism, understand why we are doing this and want to help us. We hope You are one of them, and we have thought of some bandit-ish perks You will get for contributing:
  • 5 Eur - a personal Thank You note (e-mailed)
  • 10 Eur - a personal Thank You note (per post)
  • 20 Eur - a festival's poster with the musicians' autographs (e-mailed)
  • 30 Eur - an invite to the festival next year
  • 50 Eur - a festival's poster with the musicians' autographs (per post)
  • 75 Eur - a VIP invite to the festival next year
  • 100 Eur - a personal Thank You caption in the aftermovie
  • 150 Eur - a personal Thank You caption in the aftermovie + a VIP invite to the festival next year
  • 250 Eur - a personal short Thank You clip from one of the festival's bands
  • 500 Eur - a CD with the musicians' songs and autographs (per post) + a personal Thank You caption in the aftermovie
  • 1000 Eur - a CD with the musicians' songs + a festival's poster with the musicians' autographs + a personal short Thank You clip from one of the festival's bands
  • 1500 Eur - 2 VIP invites to the festival next year + a CD with the musicians' songs + a festival's poster with the musicians' autographs + a personal short Thank You clip from one of the festival's bands + a painting from the visual performance during the festival

The Impact

With Your contributions You are giving us the opportunity to create a secure environment and place for the young talents to reach their goals and dreams as well as the right people. With Your trust and support You are helping us to unite the right community and stand for something big - the opportunity and power of the young generation to dream and create, spread their ideas and, maybe, even change the world? Although the festival is very young, it went great last year, is growing very fast and has a huge potential. We are asking You to understand the necessity of such movement and event to the young artists and the community, to believe in our aims and help us make them happen.

Risks & Challenges

As the festival is so young and only taking place for the second year, the possible partners do not trust its success yet as well as the audience does not rush to buy the tickets. We will have many guests and volunteers, but we do not have enough funding and confidence about the tickets to be sold to ensure the proper realization of the event. For now we only hope to be able to make the event as qualitative as possible with such little funds and not end up with debts. To avoid that we are trying hard to promote the event as widely and creative as we can to get as much tickets sold as possible, and to still attract at least some funding from the private companies.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are hoping You will help us in either way You can, whether You can contribute financially or spread the word about the initiative - it will be very much appreciated!! Thank You for every 5 Euros and every share with Your friends or on Your wall - that means You too are TRYING ("bandai") to contribute to realizing the dreams of the young artistic generation, therefore You are a BANDIT. Welcome to the community!

story:
I've always had an adoration for letters, and growing up in the mountains of North Georgia, the intricate minutae of nature became a constant filter through which I see many things.
I began doing calligraphy and hand lettering in 2003, when asked to address invitations for a friend's wedding, and since then, have watched my lettering style continually evolve and mature.
Most recently, in 2015, I began going one step beyond simply writing the letters, and began illustrating them with varying botanical and nature images. I like to think that each one tells a different story, and I am eager to share them all.
Funding toward this campaign will be used to cover basic necessities while working on the remaining letters (about ten more to go!) as well as production costs such as printing, paper testing, and professional photography. The grand finale (fingers crossed!!!) will be the creation and printing of two separate book styles - a hands-on coloring book, as well as a luxurious cloth-bound coffee table book with high quality fiber papers to really bring out the depth and texture of my drawings. I hope to inspire other lettering artists, as well as those who simply enjoy the time-intensive work that goes into each letter to pause to observe the beauty around us on a daily basis.
My goal is to have the first batch in production in early 2016. Those who contribute $75 or more will have early access to the hardcover book when printed, as well as receive a shrink-wrapped version of the coloring book prototype with a handwritten calligraphy Thank You note in time for the holidays!

You can view a teensy (slightly grainy) action video here! https://instagram.com/p/6gC0evR9iS/

Many thanks for taking a moment to allow me to share my ideas

story:
Premise

Everybody has got their reasons to leave and this decision will take one on a journey. Please, feel free to join one of them.

         Limbo Citizen is... an interactive 'walkthrough' documentary to be located in the city center of Utrecht- starting as of the 1st of May in Utrecht's medieval cathedral, the Domkerk. In this real-life sized maze, you will find out about the story of four different migrants. An undocumented migrant from Ghana, an asylum-seeker from Syria, an economic migrant from Kenya and a student from India will bring you closer to the problems they encountered given their lack of an EU-member passport. Despite coming from completely different backgrounds, there is one thing in common in all their stories: after leaving their homes, they end up in a Limbo. This is, a transition phase in which the present is unsettled and the coming future uncertain. 

Hello, here is Pien and Lillian- together we are the creators of Limbo Citizen.

 Our project looks forward in giving you, the user, a taste of what it is like to be in the vacuum of four migrants. What we want is to give citizens the opportunity to experience the 'limbo' situation of someone else. This is, a state that is caused by the pressure to obtain a legal status once seeking to stay in a foreign country. Imagine feeling stuck. Have you ever thought about the limitations of being born in circumstances where it seems you were given the "wrong"  nationality? 

Hmm...

Holding the status of EU citizenship comes with so many privileges that most of the time it is hard to notice they are there even once you have it. Besides the normal bureaucracy here and there, travelling and moving abroad for work or study for most EU passport holders is not much of a problem- at least not between the borders of minimum 26 countries within the Schengen area plus another 20 more countries in the rest of the world when travelling as a tourist (see the map below).

(Image retrieved from Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Visa_requirements_for_European_Union_citizens)

However, this is not the same for everyone. A person from outside of the EU, let's say, Bolivia, who comes to study in an EU country, for instance, the Netherlands, will most likely have a hard time trying to figure out how to stay for a longer time in the Netherlands after she/he has completed her/his studies. Once the study period is over, one is expected to leave the EU as soon as possible. For some, when this expiry date of stay is approaching this sometimes may take on a sudden and hasted decision such as applying  for a new study program to extend a residence permit. In some cases, this may even take on a drastic decision such as marrying an EU national in order to obtain the rights of civil union. Regardless the choice, waiting for the legal measures of stay, creates a time of uncertainty, frustration and anxiety for the individual. In this situation, one sees how civil freedoms of education, work, mobility and settlement are limited depending on one’s national citizenship. 

Idea

The idea for this project came from a time where, one of us- Lillian- was personally experiencing what she would describe as a suffocating and claustrophobic feeling of uncertainty, fear and anxiety- a state we came to see here as "a legal 'limbo'". Heavy-headed, she watched time flash by as she frantically searched for alternatives to continue her stay. That is her, a few months ago...weighted down by her limbo-head.  


After finishing my studies in the Netherlands, as a Brazilian national I was expected to leave the Netherlands given that my study permit was about to expire. This was a very stressful and frustrating time for me as I did not want to leave. Seeing me go through this experience made Pien aware of her privileges as a Dutch citizen.

Together, we became interested about how other people are having trouble with their right to stay in a foreign country (in the EU, especially) and if they also experience what we perceive to be Limbo. When talking to people about it, we came to notice that waiting for the legal means to stay or having the status of being 'undocumented’ creates a feeling of in-betweenness or stuckness due to the presence of this legal barrier and pressure. We came to realize that once in this situation one comes to feel out of place as one's sense of belonging becomes lost. Due to my growing up as a “third-culture” kid, I sometimes felt lost about which culture I belonged and so, that complicated my perception towards the country I was seemingly expected to go back to. I was puzzled about wanting to stay in Europe when I am actually Brazilian and was held with the expectation of going back although for the past 11 years I have lived outside of my 'home country'. From this, we have come to see nationality as an arbitrary concept. In terms of nation borders and citizenship, the enforcement and implications of these concepts can make an individual feel not only unworthy or misplaced but also feel high levels of stress and anxiety given all the bureaucratic problems and constant uncertainty about the future. 

However, such limits of national bureaucracy and citizenship often remain invisible until you have to deal with it...

That's why,

we want to create Limbo Citizen in hope to offer citizens of the world, a surprising possibility to become aware and hopefully reflect on their privileges or, lack of it, given their citizen status. By doing this, we also hope to question the status of nationality and citizen rights in today's time of globalization and migration. 
Now,you may be asking how...

An open and free interactive installation located in the city center of Utrecht.

Each line in the map represents a limbo story and pathway the user will be assigned when entering Limbo Citizen. On the right side, you can see its size on real-life measurements.  Once inside this 6m x 5m size and 3.5 meters high maze, you are expected to find your way by the access of your Limbo ID card, thus, unlocking bit by bit of your given character's story.

But, we need you.

So far we managed to raise altogether a budget of 3,500 euros. This was thankfully to the aid of 1000 euros prize-money from Camera Interactiva competition program (on the 10th of December, 2015) and 2,500 euros from Gemeente Utrecht's cultural subsidy  funds awarded just recently (on the 7th of March, 2016). About 1000 euros out of the 3,500 has been spent  for buying the tools and materials for building the outside of the installation such as the framework tent and its consisting fabric, thread and ropes. We also used some of that money to buy and test out the technical parts of the installation such as card readers and headphones. Below you can see some of our progress, with one of the limbo pathways on the process of being built and tested.

At the moment we are in the process of finishing up with the cutting and sewing of the fabrics for the rest of the other limbo pathways in the installation, as well as preparing all of the audio-visual material such as filming, video editing, writing up the final parts of the script, as well as carrying out audio recordings and processing it. 


So we already managed to raise some money, but they don’t fully cover our estimated costs of transportation, the technical parts, parts of the design and not yet paid costs from the work of collaborating specialists like, technicians, sound producers, visual artists, actors and photographers in our team (yes, surprisingly, artists need to eat too!). By helping us raise 1,500 euros you would more specifically help us attain the more technical parts of the installation such as projectors, lights, raspberry pi's, headphones.

In order to make the Limbo ID card activate to the corresponding audio-visual material, we will need the following for the electronic and technical parts, this would be a total estimate of 1,500 euros. These include:

  • Projectors: 600 euros

  • Lights: 200 euros

  • Raspberry pi's: 105 euros

  • Headphones:  100 euros

  • Remaining card readers: 60 euros

  • Electricity and pieces (cables, wifi-transmitters, relais, etc) : 500

Furthermore, we are still working on some parts of the design of the installation itself, such as the roof, the floor and so on. This will cost us approximately 1,000 euros:

  • Floor: 200

  • Roof: 500

  • Boxes for the RFID-readers: 150

  • Finishing touch (ribbons, rope, weights on the bottom, pegs and guy rope for bad weather): 150

We try to work as much as possible with volunteers, but for some parts, we really need professionals, and they need to be paid, these are approximately 1000 euros:

  • Technical services: 200-300 euros

  • Sound editors: 100-200 euros

  • Voiceover actors: 100-200 euros

  • Audio-visual artists: 100-200 euros

  • Extras- transportation costs, re-contribution of interviews, locations: 300 euros

So a contribution would really help us reach that extra mile! In case you cannot, it would be great if you could show your support by spreading the word amongst yours friends and sharing this page on social media.

And lastly (oh finally!),
We would like to thank you for making it until the end while reading through this lengthy campaign! We know it's long, but good ideas take some time. We hope it was worthy of yours too though and also to see you next time, in 'limbo'.

story:
ABOUT ME

EN Hi, I’m Miguel Martins, a.k.a. Edis One, my artistic name. Since 2007 I’ve been working on street art. When I started on Graffiti I never thought I could make a profession out of it, but today I have the chance to say that I live from what I love to do. Most of what I’ve done lately has been focused on changing the perception people have about street art.
One of the projects that made me prouder was MUDAR LISBOA, a project I launched where we wrapped public objects with cellophane. We wanted to call peoples attention to our monuments and it had a great impact both with media and public in general.

With graffiti I’ve had some great experiences and some not so great, that made me grow as a person as well as an artist, and from which I’ve learned that life’s short and we have to be true to ourselves and fight for our goals.

PT Olá, o meu nome é Miguel Martins mas na minha profissão sou conhecido por Edis One. Desde de 2007 que estou ligado ao mundo da street art e hoje posso dizer que vivo daquilo que mais gosto!

Já criei vários projetos relacionados com Street Art e a maior parte das minhas iniciativas têm o objetivo de ajudar a credibilizar esta forma de arte em Portugal.

Um dos projetos que criei com maior impacto foi “A MUDAR LISBOA”, que passou por chamar a atenção dos habitantes da cidade para objetos públicos, embrulhando-os com celofane. O projeto teve um enorme e inesperado impacto quer ao nível da comunicação social quer das pessoas em geral.

Com o graffiti já vivi várias experiencias e passei por diversos obstáculos que me fizeram crescer bastante como pessoa e como artista. Aprendi que a vida é curta e que temos que lutar e acreditar nas ideias que temos.


VAN STREET ART

EN Van Street Art is a consequence of this attitude. It is mainly a great challenge. An Idea with great potential that I’d love to see growing.

It all started on my visit to Art Basel, world’s biggest street art event, in Miami, 2014. In this event I came across with something I loved: a van that had an exposition in its interior.

I discussed this concept with some friends and decided to create an event dedicated to Street Art. An event that aims to be an international reference and highlight portuguese culture and its artists.

The objective of Van Street Art is to reinvent the concept of a traditional art gallery, from a street concept to a modern one, inside a van.

The main event will take place in Lisbon, during 2 days, in Parque das Nações. 6 vans will host 6 of the best street artists expositions.

The event will have live painting, workshops, a DJ set and of course lots of street art.

The main artists will be:

MISTER DHEO, from Porto, has already two Guinness Records and many works around the world.


PARIZ ONE, from Lisboa, is one of the most international portuguese artists. His work is spread all around the world. At this moment he is involved in European projects of urban space requalification.

SMILE, from Odivelas, on of the most representative artists of híper realism, in Portugal. Smile has been always focused on visibility to portuguese street art, although he has already several works around Europe.

The other three artists are still blocked. It will be a surprise!

But Van Street Art is much more than a 2 days event. It wouldn’t make sense to have art inside a van and keep it parked. So I thought of a roadshow where, during 4 months, we will showcase the event  in Lisbon, in a first moment in iconic city spots, and in a second moment in secondary schools, where we will also demonstrate to kids why street art should be treated with care and respect.

PT O VAN STREET ART é uma consequência desta atitude. É uma ideia, um desafio, com enorme potencial que eu quero trabalhar para que um dia consiga ganhar asas.

Surge de uma viagem que fiz a Miami em 2014, onde tive o prazer de estar na Art Basel, considerado o maior evento de arte de todo o mundo. Nesta viagem reparei em algo único, uma carrinha com uma exposição no seu interior.

Em conversa com amigos resolvi criar um evento dedicado à Street Art. Um evento que possa a vir a ser uma referencia a nível mundial, destacando Portugal, a sua cultura e os seus artistas.

O objetivo do VAN SREET ART, é modernizar uma galeria tradicional, galeria de rua, para uma galeria moderna, dentro de uma carrinha.

Para isso iremos ter um main event, com a duração de 2 dias em Lisboa, no Parque das Nações. 6 carrinhas vão receber uma exposição de 6 artistas de renome internacional.

Para além das exposições, podemos contar com pintura ao vivo, workshops, música e muita arte!

Entre os artistas confirmados destacam-se:

MISTER DHEO, da cidade do Porto. Já conta com dois records do Guiness e com muitas obras espalhadas por todo o mundo.

PARIZ ONE, da cidade de Lisboa, foi dos primeiros artistas portugueses a ter um seu nome em diversos países. As suas obras estão espalhadas um pouco por todo o mundo. Está atualmente envolvido em projetos Europeus de requalificação de espaços urbanos.

SMILE, da cidade de Odivelas. Um dos artistas que faz híper realismo em Portugal. No seu percurso a nível de artista, tenta sempre criar projetos para dar uma visibilidade à street art nacional. Conta também com alguns trabalhos na Europa.

Mas ter só este fim de semana dedicado à Street Art, não fazia sentido e para isso criei o VAN STREET ART ROADSHOW onde após o main event iremos circular durante 4 meses pela cidade de Lisboa mostrar o resumo do nosso evento. Numa primeira fase em zonas centrais da cidade e numa segunda vamos a escolas secundárias mostrar aos mais novos o que a Street Art tem de bom.


YOUR HELP

EN Gather support for Street Art events in Portugal is not an easy task! We’ve already knocked on many doors but found most of them closed. But as I said before, I believe in my work and specially in the potential of this project.

With your help we will make Van Street Art a reality! But please don’t look at it as an event like many others. Van Street Art is a window to street art in general. A first step to take street art to the higher ground it already deserves!

PT Mas arranjar apoios para a criação de eventos relacionados com a Street Art em Portugal não é tarefa fácil! Batemos a muitas portas e encontrámos a maioria fechadas mas acredito naquilo que faço e acredito no poder que este projeto poderá ter a nível cultural.

Com a vossa ajuda vamos fazer do Van Street Art uma realidade. Gostava que não vissem isto como um simples evento, mas como um claro apoio a uma cultura que está a crescer cada vez mais. Um primeiro passo para levar a Street Art ao lugar de destaque que já merece!


PERKS

EN So what will it take? Any donation to make this dream come alive is more then welcome!

So if you, as a person or company, want to be part of it, here’s what you can expect in return:

PERSONAL DONATIONS

1 € - Thanks for believing!

25 € - A branded t-shirt. You can choose from several sizes and one of 3 colors: gray, black or white. Size: S, M, L, XL and XXL.

200 € - 3 official prints of the event. A limited edition of 100 units.

500 € - A art work from one of the artists present in the event. Limited to 60 participants.

1.000 € - A mini van painted by an artist of your choice. And the 3 official prints! Limited to 20 units.

3.500 € - 6 mini vans, personalized by each of the 6 artists of the event. You will also be invited to participated in one of the street art city roadshow venues.

5.000 € - (only to non residents in Portugal) – This is your opportunity to live the event from the inside. Your donation includes a trip to Lisboa, B&B for 5 days, and an opportunity to see and participate on the main event from the inside. You will also have a private graffiti workshop, 3 official prints and 6 personalized mini vans.


COMPANY DONATIONS

Bronze Sponsor – 3.500 €

Includes a 3x3 tent where you can activate your brand. Your sponsorship will be communicated in all the events communication materials.

Your brand will be associated with a unique vanguardist event, in contact with a community of over 400.000 fans.

Silver Sponsor – 6.000 €

Includes a 3x3 tent where you can activate your brand in the main event and a 2x2 area to active your brand with the roadshow. Your sponsorship will be communicated in all the events communication materials.

Your brand will be associated with a unique vanguardist event, in contact with a community of over 400.000 fans. Contact with over 70.000 persons in all venues.

Gold Sponsor – 8.000 €

Central tent where you can activate your brand in the main event and a 2x2 area to active your brand with the roadshow. Your sponsorship will be communicated in all the events communication materials.

Your brand will be associated with a unique vanguardist event, in contact with a community of over 400.000 fans. Contact with over 70.000 persons in all venues.

More info: vanstreetart@gmail.com

PT Qualquer tipo de doação tem um significado especial para o evento. Por isso, se quiseres dar o teu apoio, particular ou empresarial, vê em baixo o retorno que podes esperar:

PARTICULARES

1€ - Obrigado por acreditar!

25€ - Uma t-shirt “brandizada” do evento em cinzento, preto ou branco.

200€ - 3 prints oficiais do evento! Uma edição limitada de 100 unidades! Não é só um, mas sim os três!

500 € - Uma obra assinada dos artistas confirmados, Mister Dheo, Pariz One e Smile! Com uma edição limitada de 60 unidades, pode ser um print ou uma surpresa a escolher pelo artista!

1.000 € - Com uma edição limitada de 20 unidades, escolhe o artista que queres que personalize a tua mini carrinha de coleção. Mais os 3 prints oficiais do evento!

3.500 € - Não 1 mini carrinha, mas sim 6 mini carrinhas! Personalizadas e assinadas pelos 6 artistas! A isto junta-se a oportunidade de fazeres um Street Art Tour em Lisboa na carrinha principal do evento e teres os 3 prints oficiais do evento!

5.000 € - (Não residentes em Portugal) – Se gostavas de ver o evento de perto, é aqui que o podes fazer! Teremos uma viagem a Lisboa para ti, com estadia incluída durante 5 dias. Terás direito ao acompanhamento e à participação no evento. E ainda um workshop de graffiti, os 3 prints oficiais do evento e claro as 6 mini vans de coleção personalizadas e assinadas!

EMPRESAS

Damos a possibilidade a marcas que se queiram associar ao nosso evento a possibilidade de estarem presentes! De criarem a sua ativação de marca no espaço!

3.500 € - BRONZE VAN STREET ART – Tenda de 3x3 metros, assinalado a azul, para ativação da marca integrada no conceito. Presença da marca em todos os materiais de divulgação e promoção do evento. Associação a um projeto único, inovador e vanguardista, desde a sua primeira edição. Contacto com uma comunidade online superior a 400 mil pessoas.

6.000 € - SILVER VAN STREET ART + ROADSHOW – Tenda de 3x3 metros, assinalado a rosa, para ativação da marca integrada no conceito (main event). Espaço de 2x2 metros para ativação de marca (roadshow). Presença da marca em todos os materiais de divulgação e promoção do evento. Associação a um projeto único, inovador e vanguardista, desde a sua primeira edição. Contacto com uma comunidade online superior a 400 mil pessoas. Contacto direto com mais de 70 mil pessoas durante mais de 2 meses.

8000€ - GOLD  VAN STREET ART + ROADSHOW - Espaço central do evento, assinalado amarelo, para ativação da marca integrada no conceito (main event). Espaço de 2x2 metros para ativação de marca (roadshow). Presença da marca em todos os materiais de divulgação e promoção do evento. Associação a um projeto único, inovador e vanguardista, desde a sua primeira edição. Contacto com uma comunidade online superior a 400 mil pessoas. Contacto direto com mais de 70 mil pessoas durante mais de 2 meses.

Mais info: vanstreetart@gmail.com

Com este projeto quero deixar uma marca na cultura com o que sei fazer melhor e tentar que a Street Art chegue ao maior numero de pessoas possível!


PARTNERS


TIMELINE AND FUNDING DETAILS


e-mail vanstreetart@gmail.com
story_txt:
ABOUT ME
EN Hi, I’m Miguel Martins, a.k.a. Edis One, my artistic name. Since 2007
I’ve been working on street art. When I started on Graffiti I never thought I
could make a profession out of it, but today I have the chance to say that I
live from what I love to do.
Most of what I’ve done lately has been focused
on changing the perception people have about street art.
One of the projects that made me prouder
was MUDAR LISBOA, a project I launched where we wrapped public objects with cellophane.
We wanted to call peoples attention to our monuments and it had a great impact
both with media and public in general.
With graffiti I’ve had some great
experiences and some not so great, that made me grow as a person as well as an
artist, and from which I’ve learned that life’s short and we have to be true to
ourselves and fight for our goals.
PT Olá, o meu nome é Miguel Martins mas na minha profissão sou conhecido por Edis
One. Desde de 2007 que estou ligado ao mundo da street art e hoje posso dizer
que vivo daquilo que mais gosto!
Já criei vários projetos relacionados com
Street Art e a maior parte das minhas iniciativas têm o objetivo de ajudar a
credibilizar esta forma de arte em Portugal. 
Um dos projetos que criei com maior impacto
foi “A MUDAR LISBOA”, que passou por chamar a atenção dos habitantes da cidade
para objetos públicos, embrulhando-os com celofane. O projeto teve um enorme e
inesperado impacto quer ao nível da comunicação social quer das pessoas em
geral.
Com o graffiti já vivi várias experiencias e passei por diversos obstáculos
que me fizeram crescer bastante como pessoa e como artista. Aprendi que a vida
é curta e que temos que lutar e acreditar nas ideias que temos.
VAN STREET ART
EN Van Street Art is a consequence of this
attitude. It is mainly a great challenge. An Idea with great potential that I’d
love to see growing.
It all started on my visit to Art Basel,
world’s biggest street art event, in Miami, 2014. In this event I came across
with something I loved: a van that had an exposition in its interior.
I discussed this concept with some friends
and decided to create an event dedicated to Street Art. An event that aims to
be an international reference and highlight portuguese culture and its artists.
The objective of Van Street Art is to
reinvent the concept of a traditional art gallery, from a street concept to a
modern one, inside a van.The main event will take place in Lisbon,
during 2 days, in Parque das Nações. 6 vans will host 6 of the best street
artists expositions. The event will have live painting,
workshops, a DJ set and of course lots of street art.

The main artists will be:
MISTER DHEO, from Porto, has already two Guinness
Records and many works around the world.PARIZ ONE, from Lisboa, is one of the most
international portuguese artists. His work is spread all around the world. At
this moment he is involved in European projects of urban space requalification.SMILE, from Odivelas, on of the most
representative artists of híper realism, in Portugal. Smile has been always
focused on visibility to portuguese street art, although he has already several
works around Europe.The other three artists are still blocked. It will be a surprise!But Van Street Art is much more than a 2
days event. It wouldn’t make sense to have art inside a van and keep it parked.
So I thought of a roadshow where, during 4 months, we will showcase the
event  in Lisbon, in a first moment in
iconic city spots, and in a second moment in secondary schools, where we will also
demonstrate to kids why street art should be treated with care and respect.PT O VAN STREET ART é uma consequência desta atitude. É uma ideia, um desafio,
com enorme potencial que eu quero trabalhar para que um dia consiga ganhar
asas.
Surge de uma viagem que fiz a Miami em 2014, onde tive o prazer de estar na
Art Basel, considerado o maior evento de arte de todo o mundo. Nesta viagem
reparei em algo único, uma carrinha com uma exposição no seu interior. 
Em conversa com amigos resolvi criar um evento dedicado à Street Art. Um
evento que possa a vir a ser uma referencia a nível mundial, destacando
Portugal, a sua cultura e os seus artistas.
O objetivo do VAN SREET ART, é modernizar uma galeria tradicional, galeria
de rua, para uma galeria moderna, dentro de uma carrinha. 
Para isso iremos ter um main event, com a duração de 2 dias em Lisboa, no
Parque das Nações. 6 carrinhas vão receber uma exposição de 6 artistas de renome internacional.
Para além das exposições, podemos contar com pintura ao vivo, workshops,
música e muita arte!
Entre os artistas confirmados destacam-se:
MISTER DHEO, da cidade do Porto. Já conta com
dois records do Guiness e com muitas obras espalhadas por todo o mundo. 
PARIZ ONE, da cidade de Lisboa, foi dos
primeiros artistas portugueses a ter um seu nome em diversos países. As suas
obras estão espalhadas um pouco por todo o mundo. Está atualmente envolvido em
projetos Europeus de requalificação de espaços urbanos.
SMILE, da cidade de Odivelas. Um dos artistas
que faz híper realismo em Portugal. No seu percurso a nível de artista, tenta
sempre criar projetos para dar uma visibilidade à street art nacional. Conta
também com alguns trabalhos na Europa. 
Mas ter só este fim de semana dedicado à Street
Art, não fazia sentido e para isso criei o VAN STREET ART ROADSHOW onde após o main
event iremos circular durante 4 meses pela cidade de Lisboa mostrar o resumo do
nosso evento. Numa primeira fase em zonas centrais da cidade e numa segunda vamos
a escolas secundárias mostrar aos mais novos o que a Street Art tem de bom.
YOUR HELP

EN Gather support for Street Art events in
Portugal is not an easy task! We’ve already knocked on many doors but found
most of them closed. But as I said before, I believe in my work and specially
in the potential of this project.
With your help we will make Van Street Art a reality! But please don’t
look at it as an event like many others. Van Street Art is a window to street
art in general. A first step to take street art to the higher ground it already
deserves! 
PT Mas arranjar apoios para a criação de eventos relacionados com a Street Art em Portugal não é tarefa fácil! Batemos a
muitas portas e encontrámos a maioria fechadas mas acredito naquilo que faço e
acredito no poder que este projeto poderá ter a nível cultural.

Com a vossa ajuda vamos fazer do Van Street
Art uma realidade. Gostava que não vissem isto como um simples evento, mas como
um claro apoio a uma cultura que está a crescer cada vez mais. Um primeiro
passo para levar a Street Art ao lugar de destaque que já merece! 


PERKS

EN So what will it take? Any donation to make
this dream come alive is more then welcome!
So if you, as a person or company, want to be part of it, here’s what
you can expect in return:
PERSONAL DONATIONS1 € - Thanks for believing!25 € - A branded t-shirt. You can choose from several sizes and one of 3
colors: gray, black or white. Size: S, M, L, XL and XXL.200 € - 3 official prints of the event. A limited edition of 100 units.500 € - A art work from one of the artists present in the event. Limited
to 60 participants.1.000 € - A mini van painted by an artist of your choice. And the 3 official prints! Limited to 20
units.3.500 € - 6 mini vans, personalized by each of the 6 artists of the
event. You will also be invited to participated in one of the street art city
roadshow venues.5.000 € - (only to non residents in Portugal) – This is your opportunity
to live the event from the inside. Your donation includes a trip to Lisboa, B&B
for 5 days, and an opportunity to see and participate on the main event from
the inside. You will also have a private graffiti workshop, 3 official prints
and 6 personalized mini vans.

COMPANY DONATIONS
Bronze Sponsor – 3.500 €
Includes a 3x3 tent where you can activate your brand. Your sponsorship
will be communicated in all the events communication materials.
Your brand will be associated with a unique vanguardist event, in
contact with a community of over 400.000 fans.

Silver Sponsor – 6.000 €
Includes a 3x3 tent where you can activate
your brand in the main event and a 2x2 area to active your brand with the
roadshow. Your sponsorship will be communicated in all the events communication
materials.
Your brand will be associated with a unique
vanguardist event, in contact with a community of over 400.000 fans. Contact
with over 70.000 persons in all venues.
Gold Sponsor – 8.000 €
Central tent where you can activate your
brand in the main event and a 2x2 area to active your brand with the roadshow.
Your sponsorship will be communicated in all the events communication
materials.
Your brand will be associated with a unique
vanguardist event, in contact with a community of over 400.000 fans. Contact
with over 70.000 persons in all venues.More info: vanstreetart@gmail.com

PT Qualquer tipo de doação tem um significado especial para o evento. Por
isso, se quiseres dar o teu apoio, particular ou empresarial, vê em baixo o
retorno que podes esperar:
PARTICULARES
1€ - Obrigado por acreditar!
25€ - Uma t-shirt “brandizada” do evento em
cinzento, preto ou branco.
200€ - 3 prints oficiais do evento! Uma edição
limitada de 100 unidades! Não é só um, mas sim os três!
500 € - Uma obra assinada dos artistas
confirmados, Mister Dheo, Pariz One e Smile! Com uma edição limitada de 60
unidades, pode ser um print ou uma surpresa a escolher pelo artista!
1.000 € - Com
uma edição limitada de 20 unidades, escolhe o artista que queres que
personalize a tua mini carrinha de coleção. Mais os 3 prints oficiais do evento! 
3.500 € - Não 1 mini carrinha, mas sim 6 mini carrinhas!
Personalizadas e assinadas pelos 6 artistas! A isto
junta-se a oportunidade de fazeres um Street Art
Tour em Lisboa na carrinha principal do evento e teres os 3 prints oficiais do
evento!
5.000 € - (Não residentes em Portugal) – Se
gostavas de ver o evento de perto, é aqui que o podes fazer! Teremos uma viagem
a Lisboa para ti, com estadia incluída durante 5 dias. Terás direito ao
acompanhamento e à participação no evento. E ainda um workshop de graffiti, os
3 prints oficiais do evento e claro as 6 mini vans de coleção personalizadas e
assinadas!
EMPRESAS
Damos a possibilidade a marcas que se queiram
associar ao nosso evento a possibilidade de estarem presentes! De criarem a sua
ativação de marca no espaço! 
3.500 € - BRONZE VAN STREET ART – Tenda de 3x3
metros, assinalado a azul, para ativação da marca integrada no conceito.
Presença da marca em todos os materiais de divulgação e promoção do evento.
Associação a um projeto único, inovador e vanguardista, desde a sua primeira
edição. Contacto com uma comunidade online superior a 400 mil pessoas. 
6.000 € - SILVER VAN STREET ART + ROADSHOW –
Tenda de 3x3 metros, assinalado a rosa, para ativação da marca integrada no
conceito (main event). Espaço de 2x2 metros para ativação de marca (roadshow).
Presença da marca em todos os materiais de divulgação e promoção do evento.
Associação a um projeto único, inovador e vanguardista, desde a sua primeira
edição. Contacto com uma comunidade online superior a 400 mil pessoas. Contacto
direto com mais de 70 mil pessoas durante mais de 2 meses.
8000€ - GOLD 
VAN STREET ART + ROADSHOW - Espaço central do evento, assinalado
amarelo, para ativação da marca integrada no conceito (main event). Espaço de
2x2 metros para ativação de marca (roadshow). Presença da marca em todos os
materiais de divulgação e promoção do evento. Associação a um projeto único,
inovador e vanguardista, desde a sua primeira edição. Contacto com uma
comunidade online superior a 400 mil pessoas. Contacto direto com mais de 70
mil pessoas durante mais de 2 meses.Mais info: vanstreetart@gmail.com

Com este projeto quero deixar uma marca na cultura com o que sei fazer
melhor e tentar que a Street Art chegue ao maior numero de pessoas possível!PARTNERS

story:
A residency? In Finland? Tell us more.

Sara Goodman and Holly Chernobyl will live and work at Arteles Creative Center in rural Finland for 4 weeks. The theme of the residency is NEO FUTURE. We’ll create a series of short films entitled "Love Letters to Earth" revolving around the premise of a woman’s life reorganizing itself in the wake of moving to Mars. Humans failed Earth and are colonizing the red planet. As her body acclimates to the new planet, her thoughts and feelings split between the two celestial bodies. She writes love letters to the dead planet and experiments with her body as an extension of both planets. She engages in integration rituals and recalls rituals she’d done, or wishes she’d done, on Earth.

Arteles offers a unique, remote, creative environment in the Finnish countryside, far from city life. What better place to visually represent an idealized version of Earth?! I mean, LOOK AT THIS PLACE.

In our work together, there’s a clear thread of failure, surrender, collapse, celestial bodies, poetry, and resilience. Sara and Holly both studied poetry at the university level, and are attracted to Ecopoetry: poetry with a strong ecological emphasis or message, often confronting disaster, the difficulty of urban reality, and mapping patterns of micro systems (e.g. evolutionary biology) reflected in macro systems (e.g. innovation systems such as Google). All these points excite us! We are incredibly eager to begin work on Love Letters to Earth, as the project embodies the continuation, synthesis, and evolution of our previous work together.

This project is a milestone in our careers as artists--in scope, size, and structure. We’ve worked individually the past years to make connections, expand our networks, and gain international recognition as artists. We wish to join our resources to create this new work, and bring it back to our home of Chicago. The final result of the project will be a series of short films which we will show in Chicago and also be submitted to traveling film festivals around the world. Our previous films have been shown in Boston, Chicago, NYC, Portland, Seattle, Brazil, Berlin, London, and Quebec (watch below)!


Why this project matters (to more than just the artists)

This project aims to address the individual and collective concerns for the planet, as well as illustrate our emotional connection to those concerns. Many, many, people carry with them un-metabolized grief for our currently distressed planet. This project uses Butoh, a Japanese postmodern dance, dealing with themes of suffering, impermanence, and transformation and Glitch Aesthetic, a digital art revolving around themes of failure, error, and collapse. We hope this project will guide people towards confronting that grief and sitting with it, leading them more into the present moment, rather than looking to the future for hope.

We’re also interested in exploring queer narratives through Science Fiction/Butoh movement and highlighting intersections of queerness, feminism, and the “othering” of bodies. Queerness is a non-binary identity, existing in opposition to the framework of conventional norms. Our work together investigates the underworld, in-between spaces, and the reassembling of beauty through destruction. We hope our work speaks to queer folks, who so very often are left out of the conversation when talking about what comes next for humanity.


Breakdown of Funding

Camera (Canon EOS 70D DSLR Camera with 135 mm Lens)- $1500

Residency-$1583

2 Flights to Helsinki from Chicago-$1900

Cost of living in Finland for 4 weeks for 2 people-$800

The total cost of the residency comes in at well over our goal of $5k, but this is the minimum we need to create the work! Any additional funds will go to costuming, expanding the project, and compensating artists who participate.

OK, this project sounds great. What possible perks do I get for contributing?

  • postcard from Finland
  • sneak peek at footage-in-progress
  • snapchats of on-location shooting
  • secret tumblr access: will have writings and photos!!
  • signed DVD of our finished product
  • gross & exotic finnish candy. Finland is infamous throughout Europe as having the most weird and gross candy around, Salmiakki. It’s similar to licorice, but really in it’s own league. Here’s what one blogger had to say about Salmiak covered ice cream: It was a lot like those chocolate-covered icecream bars, except that it was covered in awful.

Truly, Salmiakki is a unique experience you really won’t want to miss out on!



Challenges & Struggles

The biggest risks and challenges are financial ones. As usual. If we do not get the grants we’ve written for, or meet our goal, we won’t be able to create the vision we have in mind.

I can’t contribute financially, but I still want to help!

There are other ways to help us besides hard cash money! Repost and spread the word about our indiegogo and project using these links:

  • https://www.instagram.com/sci_fi_mascara/

  • http://scifi-mascara.tumblr.com/

Follow us on our adventure and process via Instagram, Tumblr, and our personal Facebook pages.
