story:
*Updated - Please Note:

___________________________________________________________________

TO CONTRIBUTE AND RECEIVE A PERK REWARD:

  1. DO NOT use the CONTRIBUTE NOW button
  2. FIRST CLICK ON THE PERK REWARD you would like
  3. Enter your payment information.
  4. Enjoy Reward when you receive it! :)

TO CONTRIBUTE A DONATION TO MY CAMPAIGN:

  1. Enter your contribution amount in the text box, 
  2. Click the  CONTRIBUTE NOW button above 
  3. Enter your payment information.
  4. Receive my eternal thanks :)

If you have contributed a donation in error and would like to receive a perk reward instead, please contact me,  as shipping costs will need to be taken into account.

___________________________________________________________________


MY STORY: 

Ahoy! My name is Shameema Dharsey and I hail from sunny Cape Town, South Africa.

I’m 34, I have two cats, Fluffy and Wobbles, who I love dearly. I adore sushi, warm beverages, and all the colors of the rainbow. I’m a passionate artist and illustrator, earning my living by communicating ideas, telling stories with images, creating memorable characters and worlds and making people experience emotion through my art.

I’ve been freelancing now for four years, and while working from home has been tough, it has been very rewarding emotionally, albeit a bit difficult financially. Yet, I was still surviving. I could pay the rent, I could purchase food for my cats, I could very, very occasionally buy sushi and I could afford fuel to see my friends. However, the longer I worked, the more the expenses piled up and every year seemed tougher than the last. In my first year as a freelancer,  I was diagnosed with a chronic condition for which the medication prescribed is a pretty penny. The third year, my cat Heksie was tragically killed by a car and I truly learnt the meaning of loss. One might think ‘oh, it’s just a cat’, but she was my friend and companion and had carved out a home deep in my heart. That same year, seven hospital visits culminated in me being cut from heart to belly button, losing a kidney and being diagnosed with a bizarre and rare auto immune disease which I am still being treated for. I fought the good fight and with the support of my family still managed to eke out a living using my given (and much worked for) talent for creating unique artwork.

Over the past four years, my bread and butter has been doing illustration work for the textbook publishing industry. Every year I had a more or less steady supply of textbooks and readers to illustrate so I could afford to live and continue being an artist and illustrator.

Last year our local government education department decided to end textbook submissions for the next five years. No submissions = no work. No work = no money. No money = no Life.

I was determined to make my art career work for me,as I knew it was my passion and what I am destined to do in life. And then my brother struck upon the idea of doing an adult coloring book. The idea immediately resonated with me, and I decided to dedicate some of my time (when not looking for work), to illustrating something special and different - a book that would stand out from the norm.


ABOUT THE BOOK: 



Sham’s Flight of Fancy, contains my heart and soul. Not only do I see it as a means to earn money and survive, but I also see it as part of my Legacy. I don’t have kids. I don’t know what I can leave this world. So if I can leave a little something that makes the world a happier, sunnier place, I can rest easy. Therefore, I decided that each page would have a bit of wisdom, advice, inspiration or motivation that someone could color in, and paste on their wall, giving it their own color and mark of personality.

I chose animals because I’m rather fond of the natural world, and besides who doesn’t like pandas? I also noticed that other animal adult coloring books always portrayed animals in a terribly serious manner. I also  feel strongly that even though you may be an adult, it is important to keep a sense of humor and have fun with life.

Hedgehog - Tea Makes Everything Better

I made the book as quirky, fun, and warm as I could, and at the end of the day I believe it is some of the best work I have done, and by far the most enjoyable artwork to create. My hope is that after you have colored in these illustrations, you will end up feeling better than you did before you started.

Raccoon - Use Your Imagination

Technical info:

  • The book boasts 20 beautifully drawn and quirky illustrations.
  • Each coloring page measures 8.5 x 11 inches.
  • Every illustration is printed on a single side of paper to avoid bleeding.
  • The book has a lovely glossy durable cover to ensure longevity.
  • Interior pages are made up of 135 gsm Cartridge paper – thus much firmer and thicker than normal paper and perfect for coloring.
  • The book also comes with an special  'mess up color wheel' page - dedicated to testing out your utensils and color combinations.

All illustrations are designed to be satisfyingly complex, without being overwhelming and the subject matter lends itself to providing hours of soothing enjoyment.

It is suitable for adults as well as children.  Take a look at some sample images below:

Panda - Life Can Be Sweet

Snail - Take Time to Smell the Flowers


Otter - Take That Leap

Snake - Open Your Heart



Some of the other animals also included in this book are:

Caterpillar, Snail, Frog, Strange Bird, Owl , Mouse, Elephant, Lion, Octopus, Shark, Whale, Goldfish 


THE CAMPAIGN:  WHAT DO YOU GET?

This is my very first campaign, my very first adult coloring book and I would love to print at least 50 copies of this book. Your contribution will help me achieve this and help cover many costs that I have incurred to create it.

I have mapped out quite a large list of perks to say thank you for your contribution - see the perks list for more info. 

Please also take note of the following steps to receive perks or to instead donate:


The book is for the most part complete and will be ready for shipping by mid May 2016. 

Shipping takes approximately 1 week within South Africa, and approximately 3 weeks to the Rest of the World. 

Shipping costs are calculated on choosing the perk to contribute.

All contributions go towards the cost of printing, packaging and tracked postage  of this book.


OTHER WAYS TO HELP

I am sure many of you may want to contribute, but cannot at this time. 

However, you can help get the word out and share this campaign with as many of your friends as possible who may be interested in these perks or book. Share it on Facebook, Tweet to your fellow coloring book enthusiasts, or post it in your hobby groups. Every share is highly appreciated.

Love to all of you who are able to contribute to this campaign in some form, you have my thanks.
story_txt:
*Updated - Please Note:
___________________________________________________________________

TO CONTRIBUTE AND RECEIVE A PERK REWARD:




DO NOT use the CONTRIBUTE NOW button

FIRST CLICK ON THE PERK REWARD you would like
Enter your payment information.
Enjoy Reward when you receive it! :)


TO CONTRIBUTE A DONATION TO MY CAMPAIGN:



Enter your contribution amount in the text box, 
Click the  CONTRIBUTE NOW button above 
Enter your payment information.
Receive my eternal thanks :)


If you have contributed a donation in error and would like to receive a perk reward instead, please contact me,  as shipping costs will need to be taken into account.
___________________________________________________________________


MY STORY:  





Ahoy!
My name is Shameema Dharsey and I hail from sunny Cape Town, South Africa.
I’m 34, I
have two cats, Fluffy and Wobbles, who I love dearly. I adore sushi, warm
beverages, and all the colors of the rainbow. I’m a passionate artist and
illustrator, earning my living by communicating ideas, telling stories with
images, creating memorable characters and worlds and making people
experience emotion through my art.
I’ve been
freelancing now for four years, and while working from home has been tough, it
has been very rewarding emotionally, albeit a bit difficult financially. Yet, I
was still surviving. I could pay the rent, I could purchase food for my cats, I
could very, very occasionally buy sushi and I could afford fuel to see my
friends. However, the longer I worked, the more the expenses piled up and every
year seemed tougher than the last. In my first year as a freelancer,  I was diagnosed with a
chronic condition for which the medication prescribed is a pretty penny. The third year,
my cat Heksie was tragically killed by a car and I truly learnt the meaning of
loss. One might think ‘oh, it’s just a cat’, but she was my friend and
companion and had carved out a home deep in my heart. That same year, seven hospital
visits culminated in me being cut from heart to belly button, losing a kidney
and being diagnosed with a bizarre and rare auto immune disease which I am still being
treated for. I fought the good fight and with the support
of my family still managed to eke out a living using my given (and much worked
for) talent for creating unique artwork. 
Over the past
four years, my bread and butter has been doing illustration work for the textbook publishing industry.
Every year I had a more or less steady supply of textbooks and readers to illustrate
so I could afford to live and continue being an artist and illustrator.
Last year our
local government education department decided to end textbook submissions for the next
five years. No submissions = no work. No work = no money. No money = no Life.
I was
determined to make my art career work for me,as I knew it was my passion and what I am destined to do in life. And then my brother struck upon the idea of doing an adult coloring book. The idea immediately resonated with me, and I decided to dedicate some of my time (when not looking for work), to illustrating something special and different - a book that would stand out from the norm.



ABOUT THE
BOOK: 



Sham’s
Flight of Fancy, contains my heart and soul. Not only do I see it as a means to
earn money and survive, but I also see it as part of my Legacy. I don’t have
kids. I don’t know what I can leave this world. So if I can leave a little
something that makes the world a happier, sunnier place, I can rest easy.
Therefore, I decided that each page would have a bit of wisdom, advice,
inspiration or motivation that someone could color in, and paste on their wall,
giving it their own color and mark of personality.

I chose
animals because I’m rather fond of the natural world, and besides who doesn’t
like pandas? I also noticed that other animal adult coloring books always
portrayed animals in a terribly serious manner. I also  feel strongly that even though you may be an adult, it is important to keep a sense
of humor and have fun with life.
Hedgehog - Tea Makes Everything Better
I made the
book as quirky, fun, and warm as I could, and at the end of the day I believe
it is some of the best work I have done, and by far the most enjoyable artwork to
create. My hope is that after you have colored in these illustrations, you will
end up feeling better than you did before you started.

Raccoon - Use Your Imagination


Technical info:
The book boasts 20 beautifully drawn and quirky illustrations.
Each coloring page measures 8.5 x 11 inches.
Every illustration is printed on a single side of paper to avoid bleeding.
The book has a lovely glossy durable cover to ensure longevity.
Interior pages are made up of 135 gsm Cartridge paper – thus much firmer and thicker than normal paper and perfect for coloring.
The book also comes with an special  'mess up color wheel' page - dedicated to testing out your utensils and color combinations.

All illustrations are designed to be satisfyingly complex, without being overwhelming
and the subject matter lends itself to providing hours of soothing enjoyment.It is suitable for adults as well as children.  Take a look at some sample images below:
Panda - Life Can Be Sweet

Snail - Take Time to Smell the Flowers


Otter - Take That Leap


Snake - Open Your Heart





Some of the other animals also included in this book are:
Caterpillar, Snail, Frog, Strange Bird, Owl , Mouse, Elephant, Lion, Octopus, Shark, Whale, Goldfish 

THE CAMPAIGN:  WHAT DO YOU GET?


This is my very first campaign, my very first adult coloring book and I would love to print at least 50 copies of this book. Your contribution will help me achieve this and help cover many costs that I have incurred to create it.


I have mapped out quite a large list of perks to say thank you for your contribution - see the perks list for more info. 

Please also take note of the following steps to receive perks or to instead donate:


The book is for the most part complete and will be ready for shipping by mid May 2016. 


Shipping takes approximately 1 week within South Africa, and approximately 3 weeks to the Rest of the World. 


Shipping costs are calculated on choosing the perk to contribute.

All contributions go towards the cost of printing, packaging and tracked postage  of this book.


OTHER WAYS TO HELP

 
I am sure
many of you may want to contribute, but cannot at this time. 
However,
you can help get the word out and share this campaign with as many of your
friends as possible who may be interested in these perks or book. Share it on Facebook, Tweet to your fellow coloring book enthusiasts, or post it in your hobby groups. Every share is highly appreciated.
Love to
all of you who are able to contribute to this campaign in some form, you have
my thanks.

story:
“Hope dolls” Sculpey Light Clay 2014

My name is Mary Annabel Tan and I am an artist.  It took a long time for me to embrace my gifts.

During my youth, I loved creating things and when someone was hurt, I would make things for them to cheer them up.  When people asked me what I wanted to be when I grow up, I would always say “I want to be an artist!” and guess what their response would be?  “Artists don’t make any money,” and I believed them for a very long time.  Further on, I become a single mother and went through several vocations that were neither emotionally fulfilling nor financially sustainable. 

Now, I have finally realised that art can bring healing and hope into our society.  Living without art is like living without colours or love.  It was a wakeup call for me as well as a calling which I have suppressed for a good 10 years. Now is the time for me to act and let it flourish. I am using my gift to bring smiles to the world and I believe everything will become brighter when we can smile at any given moment.

Many things have happened in my life and I have gone from hope to fear, joy to sadness, longing and disappointment, anger and bliss, love and hate….  And I have learn to choose what my heart desires over choosing short term gains. The thoughts and whispers are like falling in love all over again, creating butterflies in my stomach and looking at life through rose tinted glasses. 

I now embrace my art as my true calling and I am going to inspire others to create through my creations.


When I started creating my “Hope Dolls” back in 2014, I had a vision of creating large scale figures that can sit in the midst of a garden.  My hope as an aspiring artist was to have my own exhibition in 2016! 

With my passion, love and soulful creation, I will revamp my website, explore and explore new online art markets like Artsy and participate in local Art Markets like The Local People. Hopefully, I can go to various part of the world to showcase my creations.

Part of my growth as a professional artist and entrepreneur includes applications for research grants, residencies and fellowships to further my education and broaden my experiences.

I have been teaching both adults and children in public events and small groups.  My future plan is to conduct larger classes for schools and corporate. This will includes having my own studio and having a team of aspiring artists with me to teach and mentor others along the way.  I am looking at contributing back to the communities by creating large installations to raise funds annually for charities.

My long terms goal is to be able to travel and create large installations for various communities around the world.

“Talk to me, I am listening”
Trying out the various position to bring our different emotions of my Art.


I have been creating all my smaller figurines using Polymer Clay.  I have also been experimenting using Terracotta, Raku and also air dry clay to create larger figures. The result are not ideal.  I have heard many good things about ceramics and was thinking of studying in NAFA and last month I found a retreat being offered by an Artist teaching us how to make large figurative sculptures using ceramics. And it was like “Yes, this is what I’ve been searching for!”  This is why I set up this campaign to rise funds so that I can go to Ubud for 2 to 3 weeks and learn from him.  This retreat will make my dream come true both in creating large figurative sculptures and also improving my skill as an artist.

I am truly grateful and appreciative of your support in this journey to live out my dream, fulfilling my potential and contributing to make our world a happier place.


Thank you for looking at my perks. I have listed many perks here for you to contribute in any way you can!  All perks comes with an original piece of my creation and I hope it will bring a smile to your face.  

“Droplets - Hello world!”

All gifters will be acknowledged in my website and later in my 1st exhibition’s brochure.

When I reach my goal of US$6,000, all gifters will receive email updates of my work in progress during the retreat.

Most perks will be delivered between March to May 2016.  For perks which comes with my original Artwork during the retreat will be delivered between April to May 2016.

All perks will comes with a step by step tutorial writeup for creating your own droplets.

If for any reason you are unable to contribute financially, I would also appreciate any shares on social media, twitter, email or word of mouth.  Do tell you friends, followers or if you know of anyone who will love my perks. Help me to spread my work.


When I hit and exceed the USD6,000 mark, all the money will be used to fund my retreat to Ubud.  If not, the money will be used to fund my local 1 year Certification in Ceramic Course with NAFA and part of it will be invested in revamping my website and also to explore and expand new online art markets like Artsy and participate in local Art Markets like The Local People.


  • In Singapore, we have very limited art suppliers to buy our materials.  In case of an overwhelming demand on this project, I might face a problem of not being able to buy the materials locally which will result in a delay in shipping and I would seek your understanding. All updates will be communicated through either email or Facebook. Let’s keep our fingers crossed that nothing bad happens J
  • In case of natural disasters, like if Singapore were to sink (like Atlantis??)  Then it might takes 2 to 3 years for me to fulfil your order.

story:
In 2014, having recently graduated, May Parsey and Giovanni Cardenas were suffering from art school withdrawals. The collaborative, communal environment which had fostered their creative development was no longer at their finger tips and something needed to change. With that JUST ADD WATER was born. 

  • JUST ADD WATER is founded in the idea of creating a completely fluid, collaborative, and cyclical experience for the viewer. Each artist creates one piece under one thematic umbrella. In doing so, the artists collaborate with each other to ensure a cohesive and continuous flow from one to piece to another.  
  • It's no secret, being young, creative, and in the city is difficult. Each of these shows is a way to encourage each other to keep up with prolific creation, while also developing a community that supports one another as we further establish ourselves.
  • Our first show was a whirling success, with amazing foot traffic, art purchases, and memories that we still hear about more than a year later. We HAD to put on another show to keep the excitement going and prove it that we'll never stop out-doing ourselves to amaze a crowd with something they have never seen before.  

Bigger is definitely better... but also more expensive. 

  • This time around we searched far and wide, all through the vast land of Manhattan. Acknowledging that moving across the river is slightly more costly. We wanted an area that holds high foot traffic and is amongst an abundance of other galleries.  
  • Additionally we are improving all of our marketing material, with the help of great graphic designers and an amazing video team.
  • Making all of these additional assets fully come to life (in printed invitations, promo posters, flyers, videos, etc.) we need to raise money to cover any and all production costs.

The Artists Behind Homonym

Sam Cannon

Steven Harwick

Rose Wong

Thomas Colligan

James Kwan

Charlie Hawks

Hannah Perry

Simon Ban

Aarati Akkapeddi 

Nina Simoneaux

Kelly Duff

Olivia Michaels

Tess Silverman

Kate Conway

May Parsey

What will $4,000 do for J.A.W. Collective? How will it benefit YOU? 

  • What are the costs you ask?
  • $1,300 for a gallery space in Manhattan for 5 days (one day of installation and another for deinstallation.)
  • $2,000 for marketing materials (show Magazine/poster, invitations, promotional flyers etc.)
  • $1,000 Misc Cost (show set up/take down, travel costs, reception materials, etc.)
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Although our goal is to raise $4,000, any amount will greatly help us offset what we have saved in our shiny piggy banks at home. REALLY, ANYTHING HELPS :) And we're excited by the chance to involve you and have you help us put this unique show together! Every penny counts! 

Can't Donate? SHARE! SHARE LIKE CRAZY!!!!

  • We appreciate you taking the time to read through this and hopefully gaining some insight into the great talent and incredible content we are trying to share with the world. We understand that not everyone can donate at this time, but we would definitely appreciate you putting the word out to any art aficionados interested in becoming patrons of the arts! <-- (so fancy)

*ALL DONORS WITH A DONATION OF 100$ Value or more, will be acknowledged during the show, and in any print and website assets.

Thanks again!

-May & Gio
story_txt:
In 2014, having recently graduated, May Parsey and Giovanni Cardenas were suffering from art school withdrawals. The collaborative, communal environment which had fostered their creative development was no longer at their finger tips and something needed to change. With that JUST ADD WATER was born. 

JUST ADD WATER is founded in the idea of creating a completely fluid, collaborative, and cyclical experience for the viewer. Each artist creates one piece under one thematic umbrella. In doing so, the artists collaborate with each other to ensure a cohesive and continuous flow from one to piece to another.  
It's no secret, being young, creative, and in the city is difficult. Each of these shows is a way to encourage each other to keep up with prolific creation, while also developing a community that supports one another as we further establish ourselves.
Our first show was a whirling success, with amazing foot traffic, art purchases, and memories that we still hear about more than a year later. We HAD to put on another show to keep the excitement going and prove it that we'll never stop out-doing ourselves to amaze a crowd with something they have never seen before.  

Bigger is definitely better... but also more expensive. 

This time around we searched far and wide, all through the vast land of Manhattan. Acknowledging that moving across the river is slightly more costly. We wanted an area that holds high foot traffic and is amongst an abundance of other galleries.  
Additionally we are improving all of our marketing material, with the help of great graphic designers and an amazing video team.
Making all of these additional assets fully come to life (in printed invitations, promo posters, flyers, videos, etc.) we need to raise money to cover any and all production costs.

The Artists Behind Homonym
Sam Cannon
Steven Harwick
Rose Wong
Thomas Colligan
James Kwan
Charlie Hawks
Hannah Perry

Aarati Akkapeddi

What are the costs you ask?
$1,300 for a gallery space in Manhattan for 5 days (one day of installation and another for deinstallation.)
$2,000 for marketing materials (show Magazine/poster, invitations, promotional flyers etc.)
$1,000 Misc Cost (show set up/take down, travel costs, reception materials, etc.)
Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
Although our goal is to raise $4,000, any amount will greatly help us offset what we have saved in our shiny piggy banks at home. REALLY, ANYTHING HELPS :) And we're excited by the chance to involve you and have you help us put this unique show together! Every penny counts!

Thanks again!
-May & Gio
